review.title: Sex, Drugs and Rock and Roll
review.reviewText:
Picture you and your wife getting away for a weekend in San Fran. No kids, peace and quiet. A hotel centrally located in the city. Bliss!

Now add in the person in the room next to you. Smoking weed so heavily that there is a cloud coming under your shared door into your room. You get a proximity high from it. Awesome right?!

Now how about loud music and rough, awful sex coming from that same room into the wee hours of the morning. Even better right?! After sex, she orders a pay per view movie and blasts it at full volume, passing out around 2 am from her evening activities, but TV is still blaring. Blissful. 

Two phone calls to the front desk got the typical, "Sure, we'll look into it" and then no response after that. Blissful.

I even gave the manager an opportunity to refund a night's stay to make up for the nonsense and he responds with "How about I write off your 2 drinks you had at our hotel bar". What a joke. 

Now a little about me- I'm a 32 year old who stays out late, parties with his wife and friends-- I'm the last person who would complain about something, but this was absolutely atrocious. And with the response they gave me, it was clear they don't really care to change anything about that type of activity in their hotel. Certainly their perogative, but I'll surely never return to there or any of their other locations, and will do everything in my power to make sure no one else I know does either. 

Respectfully yours (not this hotels), 

Don

review.title: Very good location-just OK room
review.reviewText: As much as I loved the location, bar & lobby area, I found the room accommodations lacking. Maybe I am old fashioned-I actually like a dresser to put my clothes into instead of plastic bins in the closet. The room was good sized w/ a large desk, with a phone that could only be used on speaker. If you tried to switch it off of the speaker option it disconnected your call. The phone by my bed wouldn't give me a dial tone. The bathroom, though nicely tiled, had no counter space & no drawers to put toiletries & make up. My daughter was staying w/ me, so doubly challenging. The shower head for the shower was loose, you couldn't adjust it past the one direction it was hanging & when shutting off the hot water faucet after your shower, it almost burned your hand. I liked the fact that you could opt out of room service for a $15 credit in the bar or restaurant for each day you are there. This is offered if you stayed 2 or more days. Opt in! My biggest annoyance, though, was the $25 per day facility fee that was tacked on when I checked out!  Upon check-in I was given a small card outlining what I thought was an option for Wi-Fi, exercise room etc. To be fair, I didn't inquire further & decided that I would use my own hub for wi-fi, if needed. I became aware of it on checkout. When I questioned it, I was told some hotels were now charging this add on fee. When questioned further the receptionist admitted she was referring to her chain of hotels. Beware when booking-room price plus $25

review.title: generally good
review.reviewText: Stayed for over a week. Great front of house and restaurant/bar staff, but they spent a lot of time daily apologizing for the management decision of not having any ice available without going thru room service. Room service always took multiple calls, from us and the desk staff, to actually bring ice, and even then sometimes we gave up after an hour or so. Also, ice arrives in an open container so that it melts right away. The mini bar is very packed (could be a good thing if you want to buy a lot from there) but leaves no room for any personal use (as diabetics we needed a place to keep insulin which required about 4 cubic inches of space and that meant putting the insulin in odd positions on top of drinks---yes, it was THAT crowded...); forget about using it for your own drinks or food.

review.title: Stylish Hotel Experience Near Union Square
review.reviewText: Clift is a stylish, contemporary, hotel in a great location. Comparable to the Bryant Park Hotel in Manhattan. Well trained and capable staff. Medium-large, clean guest rooms. Well-performing, free in-room WiFi or direct Ethernet connection. Free premium coffee in the lobby each morning until 10. Lovely breakfast buffet, a tad overpriced. Pleasing menu and cuisine available in the lobby restaurant or for in-room dining. The elegant-yet-hip Redwood Room, featuring outstanding cocktails and service, vibes with youthful, adult energy--especially on Friday and Saturday evenings. Bypass the hotel valet and park at one of the two garages that are just steps away on Taylor Street between Geary and O'Farrell. Both garages offer in-out privileges and valet service 24/7.

review.title: Great Location, Great Staff but it ends there...
review.reviewText: The Clift truly has a great location and exceptional hotel staff. The hotel lobby does retain a lot of its old world charm and represents today's boutique hotel environment. However, that's where all the good stuff ends. When we first walked into our room, we were greeted by a strange smoky and old musty odor. It inhabited the small hallway between the front door and main living space. We immediately called the front desk and told them. As there were no other rooms available at the time, they offered to clean the carpet as we decided to go out for a stroll around Union Square. When we returned, the smell was replaced by something more pleasant but the odor returned after a few hours. We decided to just avoid that space since we only needed to pass it when entering or exiting the room. A lot of the room fixtures are in disrepair and the bathroom was oddly shaky as well. Cleanliness was not a strongpoint as dirt was visibly accumulated on the door hinges and when I went to rest for the evening and looked at the ceiling, there was a huge clump of dust around one of the ceiling fixture covers. I just prayed that it would not fall on my while I slept.

review.title: Wonderful service, good location, but loud.
review.reviewText:
I stayed here for 3 nights and thought the service was great. Everyone from the front desk, to valet, to room service was really nice.

Room was a good size, and felt clean enough. 
Food was just okay, but not as over priced as some other hotels. Although I probably would have been willing to pay more for better quality/taste.

My main complaint is just about the noise. You can hear everything that goes on outside your room, from people walking down the halls to the cars driving down the street. Even if they're not being loud or the cars aren't honking, you feel like your door and window are open. It's kind of hard to get a good nights rest. Also heard others complaining about partiers while checking out.
review.negativeRemarks: The noise issue. Better food.
review.locationRemarks: Lots of food and shopping, museums and galleries. Nothing is more than about a $10 uber ride away.

review.title: Definitely Disappointed
review.reviewText:
First Impression: 
The room was ok. It was a bit dated. It had an iphone or ipod player that was for the iphone 4 which it quite old. It also did not have a modern feel as the photos showed online. The restrooms were tiny and VERY outdated. I booked this room for my parents to stay in while they visited me here in SF and it was disappointing. 

First night:
There was  a party next door. My mother recorded the entire thing. The loud was so noisy next door that my parents got no sleep at all. The party started at 1am and did not end until 4:30am. Security was called TWICE and they continued. The next night they offered my parents free breakfast....really? They should have moved them immediately. My parents are 60 years old and I felt bad that they did not get any rest after sight seeing all day. 

Night Two:
It was quiet and there was no noise thank GOD

Overall I would NEVER stay here nor would I book this for hotel for family and friends in town.

review.title: Wonderful Hotel. Hard to Find
review.reviewText:
We don't go to San Francisco very often. Finding our hotel has been the number one thing to cause anxiety every time we go. This hotel is not marked well on the outside, just a small gold plaque that says the Clift on the wall in between 2 sets of huge glass doors. We drove around the block twice to find it. Then there was no way to park to check in, except to double park. We had to jump out in traffic and hand over the keys parked half in a traffic lane. 
 
Getting our car back after check out was a little frustrating. They told us 15 to 20 minutes, and we kept checking out front to see if the car was there. There were empty parking spaces in front, no cars, so we kept waiting. Fourty-five minutes later, I actually asked about our car, and it was parked halfway down the block, not within site of the front of the Clift, and probably had been for a while. Would have been nice if the valet service announced that "guest" car is available
. 
The hotel itself is beautiful. All the staff was polite and helpful. The room was clean and pretty. It had a room service/honor bar style fridge that was too warm, but we managed to squeak in our own snacks, and get ice from room service to replenish our cooler.  No in room coffee pot or microwave. The room service food was delicious, the servers were very nice. I am never quite prepared for the cost of such things, but at least the food and people didn't make me regret the luxury.
review.positiveRemarks: I like the staff. The bedding was very nice and the shower was Powerful. When I turned on the water, it nearly pushed me back a foot- I'm not small.
review.negativeRemarks: They could find a classy way to mark the hotel to make it visible to newbies driving in a strange city.
review.locationRemarks: The location was super busy. I don't know about anything nearby. We used Uber to get to a concert at the Mezzanine.

review.title: The Clift delivers!
review.reviewText: We had a great stay at the Clift!  We went to see Crossfire at Biscuits and Blues, which was almost directly across the street.  The staff at the Hotel were great, the room was clean, spacious and very comfortable!  The lobby ambiance was great - warm and inviting.  The only feedback I would have is parking could have been a little more clearly marked, that was a bit confusing, but we just parked in a garage across the street, so it was fine (just a little more expensive).  My husband and I have wanted to do a get-a-way to the city for some time, but were always nervous about finding a nice hotel - and I think we've found it! (Internet pics of hotels can be manipulated, but the Clift delivers exactly what is shown on the website!)  We will definitely be back!

review.title: Trying to hard to be cool.
review.reviewText:
Pros -- clean, comfortable room.  Very quiet even though on a busy street.  Outstanding staff and service.

Cons -- this is a venerable old SF hotel that did a make over to be "cool."  in our view it did not work.  The lobby, common areas and elevators are all too dark. The room, while comfortable, had plastic cubes as bedside tables and a table as the desk. There was not a pen or piece of paper in the room, and the bathroom was tiny and way too dark.

review.title: better alternatives for the price
review.reviewText:
With all the options to choose from in downtown, I would recommend elsewhere.
Our room had a large coffee/something spatter stain on the TV,drape wall. The hotel has no ice machines near guest rooms (staff told us they are too noisy) so you have to call room service for ice........which would be OK if you could get them, but their line was busy any time we called during our entire 4 day stay...we tried two separate times and the line was busy for an hour straight both times.  We also couldn't call front desk from our room. Twice we got someone who didn't seem to understand what we were saying. (couldn't understand english well enough) and the third time we were told that they couldn't help us because they were all asleep!  We thought we must have had a phone problem that was connecting us to the wrong places.....so we checked in person at the front desk and they couldn't find a problem.
It's a shame because overall the hotel is nice, and seems well maintained. Even though trying to make a historic old hotel look "modern" fails in some respects, it was still overall esthetically nice. The bellmen were always very attentive and helpful. Only problem is that there are so many other nice places in downtown san-fran that it's just better to look elsewhere.

review.title: Great lobby, great/small bar, lousy room.
review.reviewText:
Firstly, stay away from 'deluxe' room 1705 at all costs - it's adjacent to the elevator engineering room and the gears could be heard ALL NIGHT.  And yes - that was the 'deluxe' room which was more expensive!  To their defense, the staff (very helpful and professional) tried to move me to another room (even before I checked-in which now makes sense!) but they couldn't.  They comped my dinner/drinks when I commented about it at checkout but for $850/3nights I really expected more.

Also, I travel 50-70% of the year and frequent hotels from 2-stars to 5-stars and this place falls into a category of bait and switch.  The lobby was beautiful, the bar (small) is well-appointed and stylish, and great/professional staff (5 stars), but all the investment was done on the first floor leaving the rooms feeling like a mod version of La Quinta.  And if I was renting the lobby and bar I'd be happy but I definitely felt disappointed.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff, the concierge, the doorman.
review.negativeRemarks: Attention to detail starting at the second floor up to the 17th - which by the way - the elevator only goes to the 16th.
review.locationRemarks: Great location but there are no shortage of hotels in this area.

review.title: Great location.  Wonderful rooms
review.reviewText: A wonderful Mother's Day weekend in the city.  The hotel was in the perfect location for a special girl's weekend away.  A short cab ride to Golden gate park and a visit to the Japanese garden and the de Young Museum.  The visiting exhibit from Scotland is a must to see!   Dinner enjoying the chef's tasting menu with wine pairing at the delightful AQ restaurant....delicious... (Give yourself plenty of time....they recommend 2.5 hours for the tasting menu).  Then off to the Orpheum Theatre to laugh and enjoy The Book of Mormon.   All within walking distance to the hotel.  Sunday brunch the next morning across the street at Colibri.  The food was fantastic!  Not enough time to really do serious shopping and catch the flight home.....it left us longing for more time to enjoy and explore.   The hotel was the perfect place to collapse at the end of the day!

review.title: A Wonderful Retreat!
review.reviewText: We requested and we were very pleasantly given a complimentary upgrade from a deluxe king to a studio suite.  The king bed was in a cozy sleeping alcove and the living room had a large window with a sunny view of Nob Hill.  We had early check-in to unpack and then went to a theatre matinee.  Returning to the hotel, we had a cocktail in the historic Redwood Room.  Our room was so inviting and comfortable, we used room service for dinner and breakfast the next morning.  We wanted a relaxing escape and the Clift proved to be perfect.

We do respect the need for relaxation in our guest rooms and will send Managers to assist with any noise issues from other patrons that may be having too much fun.

review.title: If you LOVE noise, this place is perfect
review.reviewText:
We came for Valentine's weekend, which granted I guess is an actual holiday, but our hotel was a non stop New Year's party. 
The hotel staff that we interacted with were all friendly, the style of the hotel is nice, and our room was spacious and comfortable. We were all set for a great weekend. Friday night came and we tucked in around midnight, only to find out at 2am that our walls were basically made of paper, and we got to hear word for word the couples argument going on in the room next to us. Saturday night the hotel lobby turns into a scene of people with cocktails milling around, to the point that we had to show our room key 3 times just to prove we were guests and get to the elevator. There were groups gathered in the hallway, noise & chatter until the early hours of the morning. 
All in all, the hotel was beautiful and our room spacious, but we couldn't get a wink of sleep. For that reason, I would not return.
review.negativeRemarks: Better sound proofing, less club atmosphere in lobby
review.locationRemarks: close to food and shopping

managementResponses.response: You can't wait to revisit and we can't wait to welcome you back!! Thank you for your wonderful comments and I am so happy that your experience was a memorable one.

review.title: Swanky & Posh Boutique Hotel
review.reviewText: From the moment we checked in and had our car valet it was such a great experience. The room was so beautiful and we had an amazing city view room on the top 16th floor. The redroom bar was so elegant and the alcohol prices were perfect and the bartenders were great and quick and made the drinks perfect! Highly recommend staying here! Can't wait to revisit The Clift again!!!

review.title: End of my Stay:
review.reviewText:
I had an excellent time at the Clift!
Great posh hotel in the middle of San Francisco --- the lighting was dramatic & theatrical, just the right tone for relaxed seduction & power exchange.  The staff was great!
Except when I was leaving...  My bellboy Edgar was ok, till he got distracted by my Ampao Chinese New Year envelope w/ his tip after he placed my bag in my BFs vehicle.  He did not close his trunk & I ended up reaching high for it & finishing his job--- after I tipped him too.  That's the only reason I can't find it in me to place an EXCELLENT review on the staff category.  He seemed very young & has much to learn in the hospitality industry.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for your constructive feedback. We are always looking for ways to improve our product and are continually working on projects to keep our hotel looking fresh and comfortable for our guests.

managementResponses.response: I am terribly sorry that you did not enjoy your stay. We are a historical building with unique room features and layouts. If ever a guest is unhappy with their accommodation, we are happy to find an alternative room that will better fit their needs. I understand your frustration with your departure and I assure you this is not they typical level of service we strive to provide. I will absolutely share your comments with my staff and ensure that this experience is used to help coach and develop our staff to the high level of service standards we are typically known for providing.

review.title: Disappointingly expensive
review.reviewText: I read some reviews that were not complimentary but I thought it looked nice (and the lobby IS impressive).  The hotel is difficult to get to; very expensive to park your car at overnight (thank goodness there are a lot of parking garages nearby that are cheaper!); the front desk will ask you if you want a location that is quieter - beware - I don't think there is a location that is noise restricted; there are no  coffee makers in the room - odd these days, the closet to hang your clothes is right when you walk in the door - then there is a hallway - then the bedroom area; the bathrooms and makeup areas are not woman friendly at all - not like most; the walls are paper thin - actually, the room next door was our entertainment for the evening; for two nights (Friday and Saturday), it cost nearly $500 and we barely could sleep because of the noise!  When leaving, the front desk didn't bother to ask us how we enjoyed our stay, good morning, good bye, nice having you stay, nothing...it was like we weren't even standing in front of them.  I will never go back to someplace that treats someone as though they can't even see you.
review.positiveRemarks: Hmm .... I can only assume the bar area was good .... you couldn't get near it for hours on Saturday evening.
review.negativeRemarks: How about treating your customers like they either make or break the establishment.
review.locationRemarks: Lots of places to go to, shopping, art galleries galore, restaurants abound.

managementResponses.response: I am sorry that your experience in the bar fell short of your expectations but I am happy to see that the staff in the Hotel were able to make a positive impression.

review.title: Not like it used to be
review.reviewText: Great location near Union Square.  I preferred the Clift when it had its old world charm, seen now only in the bar area.  The staff were very helpful but the concierge didn't even have a decent sized map of the city.  There was no information about what to do in the city in the room.  Some bathroom tiles were chipped as were the door frames and the paint on one wall in the bedroom.  The decor of the bedroom was mostly elegant but ruined by the orange acrylic nightstands and inside legs of the desk and desk chair.  I'd give this 3-1/2 stars.  Touch up paint, fix the tiles and get rid of the orange and I'd give it 4 stars.

On a negative note there beggars on the side walk but I think the hotel can not do anything about it, but request more police presence

review.title: Hip Property, Great Location, Very Friendly Staff
review.reviewText: Very hip and fashionable property, without being obnoxious, which is where other properties get it wrong.  The Clift has just the right balance.  Rooms were surprisingly spacious, clean contemporary, and comfortable and practical in all aspects.  Bathroom was definitely small, but still did the job and had a full bath, for those that like that feature, and very nice bathroom products as well.  Trendy bar and restaurant brings in the crowds and lines at the front door, but guests have no issues with access, and security is a well-oiled and friendly machine that keeps everything smooth.  There's also no noise issue in the guest rooms from the lively crowd in the bar and restaurant.  Speaking of friendly, this hotel has amongst the friendliest staff I have ever encountered, and especially at the Bell Desk...Bell Desk staff are frequently the first and last encounter with a hotel, and the staff at the Clift's Bell Desk are simply the best...better than I've encountered at hotels that I've paid many times more money to stay at.  Finally, great location, in the heart of San Francisco, and just a few blocks from the Union Square area.
review.positiveRemarks: Pretty much everything!  But my favorite was the staff, followed by accommodation, location and value.
review.negativeRemarks: The bathroom was small, but can't do anything about that.  No issues or areas that need improvement.
review.locationRemarks: Heart of the Union Square, with shopping, bars and restaurants.  Metro (called MUNI and BART) and cable cars get you everywhere else you want to go.

review.title: Outstanding Experience
review.reviewText: I pulled up to the hotel for a two night first anniversary celebration with my wife. The staff is super helpful, the lobby is full of art pieces, including Dali works, we felt very safe and secure. Our room was great, the shower was like a gushing waterfall. One of the nicest hotel experiences I have ever had. The bar is a great place to kick back and relax, the room service runs until 3 am on the weekends...good for when the munchies hit. A unique San Francisco experience. We are definitely coming back.

review.title: Premium Experience, Great Memories
review.reviewText: The Clift is in the best location in San Francisco. Imagine going to Broadway quality theatre, world-class shopping, and multiple restaurants all without leaving your neighborhood. Our stay was magic. Tip: If you want a martini just order one and share it. Wow!

review.title: Good location, finish missing the "edge"
review.reviewText:
Great location.  This is a refurbished hotel and you can tell that by simply looking at the rooms.  The lobby is great and funky and all kinds of stylish but the room itself was a little "unfinished".  The original bath was still there and I don't mean 1920s art deco original, I mean original from the 1990s.  In fact, it's the little things like the bottom of the bath peeling and the mustiness of the cupboards that makes this place not quite right.

Anyway, the hotel is in a good location and good enough.  Just don't expect 5 stars, despite the price.
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms need a bit more work.

review.reviewText:
Great hotel right in center of SF.  Swanky and cool, the hotel strikes a particular sophistication at just the right level.       The dimly lit lobby evoked the thought that I might at anytime be walking past a rock star, tech executive, or undercover vampire.  If you dig that vibe, this is a great spot.  

Only issue I had was that the bathtub in my bathroom had a few scrapes that tarnished the rest of the otherwise amazing junior suite.  

Would definitely recommend - alongside the character, it presented good value for the money when compared to other hotels in the vicinity.

review.title: My favorite SF hotel
review.reviewText: This is the original trendy hotel, and still the best. Beautiful facilities, great rooms (check out 1601 for a single), nice staff, lively bar, pretty good location. I go to SF once a month and have stayed in just about every hotel. If I can get a decent rate, this is where I stay. I use it primarily for business, but if you want to have a romantic weekend, the rooms, just saying...

review.reviewText: Very pleasant experience.  Would stay there again.

review.title: Hotel ia centrally located
review.reviewText: We like this hotel and this is our second stay. The bathrooms are a little small as mentioned in other reviews but not a big deal. The staff was attentive and pleasant. The option is decent as far as accessibility to what the city has to offer.

review.title: Nice trendy hotel
review.reviewText:
The hotel is hip and right next to Union Square, its pricing is pretty on par with the hotels within that area. 

The staff was nice and things were clean
review.positiveRemarks: very close walking distance to Union Square and Railcar
review.negativeRemarks: The washroom, although clean, clearly needs some further renovations

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Easy to check in after long flight. Friendly staff. Great security.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, decor, gym and cleanliness. Amazing pillows, sheets and bed comfort.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom a it tired

review.title: Odd choice of decorating style
review.reviewText: Arrived at night - a bit dark and overly modern for our tastes
review.positiveRemarks: Room was larger than anticipated - but stark
review.negativeRemarks: More inviting atmosphere - lobby, bar and room and pricey

review.title: Nice stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: We had a great time at the World Series - Giants versus the Royals.  Giants taking the crown. WOOT WOOT!  We enjoyed this motel because it was right down town and blocks away from the Cheesecake Factory.  We also walked to AT&T Park.  The bed was comfortable and the rooms were clean.  The only thing I would change would be to enlarge the bathrooms.
review.negativeRemarks: I wished the bathrooms would be larger.  The trash can under the sink was hard to get into.
review.locationRemarks: Cheesecake Factory, Apple Store, Lots of Shopping and Food.  We walked everywhere.  It was an awesome location.

managementResponses.response: The Management Team here at Clift is truly sorry that you lost your credit card after visiting the bar. We turn all found items, including credit cards into the Front Desk to keep in a locked storage facility for safe keeping. Unfortunately, your card was not found as was discussed with you at length by the Front Office Manager. The Hotel has no need for keeping guest's credit cards and we even make sure to shred them if they are not claimed from lost and found within a couple of days of being turned in. This is for the security and safety of our guests and their information. We have very strict card handling procedures that must be adhered to at all times. We are truly sorry that we were unable to assist you in locating your misplaced card.

review.title: Watch your credit cards & beware of poor mgmt
review.reviewText: We gave our credit card to the front desk at check in and she managed to put our credit card info down for another room and at the lobby bar we gave our credit card to the server to hold a table for us and our card managed to get skimmed and we were billed for charges after we paid our bill in cash and after we left the hotel bar.  When confronted, management was so rude and accused us of being too drunk to know what was going on.  I am actually pregnant and was extremely offended by her comments and the way they handled the entire situation.  Be careful with your credit cards here.  Toilets also do not flush here.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Hotel is located right by the Union Square. Staff is friendly and helpful, we asked for a room on the higher level far from the elevator an they gave us 15th floor with great views. Room is on the small side but for 2 people it is not an issue. Bed was really comfortable and sheets are nice. Previous reviews said the bathroom is dated but it wasn't that dated at all. Tub could be replaced but it isn't bad if you prefer to shower. No coffee maker in the room but it's available in the lobby in the morning. WiFi was complimentary. Overall it was vey enjoyable stay and we would stay there again.

review.title: Loved it!
review.reviewText: Loved my room and all the accommodations the hotel had to offer. We spend some time on level m and had a nice time just hanging out. By far one of the nicest hotels I have stayed in.

review.title: Great Downtown Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel was a great surprise!  Very clean and the staff was very knowledgable.
review.positiveRemarks: location to and from the convention center, cleanliness

review.title: Excellent!
review.reviewText: Amazing hotel, gorgeous decor, helpful staff! Comfortable bed. Bathroom was small but didn't make a difference. Near shopping, Westfield Mall.

review.title: Great location in the City; gorgeous lobby bar
review.reviewText: Central location.  Beautiful lobby and stellar lobby bar.  Staff was friendly and accommodating.  Spacious room with ultra comfortable bed and bedding.  Room and hallway looking a little worn, but did not detract from the experience.

review.title: Very close to Union Square and Chinatown
review.reviewText:
Love the hotel atmosphere, decoration and friendly staff. If you don't mind to walk the Fisherman Wharf is a 20 minutes distance. Close to shopping, Union Square and Chinatown.
The only negative point is the VERY expensive breakfast on the "Velvet Room", $50.03 for 2 cup of coffee, 1 french toast and a order of hollandaise eggs is a little too much, don't you think? After that experience we choose to go the Starbucks across the street.
Ah! another thing, what is it with not offer an optional top sheet on your bed? Anyways we have a wonderful 5 days stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Love the hotel atmosphere, decoration and friendly staff. If you don't mind to walk the Fisherman Wharf is a 20 minutes distance.
review.negativeRemarks: what is it with not offer an optional top sheet on your bed?
review.locationRemarks: Shopping,have a cold beer at Union Square

review.title: Excellent and Funky
review.reviewText: It was great.  We are a middle-aged couple and even though it is trendy and funky we were totally fine with it.  We had seen some complaints about room size but this is a downtown boutique hotel - the rooms are always going to be a bit on the small side compared to the chains.  The rooms were absolutely big enough and the bed was very comfy.  Great place, nice bar and lounge and close to everything!
The hotel was ok had to ask for housekeeping one day as they had not cleaned the room by 4:30pm.  The location was great with easy access to union square

review.title: Affordable Luxury
review.reviewText: Great visiting this property again. It's on the edge of the Tenderloin, so walk the right way to avoid that area, if you care. Enjoy the Theater and Shopping around Union Square. So convenient with BART from SFO.
review.positiveRemarks: Great design, beds, comfortable luxury add up to a good value for San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: minor carpet stains and wear on some furniture.
review.locationRemarks: Great Union Sq location and with Powell St BART Station from/to SFO, getting here was easy.

review.title: Needs updating.
review.reviewText: The bathrooms were run down and need updating.  Rooms were small for the cost.
review.locationRemarks: Near Market Street and other nice shops.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for your recommendation! We can't wait to welcome you back to Clift.

review.title: Amazing hotel, phenomenal staff.
review.reviewText: Absolutely LOVED this hotel. It's beautiful, trendy and in a great location. Highly recommend it!

review.title: Exceeding expectations
review.reviewText: Even though this hotel had plenty of recommendations, I still tought I would find it 'ok'. It so happens the hotel is amazing: clean and modern rooms and facilities, spacious rooms (I got a Standard), excelent shower, great food. Adding to that is an impressive staff: quick on duty and responsive - the concierge even offered to text me restaurant options when I called from the street asking for recommendations. The only thing I would say is that at night the bar is really close to the lobby and is like you're getting into a party (at rooms no noise).

review.title: Wonderful experience overall.
review.reviewText: Steve, the concierge was a great help in securing my boarding pass. I did not have a confirmation number so he got on the phone and managed to get to the right people to secure the info needed. Kudos to Steve! Bellmen, desk clerks, all staff excellent. I prefer the location because the Clift is near good restaurants, Union Square and all the best shopping.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly and helpful staff, excellent location
review.locationRemarks: see above

review.title: overnight getaway
review.reviewText: My husband and I go to S F quite often, we like to find different hotels when we go. We have love everyone we have stayed at. This hotel was quite fascinating, It was dark and the décor was amazing... (although animal lovers may approve of the tusk couch and other animal parts. I likes the lights that are planted in the floor, your hallways were twice the size of any hotel I've seen.  We took a walk into the bar which was so beautiful, the bar itself was a master piece.The only thing that bothers me is, No coffee in the room, and the bathroom was really small,.Also we always ask for a window facing the street, as we love to see all the lights at night, they tell us ok, and we seem to always get a room facing the back of a building. All in All it was a very beautiful hotel, Also they need to put a Large sign in front of building as we passed it twice, and we heard other saying the same thing.  Very Very  nice place, we would stay again, but we need to ckeck out other hotels, as there are so many to choose from.
review.negativeRemarks: Coffee in room and small refrig.  for left overs.
review.locationRemarks: We always like the Union square area, we went on the double decker bus, did the duck bus, went to the golden gate park, eating out, shopping.

review.title: A must / the best ratio of room quality over rates
review.reviewText: I had been hiking in Yosemite for 3 days and needed much rest before taking my flight back to Quebec City. As soon as I entered the Clift loby, its low light level and art deco style put me in a relax mode I had experienced only a few times over my 30 years of travelling. This was most welcomed after my 5 h drive from El Portal. I recall one hotel in Fukuoka, Japan, one in Bali and another one in Amsterdam. And, this was just the beginning of my stay at Clift. The rooms are cosy, their minimal deco puts you in relaxing state and makes you smile of happiness. Everything in the room, from the position of the TV to the small boxes to put your shirts, is well thought. The happiness of staff is contsgeous and adds the cherry over the sundae.

review.title: Beautiful hotel, excellent service
review.reviewText: Smooth, easy check-in. Only a few blocks from BART for easy access to/from SFO. Easy access to anywhere located only 2 blocks from Union Square. Initial room has lingering smoke (even though hotel is non-smoking) and they were out of other comparable rooms, but quickly upgraded us to a suite w/no hesitation. Friendly staff, I'd definitely stay here again.

review.title: Nice hotel close to union square and cable cars.
review.reviewText: Nice cleans place, we would stay there again. Very close to Sears Fine Foods restaurant. If you have a chance check it out. Very good food and we'll priced.
It was a nice experience. Overall I would come back and stay

review.title: Disappointing stay at this hotel.
review.reviewText:
I should start with the positives.  The staff was very nice and helpful.  We were able to check into our room early...that was a plus for us.  But, the hotel is very dated!  Our room was a total disappointment.  Very old!  The room did not look anything like the Expedia pictures.  The carpet was full of stains.  The purple color reminded us of a little girl's bedroom.  The bathroom was incredibly tiny and cramped.  The toilet was like a men's locker room toilet.  The shower was full of mildew.  The shower head was broken so we had to hold it upright so you could get under the water.  

We left thinking, " no wonder this place is kept so dark!"  Will try another hotel next time.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was very helpful and pleasant.

review.title: Nice place in the heart of union square
review.reviewText: Rooms were finished nicely.  A good quality place in a good location!   Very nice bar/lounge that was very popular!   Overall a very good experience!
review.positiveRemarks: Nice place to entertain in the lounge.  Great staff
review.locationRemarks: Heart of union square, you can walk to anything!

review.title: Hip and swanky!
review.reviewText: We had a great experience at Clift. We were in town for the night on our way to Sonoma. It was my wife's birthday and we had drinks and appitizers in the Redwood room ( a must see!) and our server sent us a bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberry's to our room after we returned from dinner. Now that's classy. Got great recommendations from the staff for nearby restaurants too!
review.locationRemarks: Lots of nightlife nearby!

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: All good except no one picked up my evening room service tray till the next day. Otherwise nice, quiet, clean,comfortable.
They are not very helpful and they make you feel like you are bothering them if you ask them questions.

review.title: With the Kids in SF
review.reviewText: Great location and nice hotel. Loud, dark and lacks service.
review.positiveRemarks: Location is fantastic, it is clean and upscale.
review.negativeRemarks: Attention to detail, more light, customer service and improved inter-room sound suppression. You can hear everything!!.
review.locationRemarks: It is in the heart of everything.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Had a great time at Clift except for some noises (moving or renovations) at night from the room above..
review.locationRemarks: Great location for shopping and sight seeing but a little scary at night as I was followed..

review.title: I stayed in the room practically my entire trip.
review.reviewText: Minus the peeling wallpaper, a weak T.V. remote control and the ridiculously overpriced internet access, my stay was superb. The bedding was heavenly.
review.negativeRemarks: T.V. should be larger and the remote is weak. Fix the peeling wallpaper. @$250  include in room wifi.

review.title: Nice but expensive hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText: All good but take your own kettle.Concierge very helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: A kettle and some tea/milk/cups.
review.locationRemarks: Location very good.

review.title: Dedicated party people only
review.reviewText: The hotel itself was visually exceptional, trendy with great lighting and color schemes.  Staff were also friendly and helpful.  The downside was the nightclub was so loud I couldn't sleep (on the 3rd floor) even with ear plugs.  Absolutely the loudest room I have ever had in my life, and I travel a lot.  When I finally gave up and asked for another room in the middle of the night I ran into a couple in the elevator who said they were leaving the nightclub because it was too loud!  Rooms were fine with better than average bedding, trendy color scheme and a nice stereo for my ipod, but small and otherwise unremarkable.  I arrived at my meeting the next day exhausted.  Wouldn't visit again.
review.negativeRemarks: Might be thoughtful about what visitors you place on lower floors
review.locationRemarks: Great art galleries and shopping

review.title: Modern and slick hotel near union square
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was wonderful very kind and helpful lounge was awesome restaurant good very nice looking but food was okay like better the lounge by far.... Room didn't get cleaned one day because we slept in and no one ever came in the afternoon to clean it and found it a lil small but it was modern and clean decor .. Great location close to everything but rented a car from enterprise throw the hotel and left my phone In the middle compartment after dropping off the car and wen I came bak to get it about 15-20m it was gone and I even called but obviously they wouldn't admit to having such dishonest staff was disappointed about that especially because it's such a well known car rental business and we went throw the hotel for booking but other then that it was good

review.title: Maybe 15 years ago...
review.reviewText: Just seemed old, the bath tub was falling apart! Staff was fine, overall very average for a $350 room. Will not do it again.

review.title: Cool Vibe, no light
review.reviewText: Was in San Fran with my teenage daughter for a family wedding.  Concierge staff was amazing help w navigation and car rental. Room was decent, bed was comfy but bathroom had very dim, little light. In fact the entire hotel was very low light. Was thankful for the window in our room.  Hotel was a great location on Geary St. We were able to walk to all our destinations or catch public transportation to wherever we needed to go.

review.title: Swanky hotel with sceny bar
review.reviewText: Had a great visit at the Clift. Rooms are stylish, beds are comfortable, and staff is very friendly. Bath products are nice.
review.positiveRemarks: Beautiful decor and excellent customer service.
review.negativeRemarks: Being pet-friendly is great, but $100 is a too high for a dog charge. $50 or so, plus credit card on file for damages would make more sense.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent (yet sceny) bar downstairs, good theatre right down the street

review.title: good hotel, very convenient to Union Square
review.reviewText:
my first time at the Clift.  Nice hotel, great location.  For the city location, my room was relatively very quiet. And, another surprise, it was very spacious and nicely designed.
The lobby, is extremely dark.  I know this is part of the design but they could provide other locations on that floor, that guests could sit and read but all of the parts of the common lobby area are dark.  
The staff can range from excellent to not attentive.  But, overall, I would recommend.
review.positiveRemarks: the size of my room was quite spacious, although it was located across from the maid's closet.
review.negativeRemarks: parts of the lobby do not have to be so dark, allowing guests to read. The staff could be more attentive.
review.locationRemarks: a block from Union Square, perfect location.

review.title: Great!
review.reviewText: Awesome!!!! I highly recommend this hotel, great location and great amenities!

review.title: Nice, clean, boutique-style hotel
review.reviewText: After arriving before standard check-in, staff was able to get me into my room early. Comfortable, simple, more than adequate. Friendly staff.
review.locationRemarks: Longer walk to Union Square than I first realized, but not too far that a nice walk will get you there.

review.reviewText: Cool vibe but the room was small and was a little older than anticipated.

review.title: Great Hotel but Room Lacks Functional Furniture
review.reviewText:
Very friendly, clean and centrally located hotel but disappointed with the lack of in-room furnishing.

Make sure that you get a room that is functional for someone who doesn’t want to spend their vacation living out of a suitcase. The reason for this is that we were given a room that had a small closet to hang things but no dressers or bedside tables to store  other items, in which it forced use to mostly live out of a suitcase for the duration of our 5 day stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Room was very quiet and clean. Staff was very Friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Ensure rooms have place to store clothing.
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located, near good restaurants, theaters and close to tourist attractions (i.e. cable cars, China Town and Fisherman's Wharf).

review.title: Nice vibe great location
review.reviewText: Had a great vibe and very modern art. The room was nice but a little too small. The toiletries were used when we went to open them. Overall nice.

review.title: Great location and THE BEST concierge staff I have
review.reviewText: Brilliant concierge staff with amazing local knowledge and great location

review.title: Great hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: My wife and I throughly enjoyed our stay.  Great staff,  beautiful hotel,  great sized home especially in the city and the location was perfect

review.title: Always stay here...  great hotel and location...
review.reviewText: I always stay here when I visit the city.  Great location so that you can walk to almost anywhere.  The staff are friendly.  It is kind of expensive and parking is currently at $52/night.  lol.  lots of extra expenses when you stay here...
review.negativeRemarks: Price....
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, Financial District, etc., etc.

review.title: Excellent location and trendy hotel
review.reviewText: Very well located, perfect stay for a first time visit in San Francisco. Right next to Union Square and also hotel has one of the trendiest bar of the city.
review.negativeRemarks: Concierge!
review.locationRemarks: Right next to Union Square, Chinatown, Cable Car!

review.reviewText: Great time for a quick get away over 4th of July. Good location
Centrally located. Nice rooms. Staff is helpful. Bar is upscale.

review.title: Cool boutique hotel located close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Was only there for 1 night, but very pleasant and restful.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, great bar and restaurant. Lovely peaceful room.
review.negativeRemarks:
Wardrobes very small, can't fit a suitcase inside.
Bathroom tiny.
review.locationRemarks: Great location - walking distance to shops, restaurants, Embarcadero.

review.reviewText:
We had wonderful time and the staff us superb!
Celebrating our Anniversary and they sent us a bottle of Champagne!

review.title: Great hotel, apart from the noise
review.reviewText: A characterful hotel, with great staff and generally fantastic rooms. Let down by the noise - desperately needs some double glazing. San Francisco never sleeps, so take some earplugs if you want to.
review.negativeRemarks: Sound proofing
review.locationRemarks: Very close Powell Street public transport hub and car rental depots. Plenty of restaurants etc. close by too. Great location for vacation.

review.title: Party hotel
review.reviewText: Overall hotel met our needs. Staff were great. Room was always clean and they never skimped on the personal hygiene products. Nice products btw. Only thing we didn't like was all the guest doors banged really loud. Simple dampening devices are badly needed. If you're into the party scene, this makes for awesome stay. We didnt eat there but it should have. Sounded amazing and the yelp reviews are good. Didn't bother us but we thought it was funny that guests comprised of old men with escorts latched onto arms.

review.title: Nice location
review.reviewText: It was really nice and the rooms r clean.i II stay again for sure..

review.title: Really close to union square
review.reviewText:
The hotel was really nice, rooms were really comfortable!!

location is really good really close to union square were you can take the hop on hop off tours, there are a lot of shops.
review.positiveRemarks: The only thing that i did not like and it does not has anything to do with the hotel, is that at night, there are a lot of homeless

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText:
Good location for business as its a 10 minute walk to downtown which was great to do instead of catching the tube.i got lucky and got a huge room on 9th floor which was very comfortable.
the bar downstairs is great,with huge whiskey selection and some good wines.
the staff were very friendly and helpful.their restaurant suggestions were all excellent

review.title: The rooms were small and the furniture is funky
review.reviewText: The staff was nice and the hotel is in a nice area, but parking is outrageous. Take the BART If you don't need your car.

review.title: Great Location Historic Building
review.reviewText: The Clift is a great place to stay as long as you don't expect a modern experience. The building is old so the rooms do not have a modern layout. The vibe of the hotel is hip and the bar is a popular spot. Parking is $50 a day so Uber might be a better method of transportation.

review.title: Good location, helpful staff
review.reviewText: My only complaint was the bathroom: too small. Other than that, it was very clean and we found the staff very friendly and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Bigger bathrooms
review.locationRemarks: Union square, close to great shopping

review.title: Trendy, downtown SF hotel
review.reviewText: Only stayed for literally six hours but it would've been nice to stay longer. Great room and friendly staff. Don't let the trendy popular club and bar fool you, the room is quiet.
review.positiveRemarks: great room and friendly staff. great location
review.negativeRemarks: Long wait late to check in. No good parking - must use valet or the garage about two blocks away.
review.locationRemarks: a ton...heart of downtown SF

review.title: Nice place
review.reviewText: Nice place good vibe nice bar and atmosphere great place to stay in the city. I got a studio queen it was not that great

review.title: Subdued Colors and Mirrors
review.reviewText:
The hotel is very chic----popular with young people.  But, the over the top use of subdued purple and gray colors, while
they may be soothing, do not raise one's spirits.  Also, so over the top with the use of mirrors.  There was a floor to 
ceiling mirror on the wall at the foot of the bed and one behind the bed---it gave one the sense of being watched, which of course one was not.  The old Clift had an older charm to it that has been lost.  The restaurant is too dark, whereas the old Four Seasons was open, very convivial, with lots of light coming in the windows.  One had the sensation of being in hiding inside the Clift.  As said, maybe this sort of decor appeals to a young set.  But it puts off the mature traveler somewhat.
review.negativeRemarks: Charging $15 for use of Wi-Fi is way out of line.
review.locationRemarks: Location and price is in line with downtown San Francisco

review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. Staff was incredibly friendly and helpful.

review.title: Excellent location and has the "cool" factor.
review.reviewText: Valet could not get the car in time on two attempts.

review.title: Great hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: Have stayed in this hotel may, many times and still love this place. Hip without trying to hard.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location and I love the interiors. Very cool.
review.negativeRemarks: I don't like the fact that guests don't automatically gain access to the bar if the bar is busy.
review.locationRemarks: Seriously, the pizza by the slice place directly across the road is the best pizza in town!

review.title: Nice hotel, super location
review.reviewText: We loved he lobby and restaurant atmosphere, the location and the courtesy of the staff.
review.positiveRemarks: Room amenities and decor is minimal

review.title: last minute weekend stay
review.reviewText:
When I saw that Expedia was offering the Clift hotel for under $200, that was my immediate choice. The hotel is central to downtown and Union Square. In the hotel's earlier days, it was well known for The Redwood Room, which was a fabulous old-school bar. I had my first martini there. The Redwood Room is no more, but it is part of the lobby area, which was pleasant and very quiet.
My room on the 15th floor was comfortable, well organized and QUIET! The Clift has installed double paned windows to keep the traffic and street noise out.
The room had a spectacular view, a very comfortable bed and deluxe sheets and pillows. I was able to sleep well there.
I ordered room service breakfast before checking out, which was reasonably priced and delicious (RARE!!).
The next time I go to San Francisco, The Clift is my FIRST CHOICE FOR HOTELS - if I can afford it.
ps - a comparable hotel in London would charge double this amount or more.
Thank you, Expedia!!

review.title: Class act near Union Square
review.reviewText: The hotel is a gem in San Francisco, and I was pleasantly surprised by the clean, well-lighted room and friendly staff. I will try to stay here again soon.

review.title: Nice hotel, however hidden fees
review.reviewText: Booked a hotel on expedia, great price, when I got there they added 300 dollars for incidentals protection. However they charged me again for the bag of gummie bears from the minibar. Not sure why they need to hold 300 dollars for a two night stay.

review.title: Great Customer Service
review.reviewText: We had an overall wonderful stay at the Clift. We unfortunately were next door to some rather loud people due to a thin joining door between rooms and were kept up all night and into the early morning because of them, so we called down to the front room and asked for a room change and they were more than accommodating to our needs!! We left for the day and upon our return they had our new room ready to go, brought us our luggage and even included a few little treats in the mix. They were efficient, friendly and made us feel welcome. I definitely recommend this beautiful little boutique hotel and will certainly stay there again next trip there!
review.positiveRemarks: I love the boutique, vintage feel!
review.negativeRemarks: Remove or replace any joining doors to rooms. They're just too thin and you can hear everything that goes on next door!
review.locationRemarks: Right in the financial district, you're only a 5-10 minute walk to majour shopping areas, transit, etc.

review.title: In Union Sqaure right by everything.
review.reviewText: Overall, our experience was good. The hotel is nice but very eclectic. We wanted ice, called down twice and it never came. That was annoying. Otherwise, very nice hotel.

review.title: Downtown hotel
review.reviewText: Like other Morgans hotels, the bar is quite the hotspot at night. Lots of people, lots of noise, people looking to hookup. But the rooms are quiet and clean.
review.positiveRemarks: Quiet, clean rooms. Great concierge with lovely advise, whatever your question.
review.negativeRemarks: I don't understand why wifi isn't included in the rooms.
review.locationRemarks: shopping, galleries, theatre.

review.title: A nice stay
review.reviewText:
Had a great stay at the Clift. It's walking distance from the main shopping an transport areas.
Great hotel room with really comfortable bed. The only downside was the pricy room service and charges for Internet in the room. Although there is free internet in the lobby.

review.title: Clift
review.reviewText:
Always coming back to Clift Hotel when I am in San Francisco.

The only disappointment is there is still no free wifi in the room. Our hotel in LA provided that facility and scored points there

review.title: Lively comfortable hotel near to Union Square
review.reviewText: Very enjoyable experience. Hotel staff were very friendly and extremely helpful. The Redwood Room bar was very lively every night - we were told it was a very popular singles bar - not the place for two people in their 60's to have a conversation, but certainly an experience. Breakfast in the hotel we thought was a little pricey when there are many other places to eat. We only ate once in the restaurant and were disappointed - but it was just before the restaurant closed.
review.positiveRemarks: Its central location and the service provided by the hotel staff.

review.title: Excellent stay in San Francisco Downtown
review.reviewText: We only stayed for one night, but Clift exceeded our expectations and made our stay very pleasant. Our room was spacious, had beautiful views, and was very clean and well appointed. The staff was friendly and helpful. We had no complaints whatsoever.
review.negativeRemarks: N/A
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco downtown (Tenderloin area) has plenty of restaurants and things to do

review.title: Trendy fancy hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText: Great experience at Clift, a trendy spot in SF to have a drink in the Redwood Room at night. Very close to Union Square and main Market St for easy access to attractions and transportation. Hotel itself had great staff and a very unique, hip and fancy atmosphere. Definitely unique style with a knack for chairs.

review.title: Trendy fancy hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText: Great experience at Clift, a trendy spot in SF to have a drink in the Redwood Room at night. Very close to Union Square and main Market St for easy access to attractions and transportation. Hotel itself had great staff and a very unique, hip and fancy atmosphere. Definitely unique style with a knack for chairs.

review.title: Sexy Hotel
review.reviewText: Stayed for one night but would stay for many next time. The hotel is very sophisticated and sexy. Loved the decor and lobby. The whole vibe is spot on for young adults. Really loved the comfort of the bed and the feel of the sheets and pillows in the room.
review.positiveRemarks: The smell of the lobby, the lighting, the decor, the beds are super comfortable
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom was cramped
review.locationRemarks: Honey Honey Cafe is great for breakfast

review.title: Comfortable, well run hotel.
review.reviewText:
Comfortable, well run hotel in the centre of San Francisco.
Only two slight drawbacks -
There were no drawers for clothes storage, only a shelf at top of wardrobe. We travel light so was not a problem but could bother others.
As with all these older hotels the sound proofing is not the greatest. Probably acerbated by having a (locked) connecting door between us and the next room but we could clearly hear every word spoken. Fortunately over our five night stay there was no problem late at night and we slept soundly but if you got the wrong sort of guests next door it could be a problem.
Otherwise we had a great stay in an interesting, charming and very pleasant establishment.

review.title: nice hotel
review.reviewText: good hotel, good location, very small bathrooms, the hotel is veru art oriented, the bar is very nice, the breakfast buffet can di better
review.negativeRemarks: the bathrooms are very small

review.title: Nice in a good location
review.reviewText: This is a quite ok 'boutique' hotel hotel with nice rooms and a very nice lobby if somewhat dimly lit.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is close to Union Square and walking distance to Powell BART/MUNI for easy access to SFO Airport and other places

review.title: Fantastic hotel
review.reviewText:
Everything was wonderful. The only quibble I have is that they took $500 from my credit card at the start of the stay, without letting me know. I was lead to believe they were just holding my details to pay for incidentals, not that they would actually remove the money from my card. Its also taken 5 days for the money to be refunded to me after checkout. I have yet to recieve a satisfactory reply from the management on this.

Apart from that, amazing place. The Redwood Room is a particular highlight, with incredible cocktails.
review.negativeRemarks: The credit card charge. They REALLY need to explain this better and arrange for far swifter refund on check out. It's really bad customer experience

review.title: handy location
review.reviewText: good location for the centre of town, although a bit posey
review.negativeRemarks: air conditioning too loud, free wifi in public rooms but $15 a day in rooms
review.locationRemarks: handy for union sq. and cable car

review.title: Close to awesome shopping and restaurants
review.reviewText: Very quiet place. Clean and comfortable bed. Great location. Very close to China Town as well as shopping centers, all within walking distance. If you like Designer clothes and handbags, you will love this location.

review.title: Good location, just OK
review.reviewText: Good location but rooms need more service. Nightclub- hotel

review.title: Nice Hotel, closer to everything
review.reviewText:
The staff was very nice, the beding was comfortable, great Location, close to everything.
The room we had was quiet. Water bottles are free. Free tea and coffee in the morning in the lobby. Car rental places are just arround the corner. Bathroom was small but had all of the amenities. Great shower pressure. I would stay there anytime again.
review.positiveRemarks: Great comfortable beding, our room was quiet. Great gym facility. Water bottles are free. Free coffee and tea in the morning
review.negativeRemarks: The lobby is a bit dark, but one gets used to it.
review.locationRemarks: Great location, car rentals, great restaurant and shops near by. Close to everything including all of the transportation.

review.title: Nice hotel, close to BART
review.reviewText: I flew into SFO and was looking for something stylish, but also close to a BART station. Clift was great, easy trip in from the airport, staff was friendly, room was nice, I had an excellent stay. I hear good things about the lounge too, but was out on the town during the hours they were open and missed it. Next time!

review.title: Close to downtown
review.reviewText: Always good - had an early check in and an upgrade of our room.
review.negativeRemarks: Hot tubs in each room - and comp Red Wine
review.locationRemarks: Access to great restaurants

review.title: Perfect location perfect staff
review.reviewText: I was alone but they didnt make me feel alone. Excellent concierge staff. Very helpful.

review.title: BDay Weekend Extravaganza for the Wifey
review.reviewText: The club was a pleasant surprise downstairs in the lobby. Moscow Mules were yummy and did the nightcap trick.

review.title: Clift hotel. San Francisco
review.reviewText: Was revisiting San Francisco as a tourist having visited many times on business. Wanted to walk down memory lane. Great city to walk around and weather was surprisingly warm for April.
review.positiveRemarks: Hotel was central and had a spacious room in a contemporary design. Dining facilities good.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom was small but functional - prefer separate shower cubicle.
review.locationRemarks: Very central - great shopping and dining very close by. Walkable distant from piers ie Pier 39 for tourists, China Town, Union Square and Market St.

review.title: Nice lounge
review.reviewText: Fun night and good location- red room lounge was a great scene

review.title: This is my favorite hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The original trendy hotel still delivers. Really nice rooms, especially the suites. Happening bar scene.
review.positiveRemarks: Rooms are really nice, perfect for business visit, perfect for romantic tryst.
review.negativeRemarks: They charge extra for internet access, come on....
review.locationRemarks: Downtown SF

review.title: Extremely Disappointing
review.reviewText:
First of all, I've never complained about a hotel stay until now and I do a fair amount of traveling. Here goes my rant...

The walls were very very thin and we woke up to people talking both mornings. We were in an adjoining room and our neighbors were partying (felt like they were in the room – we could hear every word they said). The rooms were much smaller than cheaper and nicer hotels in the area. Don't worry about your view because you can't see out of the dirty windows even if there is a view. The shower did not work… The tub had chipping paint and the water literally dribbled out of the shower head at constantly changing temperatures. Absolutely horrible experience after paying good money. I would never recommend this hotel to a friend; I'd recommend checking out the Hotel Monaco across the street.
review.negativeRemarks: Showers that work and that are kept up. A cleaner room with clean windows would be nice… And at least SOME kind of soundproofing between rooms...
review.locationRemarks: Somewhat dirty area but a short walk to nice shopping and restaurants.

review.title: Clift hotel....
review.reviewText: Stayed for two nights. It was nice, the rooms are big.

review.title: Edgy Clift
review.reviewText: We had wanted to stay at the Clift for a while but things hadn't lined up before. It was worth the wait! The Clift has and edgy feel, from the decor to the furniture to the color palate. Aa LNG established hotel that has been repositioned for the 21st century.
review.positiveRemarks: Room was spacious and comfortable. Bed was comfy. Furnishings were trendy.
review.negativeRemarks: There was a kind of lack of storage space in that there was no chest of drawers, no armoire and all storage was in the single walk in closet.
review.locationRemarks: Almost next door to the Curran theatre and ACT. Two blocks firm Union square. Three blocks from shopping. Restaurants all round. Right in the action

review.title: Trendy but nice
review.reviewText: The hotel room was spacious and nicely appointed. Great view of the city. Friday night, when we checked in, was a bit of a club scene with doorman and music bumping, but the rest of the weekend was much tamer. Great location near Powell BART station and walking distance to all the sights of San Francisco a tourist would want to visit.
review.locationRemarks: Near Union Square, Powell BART station, nice walk to Chinatown, Union Swuare, The Embarcardero and all the sights in San Francisco

review.title: From old to new.
review.reviewText: It is an older building that has been refurbished. I have to remind myself that San Francisco is a very expensive city to spend the night. Next time we will stay south of town as I really didn't feel that I was getting my money's worth. We recently stayed in Long Beach at the Pike for similar price but their could be no comparison. If you like convenience this is a good location and near the cable cars on Powell street. Shopping is very good, good food and theaters near by. We saved about 120 a night by using Expedia over the regular hotel price.
review.positiveRemarks: The ambiance was very nice some thoughtful work went into decorating the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: We had a superior king, and their was ample room for a desk. Plus this hotel charges $50 for parking and the parking lot next to the hotel was $38.
review.locationRemarks: Your a 5 minute walk from Union Square and Powell st. Cable cars and shopping, good restaurants all around their is a French cafe across the st.

review.title: Great location - central to everything in SF
review.reviewText: Great staff, updated rooms good restaurant and fun and lively bar
review.negativeRemarks: Not much
review.locationRemarks: Very close to Union Square

review.title: Simply Amazing
review.reviewText: I was in LOVE the moment I walked into The Clift. The best way to describe The Clift is SEXY. I loved the decor. My favorite part was the bed, it just hugs you as you lay in it. The Redwood had an awesome atmosphere great music, and tasty drinks. I will stay again

review.title: Funky euro vibe
review.reviewText: The Clift would be at home on South Beach. Funky chic decor. More Europeans than natives both staying and employed. Nice place. Clean, and security was good. We had fun.
review.positiveRemarks: different. good security in elevator lobby at nights to keep non-staying guests from the room areas.
review.negativeRemarks: coffee maker in room would have been nice, but available every morning in the lobby so ok. dresser in the room would have been nice to unpack.
review.locationRemarks: near theaters and powell street cable car, but really not close to fisherman's wharf or waterfront, or golden gate park

review.title: Handy location to Union Square.
review.reviewText: Close to transport (Powell street station, about a 9 minute walk to the hotel) and Union Square. Take Bart train from airport to Powell street station (takes about 30 minutes, costs $8.65 each way) then walk up Powell street and turn left at Geary street. The hotel lobby is very dark (much like a night club) but eclectically and comfortably furnished with a variety of board games to play. There is a stunning grand dining room. Staff are very helpful and friendly. Our room was a good size and cleverly appointed with a large bathroom, beautifully fragranced soaps/shampoo and a very comfortable king size bed. There is also a good gym. At night the ground floor becomes a night club but this doesn't interfere with the hotel guests. The pinecrest dinner is just down the road and is open 24 hours a day with reasonable priced meals. There are lots of art galleries between the hotel and union square. The large department stores such as Macy's and Neiman Marcus are also just down the road. Overall a stylish hotel in a great location that we wouldn't mind returning to in the future.

review.title: Great hotel but room left more to be desired
review.reviewText: Great hotel, nice ambiance in the lobby but the deluxe room left more to be desired. The room is nice and spacious but it seemed a little bare.

review.title: Bad Hood and Smells
review.reviewText: The hotel borders a very seedy neighborhood- not part of Union Square- really part if Tenderloin. It prides itself as a "clubby" feel. The lobby is part of the club- and is very cool. The smell of pot on the floor where my room was- not so cool. The bathroom felt dirty and not luxurious at all.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: This is a nice hotel in a great part of SF. Room is a little small, but is pretty nice.

review.title: In the heart of San Francisco!
review.reviewText: Great staff...very friendly! The hotel was walking distance to Union Square. Overall great experience!

review.title: Old SF hotel in great location.
review.reviewText: The Clift was relatively pleasing although the lobby and common areas are pretty dark. The room and bathroom is small but clean. Room service came up quickly when ordered.
review.negativeRemarks: Only one of 3 elevators was working. I'd also recommend using Heinz ketchup versus the house-made ketchup in room service.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is within walking distance to Union Square and close to shopping. It's also a perfect distance to the Ferry Building and Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Good hotel.
review.reviewText: Hotel is hip and at night becomes dance club. The décor is cool. The staff good. The room was small but fine. There was hair in the bed and bathroom. Didn't like that part. But that could just be one bad housekeeper. I would recommend and the price was decent based on location.

review.title: Amazing experience
review.reviewText: The staff was outstanding. I have stayed at a lot of wonderful hotels in the city, but this is my new top favorite. They made sure my fiancé and I were taken care of at all times. They even upgraded our room when they found out we were there for a special occasion.

review.title: Hip Spot Downtown
review.reviewText:
Nice hotel with a great location and awesome bar. Redwood room would fill to capacity on Fridays and Saturdays with travellers and locals. Tony the bartender was great in recommending a whole list of places to visit, and great cocktails too.

Hotel is historic so the rooms are a little small - get a corner room if you can.

review.title: The area is just ok. The decor is trying too hard.
review.reviewText: Doormen were unattentive. I opened the door for myself most if the time while they spoke to each other. Charges were over the top. Charge to use computers in business center, charge per page of paper, charges hot wifi, $4 for a kit kat.

review.title: amazing place
review.reviewText: lovely atmosphere and friendly staff. The hotel is conveniently located for conference and pleasure.
review.negativeRemarks: nothing really,
review.locationRemarks: everything from malls to restaurants.

review.title: Excellent location.
review.reviewText: I am happy with the location and facility. It is different from your typical major hotel chain.

review.title: Great, modern hotel. Especially restaurant and bar
review.reviewText: Internet was very slow and tedious. Door men were more of an annoyance than a help. Beds and pillows were amazing! Room was clean and neat.
review.positiveRemarks: Lobby, restaurant and bar. The location is superb for shopping and Union square activity.
review.negativeRemarks: Internet access. SFO shuttle.

review.title: Trendy little spot
review.reviewText: Right when I walked in I noticed all the different couches and chairs, the huge fire place and huge fur chair people were talking pictures on. Rooms were nice would definitely stay here again!!

review.title: Will stay again!
review.reviewText: Stayed at the Clift so my partner and I could have what our son calls "a big person night and slumber party." Room was spacious and amenities were perfect for an overnight stay. Only negative was the bed linen didn't fit well for a king bed and we kept fighting for the covers.

review.title: best hotel
review.reviewText:
It was the best hotel to stay in San Francisco! Best location. Veru nice atmosphere and decor. Very comfortable room. (we got an upgrade to a jr suite). The staff is unbelievably nice and helpful!
Great bar!

review.title: Great location..loved it.
review.reviewText: The hotel was fantastic. My only complaint would be my room had no view at all and bathroom a little tight...but other than that...I would stay again.

review.title: Awesome Stay in SF
review.reviewText: Loved every minute of our stay. Great location - walking distance from financial District and China Town. Hotel staff were wonderfully accommodating…anything we wanted (including putting special together for my wife's birthday).
review.negativeRemarks: Fix leak in faucet

review.title: Spectacular
review.reviewText: We stayed four nights, no trouble checking in or getting the room type we had been promised, which was an upgrade. Very inexpensive on Expedia booking well in advance. The suites and public areas were stunning. Loved the big windows in the room and the eclectic chair collection on the main floor. The bed was very comfortable and there were lots of amenities in the bathroom.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to Union Square, lots of shopping great restaurants within walking distance. Try the Olympic on Geary for breakfast.

review.title: Suite Life
review.reviewText: We had a amazing stay at the Clift hotel. We were given a complementary upgrade to a loft suite. The room was huge!!! The mini bar had us laughing be sure to check out the goodies in there. Great location, Great Bar in the hotel.

review.title: Romantic getaway
review.reviewText: They upgraded our room to a sweet and gave us complimentary champagne and chocolate strawberries when they found out we were celebrating our anniversary! It was wonderful!

review.title: Sexy, stylish and fun
review.reviewText: First time for me at the Clift Hotel and it was great! As one property among several others in the Morgans Hotel Group, the Clift Hotel exudes a certain sophisticated style consistent with their other properties. I have stayed at the Hudson Hotel in Manhattan several times, the Mondrian in LA and the Delano on South Beach. The Clift Hotel is among the others in terms of ambiance, comfort and service. Although we are locals my girlfriend stayed at the Clift recently for a romantic interlude. The Clift delivered and we really enjoyed the whole experience.
review.positiveRemarks: Junior suite on the 5th floor was spacious and quiet. King bed was extremely comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Housekeeping was slow to service the room on Saturday afternoon, but otherwise the staff was superb.
review.locationRemarks: Two blocks from Union Square and 20 minutes from everything in the city. Outstanding location.

review.title: very nice clean & cozy
review.reviewText: went for my bday for my boyfriend and i and lets say we ordered a bucket of ice and it came to the room in less than 5min the staff were friendly & we had a good time very relaxing bathroom was wayyyy to small but everything else 5 stars

review.title: Nice hotel but...there is a lot of noise !!
review.reviewText: Everything was perfect except for The fact that you can hear everything coming from outside, the music from the lobby was really loud and you could even hear the bass. Then we could hear next room's couple having intimacy like they were right next to us :/

review.title: Quality location
review.reviewText: Close to Union Square. Pleasant staff, accommodating when we had loud neighbours.

review.title: Nice HOTEL, great customer service
review.reviewText: enjoyed our stay at the Clift, beautiful lobby. Very pleased with the customer service. Great location and we got a room upgrade. The room could use some improvements, but I would definitely will book another stay here.

review.title: Great staff and beautiful hotel
review.reviewText:
I always have a great stay at the Clift. The staff is very attentive and willing to ensure you
Have a positive stay.

review.title: Room given away before we checked in!
review.reviewText: We booked 2 nights via Expedia & arrived around 10pm. Here's how it went: 1) We had to double park at valet, leaving our car running in the street with a tow truck right behind us (wondered if we would we get towed); 2) It was Saturday & some club-goers were in line thinking hotel check-in was the coat check (irritating). 3) Valet leaves your luggage in the lobby with the hundreds of drunk club-goers. No one is watching your stuff, so you better! 4) The manager told us our room had been given away to the guest who stayed the evening before (who did not have a reservation) & we were being sent to another hotel.
