Never should a person without a reservation be given priority over a person with a reservation. That is just bad business and RUDE. We planned 2 nights at the Clift because we wanted to try a new hotel and because we did want to pack up and transfer hotels. Their bad business decision ruined our mini-vacation to the city and they thought they could make up for it by sending us to another hotel at their expense and upgrading us to a suite on night 2 when we had to return to their hotel. Honestly, the Clift is nothing special and we would have rather of stayed 2 nights at the hotel they sent us to when the Clift turned us away. Hotel Nikko is incredible. If you are out to party & just need a bed to sleep in, then by all means, choose the Clift. If you want luxury, comfort, & peace of mind, choose Hotel Nikko. We have stayed at Hotel Nikko before & they never disappoint!
review.positiveRemarks: The chic decor and the various chairs. Can you say, "chair fetish"?
review.negativeRemarks: business practices

review.title: Great hotel centrally located
review.reviewText: Great location 2 blocks from Union Square and the Cable car. Close to great shopping area. When I was booking this I didn't know where to book, but it worked out wonderful - we were 2 blocks from the BART, tram and cable car. Also lots of restaurants and shopping. When we had initially booked our rooms, expedia and the hotel booking agents were not very accommodating about our requests, but when we arrived the front desk were more than accommodating and were very helpful and meeting our needs. What a wonderful place to stay. We will more than likely stay there next time we go.
review.negativeRemarks: The Booking agents for the hotel, they are not very friendly and were very rude when I called to confirm our room types.
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco cable car, Union square, great bars and restaurants

review.title: Cool hotel in a great location.
review.reviewText:
Enjoyed our hotel experience at the Clift. Very comfortable rooms and good location for our trip.
The only negative I have is that the prices at the bar were extremely high. That kept us away from spending
much time there. But I understand that it is a destination bar in the city and you must pay for it.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was very friendly and helpful.

review.title: hard to find
review.reviewText:
Had to drive by the hotel twice because the signage and entryway is so small.
Had to call the front desk for a clue….He wasn't very gracious.
Really…..$52 to park for one night…..I didn't even get a wax job!
Seating in common areas is very worn and tired.
Our dining experience completely ruined by loud electro-dance music.

review.title: Cramped, dark and dirty
review.reviewText: It's not a great experience when you leave with 5 huge visible bruises from lack of adequate lighting (we asked the front desk to replace the vestibule lightbulb the first day, it did not get done for our 5 day stay. To disguise this room as one that would hold a king bed opposite walls were mirrored floor to ceiling. It was impossible to walk around the huge king sleigh bed that simply did not fit. We went to unpack for our stay and found they had neglected to put any furniture with drawers in the room, of course there was a minibar the size of Montana, but no place for your clothes. The bathroom (which had the best showerhead in the history of the world), was tiny, and had no counter space for storage of guest's personal items. One day during our stay our room received no maid service--there was no door hanger to request it for some reason.

review.title: Fantastic hotel in great location
review.reviewText:
Check in process very professional ...the room was perfect for our needs ...the housekeeping staff very helpful and friendly... Also the room was very quiet and hardly any noise from
Other residents during the nights even thou this is quite a busy hotel with weddings and meetings and parties going on..the front door staff were also aware of all customer needs and carried out all tasks efficiently..the concierge services were informative suggesting and recommending very good resturants in the area the member of staff was called Oscar was particularly helpful in this area
review.positiveRemarks: The decor and design of the hotel was truly beautiful .. The Redwood Bar was outstanding A real destination place to stay...
review.negativeRemarks: Just one complaint ...would have liked to have a better grade of coffee served to residents In the morning
review.locationRemarks: The location was perfect it is truly near every thing you would want to see in beautiful San Francisco..

review.title: Great hotel in the heart of San Francisco
review.reviewText: Stayed three nights and thoroughly enjoyed the hotel. Ate in the dining room one evening--excellent meal and service. Only a couple of blocks from Union Square, easy to get to BART, the metro system, by which you can access any of the areas of Greater San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, excellent and very helpful staff. The Red Room Lounge and the Red Velvet Dining Room are spectacular
review.negativeRemarks: Room was small and should have had more storage drawers (only three small plastic drawers were provided.
review.locationRemarks: Close to everything in downtown San Francisco. We walked to China Town, Fisherman's Wharf, The Coit Tower, Lombard Street and Ghiradelli Square.

review.title: Trendy, lacking amenities
review.reviewText: Trendy hotel in a good location. The room was fine, but the bathroom shower had a little mold. Also, no ice machine so had to call the front desk every time we wanted ice. Staff was friendly and helpful.

review.title: Nice hotel, but a bit overpriced
review.reviewText: The hotel lobby is stunning, my room was really clean and the staff was amazing. However, the bathroom was very small for a hotel that price. Even though we have free Wi-Fi in the lobby, you would have to $14/day to have in you room. This is 2014, free Wi-Fi in every room is MANDATORY for a hotel that price.
review.positiveRemarks: It was very clean and the bed was very comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: My room was a bit cold even if the thermostat was set at the highest setting, I still can't believe a hotel that price would ask that much for Wi-Fi.
review.locationRemarks: Very well located. For someone who loves to walk, I was able to walk to all San Francisco major attractions.

review.title: Classic hotel desecrated by crazed modern decor
review.reviewText:
No comfortable seating in room
Bathroom was extremely cramped and inconvenient
Everything is "extra", i.e. wi-fi, business center computer use
There for 3 days, doorman was never around when we needed him
On the plus side, the morning coffee and tea service in the lobby was high quality
review.positiveRemarks: Location was great Morning coffee and tea service in the lobby was great

review.title: Fabulous hotel; Exceptional staff
review.reviewText: Stayed for four nights at The Clift while taking a course in San Francisco. Hotel staff are exceptional and very efficient. Hotel is clean, quiet, and comfortable. Bathroom is small, but we managed well. Excellent location, two blocks from Union Square and about. 20 minute walk to Fishermen's Wharf.
review.locationRemarks: On the doorstep of Union Square and Chinatown

review.title: Great stay!
review.reviewText: Nice sized room with open floor plan and very convenient to restaurants and shopping.

review.title: Very San Francisco
review.reviewText: A short & busy business trip, this hotel was a pleasure to come back to each night. Quirky and trendy, with bigger than life furniture to moving portraits. Rooms very comfortable and surprisingly quite.
review.negativeRemarks: WiFi could be inclusive
review.locationRemarks: Quite central, near the stage shows & union square.

review.title: Horrible experience, urgent renovation needed!!
review.reviewText:
We went to San Francisco to celebrate my wife´s birthday, decided this hotel because Expedia suggest it as VIP hotel. Big mistake. Even when the front desk received us well and gave us an upgrade (wich I never knew what it was, since I paid for a deluxe room and that's what we got) we were very disappointed about the room conditions. Bathroom was the worst thing (pics attached). Depressing view and very limited amenities. We decided to check out and leave the hotel immediately. We didn't stay more than 30 minutes and still charged the first night, wich is OK since those were the terms and conditions, but nobody showed any concern about it in the front desk. At the arrival doormen didn't help us with our luggage since it has wheels (his own words), obviously when we left didn't do it either. I don't really know who evaluate an hotel and give the star rating, but definitely this one needs to be re-evaluate, I would never give the 4 stars. I bet there are plenty of 2 star hotels with better bathrooms.
We made another reservation and went to other hotel as fast as we could. After all, there are some other hotels out there who know how to give great service.
review.negativeRemarks: Urgent renovation. With those rates they I bet you can afford some new bath tubs. Need new carpets too.
review.locationRemarks: Cant say, didn't stay for more than 30 minutes.

review.title: Fab hotel great location
review.reviewText: Very child friendly. Great staff. Super accommodating

review.title: Cool chic hotel
review.reviewText: Received hood service from the staff. Bar was great but a little overpriced. I will stay here again.

review.title: ONE DAY/NIGHT IN THE CITY
review.reviewText: easy check in - was able to make dinner reservations at local restaurants that would have hard to get into on my on..
review.negativeRemarks: can't think of anything presently
review.locationRemarks: walking distance to major restaurants/bars/night clubs/movie theatres and shopping

review.title: Great hotel near downtown
review.reviewText: Received an upgrade to a studio - spacious and comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: It's on the edge of the Tenderloin, so out on the street there are many homeless and panhandlers.

review.title: Great hotel. Great location!
review.reviewText: A great modern hotel in an older building. The bar is fantastic! The rooms were clean! There are cool funky chairs throughout the whole building so get out your camera for great group photos!

review.title: Nice hotel. No complaints.
review.reviewText: Good beds, good breakfast, good service. Better than average hotel bar/club. Area a bit seedy but safe enough.

review.title: Trendy lobby, excellent location, small rooms
review.reviewText: Our Deluxe room seemed so much smaller than the 315 square footage it claims. There is a small nook for the computer desk with wired internet. It's got a pastel lavender decor. The bed is really comfy. Bathroom is cramped and the water drips. There's a hint of naughtiness. They are so considerate of their female clientele that they even offer a personal vibrator on the mini bar menu! There are floor to ceiling mirrors in front and behind the bed. It's a great place to crash for a night after drinks at their chic lounge, the Redwood room. I've seen guests with dogs and children stay here too.
review.positiveRemarks: excellent location, great lobby and lounge, place to be seen.
review.negativeRemarks: some bathroom paint touch up, tighten the leaky faucets
review.locationRemarks: everything is walking distance: theater, shopping, clubs, restaurants, sightseeing, and public transit.

review.title: Rooms not cleaned
review.reviewText: The light switch in the restroom was gross and nasty. The toilet seat was also dirty. Pluming was terrible the tub would fill while taking a shower.

review.title: It was ok - for the price you got a great location
review.reviewText:
Extra "holding charges" each night were very fast out of our account but still waiting on the refunds.
Staff could've been more friendly and better equipped with on sale options we had to ask for everything eg: upgrades, transport, recommended places to eat/visit etc - however location was fantastic!

review.title: Arty and busy hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText:
Arrival at hotel was a good experience with friendly and helpful concierge/bellmen and efficient check-in staff. Public areas of the Clift are quite dark which takes a while to get used to and the furnishings are trendy, edgy but functional too.
Room was good and surprisingly quet on the 7th floor. Plenty of room to move with mirrors giving it extra perceived space. Would recommend this hotel to family and friends.
review.positiveRemarks: Room size and amenities, friendly and courteous staff
review.negativeRemarks: Bath tub/shower needs replacing or resurfacing as it was peeling
review.locationRemarks: Good location, close to most things

review.title: Nice hidden hotel
review.reviewText: Clift was next to Union Square, which most of us tourist like. Hotel staff are super friendly and helpful. The only downfall is that it is close (a street away) from the most dangerous area in SF, the Tenderlion district is what they call it.

review.title: Nice Hotel Centrally located near Union Square
review.reviewText: The hotel and it's staff were truly excellent. My only negative comment doesn't really have anything to do with the hotel itself; rather, it has to do with the homeless people outside the hotel. Almost every time I walked in or out of the hotel there were people begging for money. It was a bit unpleasant and the beggars were in your face all the time.
review.positiveRemarks: Very modern décor, extremely clean and first class staff. Great bar!!! Very warm and intimate.
review.negativeRemarks: Front entrance security to keep the homeless people away from the guests.
review.locationRemarks: Good location within walking distance from Union Square.

review.title: beware - nightclub on site
review.reviewText: Unfortunately, we did not know there was a "hot" nightclub on the premises and had some late night noise issues.
review.locationRemarks: We had tickets to the Orpheum Theatre. We were able to walk (through a sketchy part of town) but took a cab back to the hotel.

review.title: Noisy, clanky room with an uncomfortable bed
review.reviewText: I had perhaps the worst night's sleep in a long time. The service elevator turned out to be right behind the room, and it clanked and groaned all night keeping me awake, emphasizing the fact that the bed sagged to the middle so I felt like I was sleeping in a bowl. Then I was woken first thing in the morning by service wanting to clean the room before I had even gotten out of bed. Altogether I ruinous experience.
review.negativeRemarks: Beds, elevator.
Bathroom tub and faucets need updating.

review.title: Good hotel close to shopping
review.reviewText: Perfect for our needs this trip we wanted to be central and this fit the bill

review.title: Hype and cool
review.reviewText: Really liked the hotel. I was with my girlfriend for 3 weekend nights. The hotel is hype and cool, the receptions suggest it's a very luxury moden hotel. Althoug the hotel bar is also luxurious and busy at night with well dressed late 20s and early 30s people, at least the standard room is not luxurious (plastic shower curtain for example), but they are indeed very comfortable, clean and cool designed.

review.title: Downtown SF - Hipster Elegant
review.reviewText:
I'm a little old for this place, but I love it. Great staff. Comfortable rooms. Convenient location.

It's worth it.
review.positiveRemarks: The crowd on NYE makes for great people watching.
review.negativeRemarks: Could not figure out why water temperature fluctuated so wildly while showering. Needs fixing.
review.locationRemarks: Theaters, restaurants, shopping, transport. It's all right there.

review.title: Chose this hotel singularly on the strong reviews
review.reviewText:
I needed to find a hotel in the city with no time to ask for references or do much research. I used Expedia to help find something based on my budget and requested date. The ratings based on the reviews were strong enough to pique my interest. The images of the property and the rooms were enticing enough to win over my reservation but I was still apprehensive until I pulled up to the curb. From that moment on the experience exceeded all of my expectations and my stay (albeit far too brief at only one evening) was worthy of the high praise. We didn't use all the amenities but the staff, hotel ambience and the room itself were the perfect compliment to a romantic getaway in the city.

From the valet and bell staffs to Colin at the front desk, the guest service was impeccable and the lobby and other public areas had the swank quirkiness and offbeat luxury one can only find in a boutique hotel. Our suite was expansive with a wonderful view (even from the seventh floor) and the bedding could only be described as heavenly. The only thing we hated was checking out at noon.
review.positiveRemarks: The location, staff, atmosphere, interior design and the room.
review.negativeRemarks: Since it was renovated, the bathroom was a bit cramped with a full-size tub and vanity leaving little room for proper positioning on the, ahem, throne
review.locationRemarks: Great location - near Market street with plenty of great shopping and dining nearby. Highly recommend nearby Bourbon Steak House for dinner.

review.title: Contemporary decor near Union Square
review.reviewText: While we really liked the hotel and were delighted with our free upgrade to an interior suite, the lack of a parking garage made it difficult for us as we rode in a motorcycle and had to search for a parking garage that would accept motorcycles. The decor is all modern and rather dimly lit throughout. There isn't a restaurant on site, but there is room service, a bar downstairs, and of course, there are many restaurants nearby. At 3 AM on our second night, the folks in the room next door returned and made a lot of noise; so the walls are not as soundproof as one would like.
review.negativeRemarks: We think it's wrong to charge for wi-fi. Also, the bed was not that comfortable and the sheets wouldn't stay tucked in.
review.locationRemarks: The Clift is next door to the ACT theater and just blocks from Union Square with all of its wonderful shopping.

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText: Room was small and the bathroom was dirty
Only negative was the hotel room walls were thin. Could here normal voice conversations in adjacent rooms.

review.title: Close to Union Square
review.reviewText: We were recommended by family to stay at the Clift, and we were not disappointed. The hotel is a 'boutique' style hotel and the facilities were excellent. The location of the hotel is ideal to explore San Fran, and it is very close to Union Square, the trolley bus ride, and downtown San Fran. All in all we were very pleased with the hotel and would recommend to friends.

review.title: Great hotel...close to Union Square.
review.reviewText: One of the best and most affordable hotels in the city. Everything is first class including the rooms, service and night life.
review.positiveRemarks: The Redwood Room is really cool. Beds are very comfortable. I can't imagine anyone being disappointed by The Clift.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.
review.locationRemarks: Walk to Union Square. Great sights and shopping.
parking lots around gearl and mason street is 32 dollors, good price compared to valat in hotel.

review.title: Close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Enjoyed it. Room was good. Room service was very expensive.
review.positiveRemarks: Close. Got in early. Stayed late. Helpful staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Room service too expensive.

review.positiveRemarks: Great location, very close to Union Square. Nice hotel bar, the redwood room, with a good atmosphere
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom needs updating badly.

review.title: A hotel with a lot of character.
review.reviewText: Our hotel stay experience was great. The staff is extremely helpful and friendly very welcoming. The hotel it self was antique looking older feel and look to it. Not quite my cup of tea since I like more of a sheek and modern look. However we had a great time no complaints. The redwood was nice and the drinks we great.

review.title: Lovely Hotel
review.reviewText: We were able to check in early on Friday which was great and the staff accomodated our request for a high floor since we had read that it could be noisy. Everyone was very professional and went out of their way to respond to our requests.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, wonderful style and lovely staff.
review.negativeRemarks: $52 per night to park is obscene. We went a few blocks away and got parking for half price. Wifi should be free anywhere. Come on, it is 2013.
review.locationRemarks: Just 2 blocks from Union Square and the cable cars. The Christmas tree and ice skating is right there as well as a mecca of shops.

review.title: Lovely Hotel
review.reviewText: We were able to check in early on Friday which was great and the staff accomodated our request for a high floor since we had read that it could be noisy. Everyone was very professional and went out of their way to respond to our requests.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, wonderful style and lovely staff.
review.negativeRemarks: $52 per night to park is obscene. We went a few blocks away and got parking for half price. Wifi should be free anywhere. Come on, it is 2013.
review.locationRemarks: Just 2 blocks from Union Square and the cable cars. The Christmas tree and ice skating is right there as well as a mecca of shops.

review.title: Convenient location.
review.reviewText: Friendly and efficient staff including security. Nice room, but small bathroom and poor lighting.
review.negativeRemarks: See aboveE
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location.

review.title: Great hotel - great location.
review.reviewText: Arrived very late - staff super helpful. Stylish/trendy interior.
review.positiveRemarks: Was mainly attracted by the Expedia 50% off offer. Got a loft room for US$160 a night. Absolute STEAL!

review.title: WONDERFUL!!!!! Hope to stay again.
review.locationRemarks: Fantastic location near everything you would ever want to do. Loved it!

review.title: 4 Nights in San Francisco
review.reviewText: While the hotel itself is an updated older hotel from the 1930's, the decor in the lobby is upscale however the room furnishings look more "Ikea" like. Bathroom is very small, but the shower was great. The water pressure was like a fire hose! There are no amenities, unlike most hotels and upscale motels these days, it was disappointing to have to pay $14.95 a day for really poor WiFi. The room service menu is over priced, $24.00 for a half dozen fresh baked cookies, as well as the liquor cabinet. The staff, including the occasional doorman was pleasant, and the wife appreciated the security personnel in their effort in keeping the riff-raff out. If you want me to stay there again, entice me with amenities. Make it worth my while to come back. Otherwise, it was more like just renting a room...could have been any room.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff were professional, building security, room was comfortable, great location just several blocks from Union Square.
review.negativeRemarks: This is 2013, why are we still paying for amenities? If you want me to stay there again, make it worth my while.
review.locationRemarks: Great location, cable cars and "F" line are within blocks, as well as Union Square. Walgreens and a liquor store right across the street!

review.positiveRemarks: Popular bar downstairs, nice sized room and nice view
review.negativeRemarks: NA. I just don't think I would recommend for a business traveler.
review.locationRemarks: Great location. easy walk to union square

review.title: The reason for low overall score.
review.reviewText: I was happy to get the reservation (through Expedia) - I needed a room at the last minute. The room and accommodations were lovely after I was checked in, however when I arrived Valet was supposedly full. I was very surprised and disappointed to learn that Valet was full for a guest! Another garage was suggested - but it was also full! I then called and spoke with the Concierge who fixed the problem for me. I was able to drop my car off at Valet after all, but this experience made me late for my event which was unfortunate. With everything I've heard about the Clift I thought a discount off parking would have been nice.

review.negativeRemarks: Did not like the purple paint in the hallways.

review.title: Very nice hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything. Location, service, decoration, furniture, comfort, etc.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: It´s in the middle of everything. You can go walking everywhere, and public transportation.

review.title: Excellent Hotel and great location!!!
review.reviewText:
Everything was perfect, the hotel, location, personal.
The only thing they need to renovate the rooms, still the same furniture 10 years ago!!!!
Definitively I will recommend this Hotel ,

Thx,

Ivo
review.negativeRemarks: Renovate rooms furniture
review.locationRemarks: Is the best in San Francisco, you are near all the interesting points

review.title: Disappointment
review.reviewText:
Fancy lobby , resto and a bar but the rooms themselves are more like 3 stars. Bathroooms are oldish and horrible.
Redwood bar was nice, bed was comfortable and I was allowed late check out which was ok.
Location is good.

review.title: for club partyers only
review.reviewText:
nicely located and trendy facilities but you need to know the lounge, breakfast and bar areas turn into a giant club on Friday and Saturday nights, which will shake you even in bed, unless you upgrade to a high floor.
Avoid anything below 6th floor if your intent is to sleep.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice breakfast buffet (26$ though), nice bar for a 6PM drink (watered down cocktails and $8 for peanuts).
review.negativeRemarks: a little smile on the staff, a more welcoming check in, no room check in on week end below 6th floor.

review.reviewText: Lobby is wonderful with a hipster chic vibe. Room was quite small, which influencesd my perception of value. Water pressure in shower was terrible.

review.title: Service above and beyond.
review.reviewText:
2nd stay at the Clift. Very service-oriented hotel. Front desk people printed boarding passes for us. Doormen recommended a much nicer ride to the airport for only $5 more than a standard cab.
Super comfy beds, understandable lights, shower controls, etc.
review.locationRemarks: Walk to Union Square, cafes, shopping of all kinds.

review.title: nice hotel...great lounge with great cocktails.
review.reviewText:
Checked in and our room was ready at 1pm! Front desk lady was a little cold but the rest of the staff made up for it.

We had drinks in the lounge before going for Dinner at Absinthe Brasserie - the hostess did an amazing job of describing the meaning behind the hotel's decor and history.

We came back to the lounge for drinks after dinner and enjoyed!
review.positiveRemarks: Lounge staff were amazing. Very friendly and knowledgeable.
review.negativeRemarks: Front desk staff was not very engaging or personable
review.locationRemarks: $10 cab ride to the wharf!

review.reviewText: We had a short but enjoyable stay. We were upgraded to a suite so we could check in a bit early to prepare for a wedding we were attending. It was a great room and we were thrilled.
review.locationRemarks: Near Union Square and Cable Car stops

review.title: The building is old and the room quality is poor
review.reviewText: The hotel is old and there is much better value out there. The rooms need to be updated to the 21st century.
review.positiveRemarks: The bar and restaurant are nice.

review.title: Gorgeous unique decor, superb service!
review.reviewText: This is the most beautiful and unusual hotel I've ever stayed in. While maintaining the integrity of the original building (circa 1913) it was redesigned into a stunningly, super modern retreat with fabulous lounges, romantic lighting, a spectacular redwood bar, gigantic ceiling height fire place in the lobby and furniture you wouldn't believe.. The rooms feature super comfortable beds, linens and silk curtains. The friendliest staff I've ever encountered, and a veritable army of great guys to get your car, or a taxi really quickly. Its near Union Square. All this and its moderately priced! You must stay there if you love beauty.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing that I can think of.
review.locationRemarks: Near Union Square, within walking distance to Chinatown, really excellent art galleries, and great shopping.

review.title: Best hotel to stay in Union Square San Francisco
review.reviewText:
After hearing about horror stories about bad hotel experiences in Union Square... you've heard them.. over priced... dirt... bad customer service... BED BUGS! I am VERY happy with my 4 night stay at the CLIFT!

The CLIFT offered friendly customer service.. the rooms were comfortable (I stayed in their loft) and the location is awesome! it's walking distance to everything in union square.

NO BED BUGS! this was the biggest worry since I heard so many people being attacked in various hotels around union square.

The rooms were really clean - but... there were small stains on the leather sofas... and on the carpet. The only fault of the CLIFT was the designer's choice in fabrics and materials. As pretty as it all looks, it's just NOT durable for a commercial use. Our bathroom was completely fitted with white tiles and white grout... and we all know how hard it is to keep white tile grouts looking clean! The same goes for their choice to have white leather sofas... yes ours had some stubborn stains.

The cleaning staff did a great job keeping our room clean... and made our stay really comfortable.

I would definately stay at the Clift again when I revist San Francisco!
review.positiveRemarks: Great design... Great customer service... Location
review.negativeRemarks: replace stained upholstery / carpets. Choose more durable materials and colors

review.title: Cliff Hotel
review.reviewText: Nice room but small for the price. Clean but shower did not work properly.
review.negativeRemarks: Bigger size and a nice cotton blanket instead of those over warm comforters.
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient to everything incl. theaters, stores and restaurants.

review.title: Oldest hotel in SF but very Stylish!
review.reviewText:
Stayed at Clift for 6 nights while exploring SF - it was a lovely place to come home to after being out all day exploring.
It is 2 blocks from Union Square so you could still be in the heart but away from it all as well, not too far from food options for all 3 main meal times, enjoyed the view of watching SF go from sunset to night time with all the lights.
Had a few different breakfast options and on the weekends their in house bars were buzzing.
We tried looking at budget accommodation but loved this place when we booked it online and would gladly stay there again on our next visit.
review.positiveRemarks: It had a bath tub - great to warm the body up after bone biting winds! The interior decorating - the staff were genuinely friendly.
review.locationRemarks: Les Ros Thai - THE BEST, Golden Gate Br, Fisherman's Warf, China Town, Haight, Union Square, shopping, Tram rides, Alcatraz, Botanical Gardens

review.title: great location
review.reviewText:
Hotel located in central down-town area, close to good down-town resto and clubs. Watch out if you walk west of Ellis street, there are quite a lot of bums over there, two blocs from the hotel.
overall good

review.title: staying at clift hotel in san francisco
review.reviewText: the hotel was great.. what I found disappointing was the luck of accessories in the room . for example even though we were 2 guests there was only one bath robe.. there was no pen or pencil in the room. there were no cosmetic suppluments like cotton pads fr the ears / face and no flip flops.
review.positiveRemarks: was centrally located, was nicely decorated and had a very nice bar
review.locationRemarks: location was great as it was very central.

review.title: Great location, fun bar!
review.reviewText: The hotel offers a great bar/ lounge with a fun atmosphere.

review.title: Great hotel near union square
review.reviewText: The hotel was pretty trendy, but right on the edge of the tenderloin area which is a bit rough

review.title: Clift
review.reviewText: We had a great experience the service was great rooms were clean drivers were great the hotel is in a great location. Would highly recommend the Clift hotel to anyone planninga trip to San Francisco

review.title: good location
review.reviewText: for over 500.00 a night there should be a coffee machine in room. Work out facilities had no water and then the next day no towels.

review.title: Nice hotel in Union Square San Fran.
review.reviewText: Eclectic hotel. One of several boutique hotels owned by this group.

review.title: Excellent cool trendy hotel in centre of city
review.reviewText: Was expecting noisy hotel with "cool" staff but the reality was quite the opposite. Stayed 10 nights and hotel was faultless. Excellent location. Received upgrade to suite as we stayed for 10 nights and the wifi was complimentary (though not the fastest).
review.negativeRemarks: Faster wifi. Rowing machine in the gym.
review.locationRemarks: Next to Union square in the city centre close to all the sights. Rent bikes from Blazing saddles on Mason 1 block away.

review.title: Right in center, close to Union Square.
review.reviewText: Hotel okay. No comparison to previous ownership by the Four Seasons. Lobby is dark and shady, reminds one of a bordello. Room okay; clean. Bathroom - tiny.

review.title: Cool & Location
review.reviewText: excellent hotel. only negative is the bathrooms which are very small. could use an extra shelf on the bathroom wall to put items. great bar. nice beds.

review.title: Dated and no frills
review.reviewText:
Stayed here for 2 nights. First room they gave me was tiny and v dated so they upgraded me to a better room. Still pretty standard. Carpet and walls are dirty and dated. Whole hotel needs a refurb.
Staff are nice but u get v little for your money in terms of service... no comp water in the room etc.
Would I stay here again? Probably not...

review.title: In a word: Claustrophobic
review.reviewText:
Great location. Love the Walgreens across the street. Theaters and Starbucks within spitting distance.

But:

The place looks like the “Shining” hotel redone

Someone has a big chair fetish in darkness
Expect to see a laughing Golum red with horns
when you turn your back
Is that trendy?
Pretensions yes of a hip crowd
An excuse to charge outrageous
Do they charge extra to change sheets?
It takes a phone call and
we’ll find out on checkout
What’s with the grey walls with blue or is it purple
Feels like the city jail

Now it’s not all bad
As long as you don’t put more than one in a room
That’s all the bathroom will accommodate

And economizing
Like half a roll of toilet paper
OK about the room
Great big bed, and creep around the walls
because that’s all there’s room for
and wall outlets, forgetaboutit
unless you crawl around on hands and knees
look behind the bed,
you might get lucky.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms and bathrooms need to be bigger. A redecoration would be in order with a softer, lighter atmosphere.
review.locationRemarks: About two blocks from Union Square. Easy walking distance to trolley cars and Market Street.

review.title: Comfortable Room Central Location
review.reviewText: A very nice hotel in central San Fran with some really out there decor which really added to the experience. Bathroom was tiny but functional enough, Bar and lounge are comfortable with a laid back atmosphere.

review.title: One night, perfect spot.
review.reviewText: Great location, quiet but close to everything, upscale without being showy. I hear the restaurant is great, didn't try it, and the room was comfortable and well appointed. I got a great price on Expedia.

review.title: NOT VERY CLEAN
review.reviewText:
LOCATION IS PERFECT!!!
HOUSKEEPING SERVICE WAS AWUFUL!! ROOM WAS DUSTY AND BATHROOM DIRTY EVERYDAY!!!...

review.title: Over priced even though it is nice
review.reviewText:
Good breakfast buffet, none the less too expensive. Courteous and efficient staff. Lacks sign outside that can be read while driving by, looking from the hotel. We had to circle around 3x before finally finding it.
Enjoyed and admired decor; the lobby chairs are fun.
All in all, too many $$$ for the stay, in spite of fun decor and nice room. Missing outdoor sign
a big negative.
review.negativeRemarks: Install a sign out side that visibly show the hotel name prominently enough so that you can spot it while driving and looking for the hote.
review.locationRemarks: Union square near by.

review.title: great lobby, terrible rooms
review.reviewText: eventhough the lobby looks beautiful and modern, the rooms look old and outdated. the bathrooms are full of scum and the tub is all chipped. The bar scene is pretty fun when downstairs, but a real nightmare when you are in your room trying to sleep. Overall a pretty mediocre experience for the price payed for the room.i think there are a lot of better options .
review.negativeRemarks: the rooms and the bathrooms

review.title: Excellent location, can rent bikes nearby
review.reviewText: We showed up and they found out we were there for our honeymoon so they upgraded us to an amazing corner view suite. Excellent staff, beautiful hotel. The only one complaint we had was that the room did slightly smell of smoke, since this most likely was a 'party suite' the weekend before and maybe people were smoking in it previously.
review.positiveRemarks: excellent staff, great fun bar downstairs. Nice gym facilities. love the style of the hotel

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText:
Good location, small room, but adequate. The thing that might make
Me return would be the staff. Good hotel but nothing special.

review.title: Trendy hotel if a little dirty flash
review.reviewText: Good hotel well located. Great bar downstairs. Rooms are a little tired and cheap
review.positiveRemarks: Even if you don't stay in this hotel the bar is well worth a visit. Very cool
review.locationRemarks: Well located close to everything

review.title: Disappointing.
review.reviewText:
Amazing looking lobby, bar and restaurant. However, the rooms do not live up to that standard. They are clean, modern and adequate. But you expect more from such a hotel. Room was very impractical. Virtually no storage space, only limited hanging space. No bedside drawers. WIFI was very poor quality and kept on cutting out, and it wasn't even free, you had to pay for it.
Staff were okay, but I think tried to be too cool for school. Rather cold and appeared not to be very experienced.
I was a disappointed with my stay and would not recommend it to anyone. You can pay less and get so much more in other hotels across the city.
review.positiveRemarks: Lobby area, bar and restaurant. Fantastic art deco design. Some of the staff were okay - lady at concierge and bar man. That's about it.
review.negativeRemarks: See my comments above.

review.title: Unexpected pleasure!
review.reviewText: After driving all day, realizing that the hotel has a very active nightclub was a bit of a turnoff. However, the manager took care of us and we ended up with a gorgeous room ! Staff was phenomenal..
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: By the airport, best location for singles..not families!

review.title: Old Dressed Up As Chic
review.reviewText: There must be better deals in San Francisco. The hotel was fine, but nothing special. The noise from Geary Street on the weekends can be a bit much. Be sure to get a high floor.

review.title: Nice Bar, good location.
review.reviewText:
Room was disappointing, bug on desk and dead bug in room. Bar very nice, next day breakfast lovely.
The bathroom very small old needs update, we will not stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathrooms really need update.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square and several Restaurants.

review.title: Art Deco Delight!
review.reviewText: Enjoyed having the excellent Bar and Dinning Room in the hotel.

review.title: Great hotel!!
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great area...cabs to most destinations weren't more than $7-$10. All staff were super friendly from the doormen to the front desk. We had a fantastic corner room that was bright and clean. Bed was comfortable. The place has great character with a little stairwells that provided quick access to our friends who were staying a floor below. We would definitely stay here again!
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, comfortable and in a great location
review.locationRemarks: Close to all of our desired destinations.

review.title: Overpriced and overrated.
review.reviewText: Rooms are very small and the entire hotel is really really dark. The bar was packed on Saturday night and had a line of about 100 twenty something's waiting outside. Was hard to even get into the lobby when we returned from dinner. The service was another disappointment. The doorman didn't want to help us get a cab to a crowded area of town so we were left to figure it out on our own. The bathroom was not cleaned well and there was trash left around bathroom wastebasket two nights in a row. Overall, not worth the price for us. The location was near Union Square but definitely on the edge of a questionable neighborhood.

review.title: Cool city escape
review.reviewText: Cool clientele, beautiful interior in the communal areas and the beds are beyond comfortable (the bathrooms could do with a little face lift if mine was anything to go by). The staff at the front desk could've been more welcoming on arrival - I had to ask about hotel amenities (gym etc) and wasn't offered any help with finding my way around the city (maps, offers of concierge help with restaurants etc) that I would normally expect of a hotel in this price bracket. Having said that, the staff in the restaurant and bar were exceptionally friendly and helpful and the Redwood Room is a must for anyone visiting the city.
review.negativeRemarks: Lack of spa and unfriendly front desk
review.locationRemarks: Great city centre location - 10min walk to the Ferry Building

review.title: Identity crisis
review.reviewText: Breakfast was very slow, waited over 45 min. for our meal. Concierge staff were amazing, all of their recommendations were excellent. There bar was empty but is still charging $325 to sit at a table, really? Overall I found the hotel trying real hard to be trendy, didn't work for me.
review.negativeRemarks: Bar and restaurant
review.locationRemarks: Great location

review.title: City chic hotel in a good location
review.reviewText:
Big rooms
Very trendy, popular bar downstairs
$15 for wifi for 24 hours - but free downstairs

review.title: Super cool with a GREAT staff
review.reviewText:
Sometimes super cool hotels mean that the staff is uptight and snooty, or sometimes also that they have trashed the antique property when they rehabilitated it. Not so with the Clift. The hotel is lovingly restored and really seemingly barely changed once you get upstairs. It's true the rooms are small, but efficiently laid out and the lobby is so comfortable that you just want to hang out there. We went down to the lobby for drinks or desert every single night we were there. The hotel sort of naturally encourages you to get out of your room and socialize, perhaps what was intended with old school hotels. And really, when you are visiting a city, do you want to sit in your room?

Extras were expensive, so we didn't get room service, or internet, and the base price seemed high to me. But ther service was impecable and they get an extra point from me for their respectful restoration of the property. Add to that the incredible Redwood Room, pannelled a hundred years ago from the boards of just one tree, the gorgeous lobby, and the great location, and for once, my hotel started to actually add a lot to my trip. Usually just a base camp for me, the Clift was more like a second home for a few days. Just fantastic!
review.positiveRemarks: Retro yet modern vibe, great staff
review.negativeRemarks: 18 dollar internet, five dollar coffee, 18 breakfast sandwich, every extra overpriced.
review.locationRemarks: Theatre district, central location to all SF.

review.title: Stay at Clift Hotel
review.reviewText: Overall stay was good - location of the hotel is excellent, very central. It has a nice lobby and a vibrant bar, but rooms are average. The bathrooms are older and need some work. For the price we paid for the room I would expect a nicer more upgraded room.
review.negativeRemarks: There need to be some improvements done to the rooms - the bathrooms are old, small and uncomfortable, furnuture is a bit old.

review.title: A great Boutique Hotel in downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText: A perfect location if you want to be city centre in San Francisco. The service was excellent and the renovation to an old building was done well. The room was a little tight but acceptable for the location.

review.title: Good location. Not too fancy.
review.reviewText: Felt like the hotel had a fresh coat of paint, but not too updated. The lobby and elevators were very dark. The bathrooms were small and the bathroom products that were provided were half-full. Location was convenient and staff was courteous and helpful. My room itself was light and clean.

review.title: First time experience: excellent Experience
review.reviewText: From the moment we arrived we were made to feel welcome. We loved the Philippe Starke interiors. Every member of staff was warm and friendly. One of the best all round hotel experiences I have ever had. We made a return visit within the month, the standard was maintained.
review.positiveRemarks: Excellent interiors. Superb rooms. First class food.
review.negativeRemarks: In my experience, nothing.
review.locationRemarks: Situated near Union Square. Perfect jumping off spot for everything to do in San Francisco.

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel, great location and extremely helpful staff. Very comfy beds. Only disappointment was being in a room with an adjoining door, so when neighbors returned at 2.30am intoxicated and behaving loudly, we could hear every word and action.

review.title: Excellent hotel near Union Square and cable cars
review.reviewText: Very nice -- staff very accommodating, polite and helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable beds, clean towels and quiet despite the nightclub downstairs.
review.negativeRemarks: More drawer spaces. More lighting in the lobby -- too dark at the present time. Club's liquor price - very expensive; good food though.
review.locationRemarks: Convenient to Union Square for shopping and business district for court and meetings, cable cars and clubs and many other touristy spots.

review.title: Tough area
review.reviewText: The beds are fabulous, the hotel has a great feel inside. But its location in the down and out area it is located made it depressing for me. The numbers of homeless is very sad.
review.negativeRemarks: the bathroom
review.locationRemarks: Poor

review.title: Good location, ultra modern decor
review.reviewText:
I've been to receptions atop this hotel in the Spanish Suite before so was familiar with the decor which is really cool and modern. This is the first stay since I'm normally at the Hilton or Nikko around the block.

The staff and hotel are great, but I was not informed that my room was on a smoking floor (5th floor) so upon getting off the elevator I could smell the cigarette smoke. I should have asked to be moved but I arrived late (3am) due to flight delays, and was only there one day (1.5 nights) and very little time at hotel or room since my meetings were at Hilton, I let it go. All in all, I'd recommend this hotel but just explicitly ask for non smoking if you're not a smoker.
review.positiveRemarks: The location and decor, and nightlife in their lounge late at night (cool "living" pictures on wall and people watching)
review.negativeRemarks: Tell guests if the floor is smoking and provide toothpaste (travel size) in room.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to Union Square, Cable Car, MUNI station (Powell), and around the block from Hilton and Nikko.

review.title: nice hotel close to everything is san francisco
review.reviewText: It was very nice stay , the staff special Ursula was very helpful she make me felt at home after i spoke with her thanks .....Hotel room was very nice i stay in floor 17 and 15 very nice view of the city

review.title: Can't go wrong
review.reviewText: I've been coming to the Clift for some years now and have always enjoyed a Spacious Suite. I love everything about this hotel; the service, the location, the ambience, the rooms. You really can't go wrong by choosing this hotel!

review.title: Great location to Union Square.
review.reviewText: Great location to Union Square. This hotel is situation in the perfect location. There is overnight public parking one block up by the Taylor Hotel for $30. The hotel is fine but it was too dark for our liking. The lobby and rooms are filled with weird art deco, modern furniture and a dark ambiance. Not bad ust not our cup of tea.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel is clean, nice staff, great location and the price was good.
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe improve on ambiance or décor style.
review.locationRemarks: Close to everything.

review.title: Great Experience, they gave us a free upgrade!
review.reviewText: Older hotel but very nice inside. Rooms are older but have good space and great views. They keep it classy at clift for sure.

review.title: Hotel remodeled since last visit.
review.reviewText: Hotel was dark and violet. all chairs in lobby were different, and uncomfortable. Bar was not open some of the time, or if it was, the doors were closed. Room was comfortable, and clean. No major complaints, but was not totally comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Decor

review.title: Very disappointed rooms and specially the bathroom
review.reviewText: good location old rooms and the smallest bathroom in the city. I book a superior room, and I check the two best room available and the bathroom were the same. Very disappointed.
review.negativeRemarks: rooms look and bathrooms

review.title: Great hotel experience!
review.reviewText: Loved the room and the service was excellent! Staff could not have been better! So glad I chose this place, and will definitely return.

review.title: Amazing!!!
review.reviewText:
The hotel is in a very good location, and looks like a night club. Almost every night u can have a good time in the Redwood room. With nice music and people.
The rooms and all the rest of hotel is nice.
Will come back soon..
review.negativeRemarks: Have a breakfast everyday
review.locationRemarks: The location is good. Just two blocks for the Union Square.

review.title: Wonderful Ambiance
review.reviewText: The Clift is the original trendy SF hotel and it is still among the best.
review.positiveRemarks: Great bar, great crowd, sexy rooms
review.negativeRemarks: They charge extra for internet access, that always bugs me
review.locationRemarks: Close to downtown, but away from some of the seedier blocks.

review.title: Customer Satisfaction
review.reviewText: Great Experience from start to finish. Room upgrade, friendly check in call, all around excellent customer service.

review.title: Great Hotel. Centrally Located.
review.reviewText:
Third or fourth time I've stayed at the Clift.

Very professional and helpful staff.

Can't beat location. Close to everything in the city.

Great hotel bar for a drink after a long day of work or taking in the city.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, Helpful and Attentive Staff and Best Hotel Bar in the city.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms look a little dated. $50 Valet.
review.locationRemarks: Central to everything. Union Square. Powell Station. Access to Van Ness (101).

review.title: Hotel in need of TLC
review.reviewText: We've stayed at the Clift multiple times over the years, including when it first opened, and have always enjoyed our stays. Love the lobby and the room decor but was disappointed this trip to see how it has slipped in upkeep. Our upper floor, corner room was lovely and the crisp white linens were perfect. However, the bathroom shower was mildewed, the faucet barely operational and the doorknob broken. Everything could use a freshen - rooms, elevators, lobbies, etc. We were also challenged in getting a late arriving suitcase delivered - though we made multiple calls to the front desk, they said it hadn't arrived. It took a lot of calls to the airlines and their couriers to find out that the it had been signed for by the hotel at 4:30 pm - when we called the desk again at 6:30 pm, they said it had just arrived!
review.negativeRemarks: Very, very loud music in the bar
review.locationRemarks: Ideally situated, close to Union Square, transit and city sights

review.title: Very hip and classy!
review.reviewText:
The hotel staff is great, had late night room service and it was always quick.
Breakfast is perfect!
Will definitely stay here every time I am in SF!
review.negativeRemarks: Vale is a little expensive overnight
review.locationRemarks: One or two blocks to Union Square, a perfect shopping location!

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: I booked this hotel because the last time I was in San Fran I found the bar to be fantastic and the lobby as well and expected the rooms to be nice also. I was greatly disappointed. Bed was very uncomfortable and way too soft. Bathroom very small, even for San Fran standards. Bar was cool, but the crowd wasn't of the same calibre as I remember it to be. The only plus was our concierge, Andrea. She is amazing at what she does. It was my husbands bday and I wanted to take him out for a nice dinner and the night before the concierge told us to go to scalla's, which is not a nice place. Andrea suggested 25 luxe and we thoroughly enjoyed our meal and the bar she suggested we go to afterwards. Oh and there are a lot of prostitutes hanging outside at night, looking for business. And we watched a guest bring one up. But I guess the hotel can't really do anything about that. I would suggest people go to their bar/hang in the lobby for drinks, but I wouldn't stay there again. The Westin it is for us next time.
review.negativeRemarks: Bed, bathroom, prostitutes
review.locationRemarks: Fabulous

review.title: Cool place to stay in San Francisico
review.reviewText:
Beautiful hotel, helpful staff. Great dinning. Perfect location for visitors to San Francisco.
The room was not huge, but comfortable as it is a a renovated historic hotel with a modern
interior.

review.title: Great location, service
review.reviewText: Will stay here again in SF. The staff was helpful and professional and the rooms were well-kept and stylish.

review.title: Stay Here
review.reviewText: Friendly service. Great lounge and bar. Two big thumbs up. Great value thanks to savings through Expedia!

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText: The service was fine. Our main concern was how nasty the bathroom was. They attempted to clean it but the grout in between the tiles throughout the entire bathroom was all missing and falling apart. We even upgraded to the nicest room in the hotel and it was the same problem.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom

review.title: Australian travelers - very happy with this hotel!
review.reviewText: Hotel was great. Very close to union square and gallaries. I have pretty high expectations when it comes to hotels, and was very happy.
review.negativeRemarks: Homeless people on the streets, but it doesn't matter where you go, good or bad streets, they're everywhere, which is sad.
review.locationRemarks: Good location

review.title: One of the best hotels in downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText: I stayed at a really bad hotel on my last stay, this was right across the road from the old hotel and it was a refreshing change. Staff were very helpful and attentive, room was clean and comfortable! Definitely recommend it!

review.title: Hot hot hot
review.reviewText: Upon arriving at the room we found it about 85 degrees. We turned on the air conditioning full blast and then left for our event for the evening. We returned to the room about seven hours later and found it was about 83 dgrees in the room! Then I tried to close the mini blinds on the window and found they would not close letting the light of San Francisco into the room all night and of course the sun light very early the next morning! This is an old hotel that has been fixed up, but obviously still needs some work. If I were to do it over I would try another hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Location to the event I was attending.

review.title: The best in SF
review.reviewText: The best in SF. Will be back everytime business brings me in SF

review.title: Wonderful service
review.reviewText: Great service from the staff - I was given complimentary tea while waiting for my airport shuttle.

review.title: I will Definitely stay again when I visit SFO
review.reviewText: The Clift Hotel is absolutely one of the Best Hotels in San Francisco! I will definitely stay there again! We felt very Welcome when we first stepped out of our car and entered into the Hotel. Everyone was super friendly and knowledgeable about areas in SFO where we were going, plus our room was very clean, comfortable and inviting. Stay at the Clift Hotel and ask for Ian, the manager at the front desk and tell him the girl from Arizona sent you! :)

review.title: Slightly disappointing
review.reviewText: The room was very small, could hardly walk around the bed. Bar was good and location was good. I have stayed in other Morgan's hotels (new York and Boston) and thought these were much better so was slightly disappointed
review.negativeRemarks: Room size
review.locationRemarks: Central to union square

review.title: Absolutely Superb
review.reviewText: I travel a lot (for business therefore stay in nice hotels) but this is one of the best hotels I've stayed, for both business and leisure. The staff (not one but all of them) are by far the most knowledgeable, friendly and helpful (actually useful!) I come across which makes the 10 days experience superb. The bed was extremely comfortable (so comfortable that I purchased the sheets and pillow cases afterwards and they do delivery). The food was fantastic (recommend short ribs!). Reasonable priced, great location. The shower wasn't the most modern designer piece but the hot water will warm you up in a second! The only compliant, if I there is any, is the street noise at night in down town San Francisco. All in all, absolutely superb.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff, believe or not. And the most comfortable bed.
review.negativeRemarks: street noise at night
review.locationRemarks: 10 minutes walk to union square, next to the theatre and several very interesting gallaries

review.title: Loveworn in spots
review.reviewText: I have stayed here several times, but mostly nearly a decade ago –– by now the bathrooms could use a retrofit – seems a bit overdue now. The lobby and social areas have held up pretty well from a design perspective (the bar is still popular, tho certainly not with .... erm... the same sort of people that kept it hip in the past ;-) ) Beds and linens still seemed pretty nice. Furniture and fixtures, while having performed honorably, are in need of retirement.
review.positiveRemarks: Location off of Union Square, is ideal, if near a few sketchy blocks
review.negativeRemarks: Bathrooms in need of retrofit and resizing. I can't imagine some of my fellow midwesterners would be able to use the toilets ;-)
review.locationRemarks: Theatres, straight shot to Union Square. Next door to Grand Cafe's yummy cassoulet. Late evening there are some ...aggressive... beggars in the area.

review.title: Stylish hotel, more happening than quiet.
review.reviewText:
The hotel is really nice. The sheets were nice and the room was comfortable. The bar downstairs was very nice and a great place to unwind as opposed to most hotel bars which are awful.

I was there for business and found the lack of internet to be annoying. $14.95 per day .. I found the decor a bit dark and the old walls a bit thin. I was jet lagged and even on the 9th floor, I heard sirens out in the street (just once, to be fair).
review.positiveRemarks: Nice sheets, comfy bed. Nice bar to unwind in.
review.negativeRemarks: The walls are thin and not noise proof.
review.locationRemarks: Good location, not great as it bothers a dodgy area.

review.title: safe door in sometimes sketchy SF
review.reviewText:
Chicken quesadilla (room service) is wonderful. One thing I find about SF is that it can be pretty sketchy especially at night. What I love about the Clift is the location is perfect for business, shopping, water, and the entrance is safe in that there is always at least one guy on the door to look out for me when I am coming or going.

And the fact that they are cute doesn't hurt either!
review.positiveRemarks: chicken quesadilla, incredibly good service at all touch points, wonderful front door experience (safe). Starbucks right across the street.
review.locationRemarks: perfect for union square (7 minute walk. Perfect for business (I had to get to embarcadero center and market street). great central and SAFE spot

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: Great experience. Great experience. Great experience. Great experience. Great experience.

review.title: Clift
review.reviewText: Great loation and staff very helpful and pleasant. Lounge and restaurant too expensive and service in lounge very poor Room fantastic and bed excellent

review.title: Trendy hotel with great location.
review.reviewText: This hotel is very well located, a few blocks from Union Square. The staff is great, kind and very efficient. The decoration is great, modern. The bar is superb, perhaps as swinging as their bar at the Mondrian in Miami (another Morgan hotel), after 5 p.m. if you are in a party mood go there. Our rooms were on the small side and the walls perhaps too thin to isolate all noise.The restaurant has a limited menu but the food is good and so is the service. All in all we loved the place.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, decoration, modern and jolly atmosphere.
review.negativeRemarks: Room size.
review.locationRemarks: Great.

review.title: Our stay at San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Andrea at the concierge/reception was very patient and helpful. She gave very good suggestions and was able to anticipate what we wanted.
The chambermaids actually a thank you note for tips that we left for them.
We were pleasantly surprised by the room upgrade.
review.positiveRemarks: Very spacious. Very funky. Every bit a boutique hotel should be.
review.negativeRemarks: The bed was too soft.
review.locationRemarks: Very centralized.

review.title: Great mini get away
review.reviewText: Enjoyed our one night stay to celebrate my husband's birthday. Centrally located among restaurants and bars.

review.title: Stylish quality in an iffy location
review.reviewText:
Very hip hotel just on the good side of Tenderloin. Don't venture more than 1 block South on foot. Room was clean, attractive, well supplied, and very comfortable bed. Walls are not sound proof - you can hear everything happening on either side of you. My shower had a slow drain, and I read other reviews with similar complaints.

There are better options for the business traveler and families, as this place caters to young hip singles, couples, and groups. If you can find the same rate at a place near Market St, might be a better choice. For example, there is no business traveler oriented breakfast service included in the rate. This is like the W with improved style and ambiance but fewer amenities.

Service was generally excellent, except for cocktail service in the Living Room (the lobby annex of the hotel bar, which itself is really more of a nightclub). Here, I often had to go hunt down the cocktail waitress. Once I ordered my first round, service was generally good thereafter. Same scenario on three trips though, so I take it this is their standard of service for greeting and taking your initial order. Snacks at the bar are very good though pricey. The warm pretzel braid and cheese plate are exceptional.

Recommend this place highly for young couples and groups who may place more emphasis on style than comfort.
review.positiveRemarks: The bed & hanging out in the Living Room.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise and location.
review.locationRemarks: Stay North and enjoy the proximity to Union Square.

review.title: nice bar
review.reviewText: expensive valet but very clean rooms and nice bar. .

review.title: Good location but dated.
review.reviewText: The bathroom was way too small and the lighting was bad. Room service meals were average. The hotel appears well worn. It was centrally located which I liked but had a dated feel...and not in a good way.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and there was a lively bar scene.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom
review.locationRemarks: It was central to everything!

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: I will always stay here. Loved everything about the hotel!!!
review.positiveRemarks: My room and the bar activity
review.negativeRemarks: Room service fee
review.locationRemarks: Ideal

review.title: Clift Hotel - viewpoint from couple
review.reviewText: Would return to the Clift in a heartbeat. Service surpasses anywhere we have stayed. The front desk, concierge and doormen staff were extremely helpful and courteous. They assisted us with tours, car rental and restaurant recommendations. Location excellent to all shopping and tourist experiences. Our room was very quiet, large and the beds/pillows extremely comfortable. Loved the minimalist decor and lighting.

review.title: my stay at the Clift
review.reviewText: Love staying here great atmoshmere and everyone who works here is very accomadating

review.title: Best in the City
review.reviewText: Fab. My favorite in the City. The hotel and the Redwood Room rock!

review.title: Fab!
review.reviewText: Fab!! My favorite in the City! The Clift and the Redwood Room. Wow.

review.title: Wonderful 10 day stay at The Clift!
review.reviewText: Wonderful 10 day stay at The Clift. Very trendy hotel with a super convenient location right next to union square. Staff were extremely helpful and the kitchen whips up some really superb food which you can order through room service. Love that they give complimentary WiFi and all the bellman and staff at the front desk look like models!

review.title: Disappointed. Not comfortable
review.reviewText: The interior design of the lobby and rooms is nice how ever the Bed and pillows were very uncomfortable and the sheets were cheap and felt like hard paper. The finishes in the bathrooms were below standard. Toilet wouldn't flush. cheap low pressure shower.
review.negativeRemarks: the comfort! Bed, pillows and sheets were horrible
review.locationRemarks: Horrible scary bad area. One of the most dangerous areas to be in the city!

review.title: Clift Hotel
review.reviewText: We arrived late into San Francisco on 29th Dec, the hotel was informed. However upon check-in, we were told that we had to take the last room on the 2nd floor as all the rooms in the category which we were booked into were full. The receptionist also mentioned that it was due to our late check-in which the hotel was duly informed. There was a room on the 14th floor but if we wanted to stay at that room, we had to pay an additional charges. So we stayed on the 2nd floor and we had a bad time trying to get to sleep. There was a group of people, at least 10 of them which obviously just got back after a party and continued their party in the room. They turned on the music, chatted, laughed and it was impossible to get to sleep. We had to call the security but it was of no use. This 'party' started from 5am and continued till 10am...It was ridiculous! We did not expect to spend our first night there like that.
review.locationRemarks: Convenient

review.title: Unfriendly. Will not stay again.
review.reviewText:
The staff was horrible. No one is in uniform apparel so you can't tell you is hotel staff

Valet service: No valet was present outside of hotel. One of us had to get out of the car, walk into the hotel and ASK where the valet was.

Doorman: Doesn't open the door, EVER.

Room: Drab and dull. The shower was backed up so your feet were standing in 3 inches of water while showering, which is gross. Toilet pressure was low so you had to flush numerous times.
review.locationRemarks: around the corner from the Tenderloin so there's druggies walking around the location

review.title: Great for young couples
review.reviewText: I really like the hotel. It is really nicely decorated and has a great ambiance. My only problem with the hotel is how unbelievable thin the walls are. You could literally hear everything that was going on in the hallway and in other rooms. Things i am certain other guests would not want you to be hearing. We had to make sure to keep our voices down. Otherwise, staff was friendly, the lounge is really fun, and the location of the hotel is excellent.
review.negativeRemarks: noise level
review.locationRemarks: centrally located

review.title: Excellent Stay
review.reviewText:
absolutely loved The Clift. Super trendy, comfortable, excellent attention to small details. We stayed on the 6th floor and our room had mirrored walls on opposite sides - very interesting ;-) The bathroom is marble and mirrored as well.

The decore of the hotel is modern and very tastefully done. The bar is excellent as well. Def. would love to stay here again.

Location: right near the union square. walking distance to Soma and Hays Valley and China Town.
review.negativeRemarks: none
review.locationRemarks: super convenient

review.title: Great downtown elegance
review.reviewText:
Great hotel room. The bed, the pillows the comforter are all amazing. Never want to leave the room.
Convenient location, in easy walk to union square.
review.positiveRemarks: The bed. The bed. The bed.
review.negativeRemarks: The room rates
review.locationRemarks: It's in downtown. Proximal to the tenderloin and all things skeevy.

review.title: Overly pretentious,comfortable but fun
review.reviewText: Overly pretentious but cool in a trendy way. Staff were very friendly, helpful and quickly remedied mistakes made. Good location for many attractions walking or local transport.

review.title: A fun, fresh, friendly hotel in a fabulous locale
review.reviewText: Everyone from the valet staff who greeted us at the curb, to the front desk staff, the Redwood Room staff and the housekeeping staff were friendly, professional and helpful. The hotel's decor is funky, fun, fresh and lively. A fabulous renovation of a historic hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The art, the ambience, the friendly, professional staff.
review.locationRemarks: Two blocks from Union Square

review.title: Great hotel, poor room service quality
review.reviewText: Wonderful hotel in many ways, but room service -- food taste, quality, and condition -- were subpar for a hotel of this caliber. Very disappointing on a cold and rainy night when we wanted to stay in and enjoy the comfort of the room.

review.title: Not the hotel you remember!
review.reviewText:
Other than hunting for hotel in heavy rain and traffic ( no sign on exterior except for a 16x10 inch unlite sign by the recessed front door). Once inside the eclectic lobby, all was well. Our room was on a corner with views of nob hill and Geary looking toward union square.
Room was well appointed....again in eclectic style and colors. Certainly a BIG change from the previous Clift of the 60's.
Hotel staff was friendly and efficient. I would recommend checking in early to avoid traffic and congestion on theatre nights.
review.negativeRemarks: Finding it.
review.locationRemarks: Great spot for walking to Union Square, shopping and local pubs. Went to Sunday Mass at Notre Dame de Victories about 6 blocks from hotel...beautiful.

review.title: Recent stay
review.reviewText: Nice hotel in a good location of city. Bathroom and carpeting in room a little long in the tooth. Staff was very helpful.

review.title: Great hotel for location. A genuine hot spot.
review.reviewText: I've been to the Hudson Hotel in NYC so I was familiar with The Morgan Hotel Group and style of hotel. The Clift is a fabulous boutique hotel with charm and style in a perfect location! The staff is incredibly friendly and courteous and helpful. The beds are luxuriously comfortable and the rooms are sufficiently appointed. The bathroom was a bit dingy and I felt it could have been a little cleaner. There were hairs and grunge before we even used it. That said, I love the hotel and would definitely stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: The lobby and The Red Room.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness of our bathroom.
review.locationRemarks: Ideal location. Shopping and restaurants at your fingertips.

review.title: Elegant and affordable
review.reviewText: Until discovering the Clift, we used to try different hotels in the Union Square area, as there are many to choose from. Now we just watch Expedia for a good price and book the Clift! The common areas of the hotel are beautifully designed with many unique features. Everything is big and spacious, including the rooms. The concierge staff can find anything you might be looking for in San Francisco.
review.locationRemarks: Two blocks to Union Square. Close to theatres, restaurants and shopping.

review.title: great for girls to stay
review.reviewText:
IT was great.
The location, staff, and room itself were what I was exactly looking for.
Clift has the most popular bar in the first floor. If you have a key, you do not have to wait in line to get in.
review.negativeRemarks: staff elevator was right next to our room
review.locationRemarks: location was great. It was in the middle of the city.

review.title: Hip Hotel in Cool City
review.reviewText: Loved the spacious room we had with a view. Staff was attentive and pleasant. Redwood Bar is/was the bomb.
review.locationRemarks: Convenient to everything. We easily walked to the Embarcadero and North Beach from there.

review.title: Not quite happy with customer service.
review.reviewText: The customer service in the morning was under par. Late in the night, we ordered a single scoop of ice cream, and was charged almost $20! The person who delivered it said to talk to front desk in the morning. When we did, she wouldn't do anything about this morbidly high and unconscionable charge, we requested a manager to call us and he took care of it within a minute. The front desk personnel should be more empathetic about customer satisfaction, especially when the situation is so blatantly wrong.

review.title: Expedia proces only! great location.
review.reviewText:
Great location. Nice rooms, get a high floor for more quiet.
Nice club in the hotel, but also a lot of places to eat, drink, shop and etc. all around.
Expensive parking, find your own around the block.
Prices in expedia got me between 30-50 % off!!! and a free internet connection (15$ worth).
Recommended for all (although not so sure about families and kids cus I don't have them)
review.negativeRemarks: old toilet mechanism (toilets are clean and good) , missing some room perks
review.locationRemarks: clubs. bars, food (diners, burgers, thai, indian, everything), walking distance to many attractions and shopping areas.

review.title: Great place to stay for conventioneers & travelers
review.reviewText: My wife and I attended the GreenBuild 2012 conference (November) in San Francisco. Our experience at the Clift Hotel was outstanding. We spent 5 nights in Standard King room which is compact; we adjusted and would stay in that size room again. A couple traveling with 3-4 large pieces of luggage should consider a larger room. The room and the hotel common areas, restaurant, restrooms...every area impecably clean! The bed was so comfortable that we had a great sleep the first night! Every hotel employee was friendly, helpful, courteous and made sure that our needs were met. The food in the restaurant was excellent; one morning I had steak and eggs and the steak was so flavorful and melted in my mouth. The house-baked granola was outstanding and the coffee was better than any that I can get at Starbucks. It's about a 10 minute downhill walk to Muscone Convention Center. About 4 minute walk to Union Square. Lot's of good places to eat outside of the hotel. Try Cafe Mason (one minute walk# for excellent service, food and fair pricing. Room service is 24 hours but hotmeals stop around 1:00 AM #?) and start again at 5:00 AM. Regarding electronics we were traveling with 2 iPads, 2 cell phones, a separate digital camera and a piece of medical equipment. I'm glad that I brought two extension cords and a powerstrip with me. We loved this hotel and the people. We will definitely stay at the Clift during our next visit.
review.positiveRemarks: The people! The cleanliness! The architectural style and grace of this old but renovated hotel. The etched-glass bar top is a piece of art.
review.negativeRemarks: One or two additonal and easily accessible electrical outlets would have made it more convenient to charge batteries etc. Take a power strip.
review.locationRemarks: Convenient to Moscone, shopping, eating. Safe...away from the seedy side of the town.

review.title: A total scene...if you're into that.
review.reviewText:
The location is GREAT. Super close to shopping, bars, restaurants and mass transit.

I would recommend this hotel to singles, young-ish couples and those looking to party. The bar/lobby area starting around 9pm turns into a scene. It isn't a club, it just sounds like one. There isn't any dancing, but mostly people just hanging out and if you can get a drink...drinking. As a guest you need to carry your key-card everywhere since security is constantly asking to see your room card (even if you've seen them just a minute before).

The service is spotty. Check in can take a while since the bar crowd spills out into the lobby and guests use the front desk as a cocktail area. There was only 1-person at the front desk.

The concierge in the mornings are great at recommendations and pointing you in the right direction.

The rooms are nice and clean.

review.title: Best SF hotel for the young hip and chic
review.reviewText:
Found the best price for the Clift via Expedia mobile!
Love the hotel and its truly the best hotel in SF! Great beds, clean, fun night life in the comfort of the lobby. No taxis required!!
review.locationRemarks: Close to Powell BART station.

review.title: Hip hotel for the business minded networker
review.reviewText: The Clift has Very youthful chic.feel about it. The rooms are tight but clean, stylish and the bed is comfy; the pillows fabulous!! 'The Red Room' is such a classy,hip lounge to people watch and socialize, so you know when 'The Red Room' is just downstairs that you won't have to go far for happy hour, a night cap or a whole evening with friends or soon to be friends.
