Just a few blocks from shopping and central to all that San Francisco has to offer,
review.positiveRemarks: pillows!! ahhh and The Red Room
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom was very small

review.title: Terrific location for theatre go-ers!
review.reviewText: We appreciate the convenience of walking from the Clift Hotel to nearby theaters and restaurants. Staff, without exception, was very friendly. We had a very good breakfast in the Velvet Room.
review.negativeRemarks: lack of information in the room about the hotel restaurant and other nearby attractions
review.locationRemarks: ideal for theater and restaurants

review.title: Classy Clift
review.reviewText: Very stylish and comfortable hotel in a great location. Pleasant but unobstrusive staff. Bathrooms a little on the small side but functional and clean.

review.title: Wonderful staff
review.reviewText: The hotel was having a private Halloween party the night we were staying. One of the major people on the staff supervising the party saw us come back from dinner, made sure we were given arm bands and were able to visit the party for as long as we wished. It was a much fun. All of the staff were especially friendly and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: They did charge for internet access.
review.locationRemarks: The location is great -- easy walking to wonderful restaurants and shopping.

review.title: Hospitality at its best
review.reviewText: Ursula at the front desk was perfect. Helpful and polite. All front door men were pleasant.
review.positiveRemarks: Radio in room and velvet room

review.title: Great Hotel for Couples and Business Travellers
review.reviewText: We liked this hotel. Superb location near Union Square. Very stylish decor. Excellent restaurant.
review.negativeRemarks: No swimming facilities
review.locationRemarks: 2 minute walk from Union Square.

review.title: Hip, clean, fun place to stay
review.reviewText: Recently I stayed in 3 hotels in 3 days, in the San Francisco area. The Clift was the best. I loved the location. The room was large, the quality of bedding and linens was superior. I will definitely stay here again, and I will recommend it to my friends.
review.negativeRemarks: Low light in lobby
review.locationRemarks: Loved being close to Union Square

review.title: For the money, go elsewhere.
review.reviewText:
For the price, this hotel was very disappointing. It used to be one of the city's best.
Public areas are darkened, for no good reason. Main room is just adequate, bathroom so small that you cannot sit on the toilet with any comfort. There are no amenities of the kind available in other quality hotels: no newspapers, no tea or coffee in the room, and there is a charge for local calls.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom, darkness, lack of amenities.
review.locationRemarks: Fine.

review.title: Great location, great bar, good rooms
review.reviewText:
The Clift has a great bar, a good restaurant and the rooms are very nice – mine had huge mirrors on opposite walls, creating a nice optic illusion. The bathroom was small though, and the tile over the bath tub as well as the bath fixtures looked quite old.
The thermostat in the room didn't see to work very well though.

review.title: Wonderful hotel in the heart of San Francisco
review.reviewText: Except for the size of the bathroom, everything about the hotel is excellent. I will definitely be back.
review.positiveRemarks: Ths staff were attentive without being intrusive.
review.negativeRemarks: the size of the bathroom.
review.locationRemarks: Location is optimal for shopping sightseeing and art gallaries.

review.title: My experience...
review.reviewText: Would just recommend that you call the hotel 2 days prior to arrival and do NOT stay on the 2nd floor. The hotel has a night club which the music sounds like its coming right under your bed. Sharp looking hotel, great service, food was good. The lounge was very nice but if you want to sleep I would suggest 4th-15th floor. Location was great but area is diffidently pricey, as they say "you pay for what you get". Would recommend to take a bike ride around the city for the day.
review.negativeRemarks: The busy night club.

review.title: Just Ok.
review.reviewText: Ok. Nothing special. The hotel is pretensions overall for no reason.

review.title: Hotel ok with terrible front desk.
review.reviewText:
Hotel is ok, decoration is good, concierge is excelent. But the front desk posture is very arrogant and rude. The people in the front desk treat the guests with huge arrogance, as if they were doing the guests a favor.
It was my second and last time at Clift Hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: The front desk treatment
review.locationRemarks: Location is ok

review.title: Clift SF
review.reviewText: Very nice, clean hotel in SF. Clean room, serviced daily - no cuts, missed days.

review.title: Style over substance
review.reviewText:
While it has a fantastic location, my overall impression is that the Clift is all about image & lacking a little in quality & upkeep.
My experience was one of very thin walls, small bathrooms & some basic maintenance issues like tatty blinds & bathroom sealing that needs attention.
Also for the price I expect to be able to make a cup of coffee in my room & who can get away with charging $15 per day for wifi anymore? Starbucks across the street is making a killing as a result of the Clift's odd choices.

review.title: Cool looking - ok rooms - bad valet!
review.reviewText: The hotel had a great vibe and ambiance. The bar was fun at night and has a great decor. We did valet parking through the hotel which was $50 and when the car was returned to us we notices it had been vandalized while in valet parking. The back area was scratched when someone tried to take the car's emblem off. They took two of the letter and scratched the surrounding area pretty bad. While it was a nice hotel I don't think the room itself is worth the money. We had a 'superior king' room and it was quite small.
review.negativeRemarks: The room and valet parking
review.locationRemarks: Good area

review.title: Opinion
review.reviewText: Nice location. Good effort to make dated hotel more modern.

review.title: Excellent hotel close to Union Square.
review.reviewText: Very helpful and friendly staff. Quiet hallways.The decor was beautiful. Excellent brand of shampoos. Comfortable beds.

review.title: A definite stay
review.reviewText: It was a good hotel, people were attentive and helpful, I really do recommend it, everything overall was great.
review.positiveRemarks: Amenities, toiletries, size of my room
review.negativeRemarks: Wifi costs, and there was a bit of noise near my room from who knows what
review.locationRemarks: It's downtown yet only problem was near the Tenderloin but right next to Union Square also, so definitely in the middle of it all

review.title: Perfect Location!
review.reviewText: The room was absolutely beautiful. Very comfortable mattresses, amazing decor, very clean. I LOVED the shampoo/conditioner and body wash - I just HAVE to look up the brand. Steve, one of the concierges, was so helpful and plotted out areas of the map to visit, where to avoid, what cable cars/buses to take, etc. The only thing I wish they had was a complimentary continental breakfast, considering the price per night. There's a Starbucks right across the street though, so that wasn't a big deal. The doormen were also very sweet and helpful. We were given the royal treatment! Such a great stay - location, service, room - I was pleased with everything!
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, beautiful room, awesome service.
review.negativeRemarks: No complimentary continental breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square, all the shopping and great restaurants. Check out Taylor Street Coffee Shop, just a few blocks over. You won't be disappointed.

review.title: Great place to stay!
review.reviewText: Great location and amazing staff! Everyone from concierge, to front desk, bellmen, housekeeping... all responsive and friendly. Room was very nice, very comfortable and very clean. Bar is one one the places to be on a Thur, Fri or Sat night. Can't wait to go back!
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was amazing and very helpful!
review.negativeRemarks: Water pressure in the shower, not bad though.
review.locationRemarks: Great location.

review.title: Lovely hotel with a difference
review.reviewText:
it had been a while since I booked it and I had forgotten what to expect from the reviews but it was a very pleasant surprise- very different but smart: to explain the hotel is actually quite dark in the lobby with the biggest chair ever, some very unusual furniture & the rooms were full length mirrors covering 2 walls.
Not really a place to hang out with kids but as we were out all day for our 3 days our children were more than happy with the room.
Rooms were lovely, good airconditioning/heating (yes in July it is cold at night in San Fransisco).
staff helpful- not the most outgoingly friendly but no complaints.
The location of the hotel was superb for union square/cable cars (2minute walk) - would advise anyone staying to get a travel pass from Powell St so you can use the trams, buses & bart. We felt perfectly safe walking at night from the hotel.
Taxi from the airport to the hotel was about $45 dollars but the driver charged us $2 extra for each suitcase. Clifts hotel is within walking distance from the bart (underground train) but it would have cost us about the saem for a family of 5.
Food in the hotel was expensive- I am not sure if there was a restaurant- we ate out in the many restaurants around. There is Starbucks opposite if you want a coffee (no tea/coffee machine in the room which was a shame). Plenty of places to eat breakfast roundabout too but be warned- by 9.45am they get very busy.
review.negativeRemarks: reception staff could have been more welcoming
review.locationRemarks: central and great location for transport- public transport is great in SanFransisco

review.title: Great Place to Stay
review.reviewText: Great location, friendly service people, clean room, great elevators and great mattress.
review.negativeRemarks: no phone book in room, no sheets to cover yourself only cover on bed, no pens, no tv guide, no refrigerator or microwave
review.locationRemarks: A Walgreens is across the street in case you need anything. Lots of eateries, theaters, bus stops, union square, great shops and its a safe area.

review.title: Great place to stay in San Francisco!
review.reviewText: While we had a wonderful experience, we were surprised the hotel charged approx. $15 a day for wifi. There were other places close by we could get wifi, but it was a huge inconvenience.
review.negativeRemarks: No free wifi
review.locationRemarks: Location was perfect for us, but we really liked walking....staff was more than willing to get us a cab.

review.title: I love the Clift!
review.reviewText:
Favorite hotel in sf.
I wouldnt necessarily say bring the whole family, but it is awesome.
redwood room is cool. Just love the Clift.

review.title: As good a hotel as you will get.
review.reviewText: One of the best hotel experiences I've ever had the pleasure to stay in. Spotless hotel with superbly friendly staff in great location.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff, cleanliness, location, stunning rooms and the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in - including my own!
review.negativeRemarks: Only minus would be the high wifi charges. Maybe free 15 or 30 mins in the lobby area would be great just to get quick info / emails etc
review.locationRemarks: Faultless. 2 mins from union square and the main Powell St BART line and cable car line.

review.title: service like it should be.
review.reviewText: not looking for this review to be made public with any of the things I think should be improved on but do want to commend the concierge Andrea and the bellman Kaleb -not sure if I am spelling correctly. Excellent service and it needs to be noted when people do their job but do it very well!

review.title: Stellar customer service!
review.reviewText: I had a very pleasant experience at Clift. The staff made my stay even more enjoyable, it was evident that they really enjoy their jobs! Stellar customer service from the door, front desk, and housekeeping. Although the room was smaller than what I am accustomed to, my overall experience way very positive!
review.positiveRemarks: The location and the entire staff!
review.negativeRemarks: The size of the room and bathroom.
review.locationRemarks: Great location. Close to shopping, public transportation, and dining.

review.title: Great find
review.reviewText: This staff, and hotel, goes out of its way to see that you are completely satisfied, from not charging for a meal you don't like to ensuring you get yet another free one you do...from my experience the entire staff was excellent and the location is good. Would definitely stay there again.
review.locationRemarks: good location...only a few blocks from major locations such as china town, union square, etc.

review.title: Horrible service, don't check in late
review.reviewText:
Terrible hotel experience. I was in SF for a one-night business trip. I called a few days ahead of my stay to confirm and to request two things: foam pillows and a higher-floor room as I know the bar can get noisy. I emphasized that I would arrive late and that I would really appreciate a room where I'd be able to sleep peacefully. I am a very frequent guest of the Morgans Hotel Group, although I have only stayed at the Clift 2-3 times before.
I arrived at midnight and was given a tiny, run-down room on the second floor and told I was "lucky" to have that as the hotel was sold out. (Lucky? I had a reservation for which I certainly would have been charged had I not shown up.) Of course the pillows were down. The noise from the bar was very loud through closing time, and the room's window faced directly onto the terrace of the building next door, rendering it very dark and confining. I awoke to the sound and visual of someone literally walking past my window three feet away from me.

On this visit I found this hotel definitively past its sell-by date and the staff incredibly rude: the equivalent of a $150/night fleabag down the street. Despite the lovely public spaces and the very nice suites, I won't be back.

review.title: AWESOME Hotel
review.reviewText: The staff was extremely friendly and courteous. The hotel was clean and the decor was very pleasant. The only thing that could upset some is that we had an adjoining door to the room next door which made privacy very limited. Our neighbors weren't there very often and were very respectful when they were so this did not upset us.
review.negativeRemarks: The adjoining door and limited privacy
review.locationRemarks: The location couldn't be better. Right downtown and next to everywhere we wanted to go.

review.title: Great weekend in San Fran!
review.reviewText: Great location. Attentive staff with excellent concierge service (thanks Andrea)! Comfortable rooms with fun decor. Beautiful Redwood Room Bar, but the bar staff is way too Las Vegas and not enough San Francisco. Every time I stay here I find it difficult to get drink! Still a great hotel though!
review.positiveRemarks: Location, excellent Overall service, great concierge staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Service in the redwood room.
review.locationRemarks: Great location! Easy to get anywhere in town.

review.title: Birthday trip
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was great and helpful. For the price of the hotel I would expect more in room amendities ie a fan in the bathroom, dresser or an additional storage furniture, free wifi.
review.negativeRemarks: Room amendities
review.locationRemarks: Great central location for downtown San Fran

review.title: The Clift in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The Clift is in a central location close to Union Square In San Francisco. The room was very quiet and extremely clean. We enjoyed our stay and will return. However, the bathroom is small and our room had the shower was over the bath.
review.positiveRemarks: The central location and the helpful staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Small bathroom.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent

review.title: San Francisco + Clift = romance, charm and comfort
review.reviewText:
I loved the hotel for its dark, romantic ambiance as well as its location. I took the BART from the airport to the Powell station which cost about $8. The hotel was only a few blocks away (uphill and through crowds of tourists but easy enough to roll my luggage. They honored my request for an early check in (about 4 hours early but was on a Wednesday). The low lighting fit the decor but also hid imperfections due to the age of the building. The staff (including front desk, bartenders and housekeeping) were all very pleasant and seemed to cater to their guests as much as possible. The bed was comfortable and the infinity mirror made me wish I wasnt traveling alone, although it would have been easy to pick someone at the bar since many people were solo and lonely. The cocktails were well made and average around $15 per mixed drink or glass of wine. The exercise room has just 8 aerobic machines but there were never more than 5 people in the room anyway.

There are many restaurants within walking distance as well as excellent shopping and a starbucks across the street. The hotel provides a "weak" but free coffee station every morning. I loved the Ipod docking station since I had forgotten my charger.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel is covered in a unique blend of contemporary flair and antique Redwood which is priceless and difficult to obtain.
review.negativeRemarks: There is nothing I can really complain about.
review.locationRemarks: I was surprised there were beggars on every corner in the touristy areas of SF.

review.title: Great place to stay in SF!
review.reviewText: Clift is in a great location, right by Union Square Park in the shopping district. The hotel bar was great. It gets very crowded there from Thursday through Saturday. The only downside is that wireless internet was not free..it's 15 dollars a night, which adds up if you're there a week. I'd definitely recommend it though!

review.title: Clift Hotel San Francisco
review.reviewText:
This is an outstanding hotel in San Francisco. The quality of the rooms and the way they are maintained is excellent.
Staff are helpful.
The hotel is close to Union Square ie within a few minutes walk and also has a number of excellent diners available for breakfast through to evening meals.
The only real issue we had with the hotel is that they do not offer free internet, nor is breakfast included.
Apart from these two niggles the hotel is outstanding and we would strongly recommend it.
review.negativeRemarks: No internet or breakfast included in the rate
review.locationRemarks: Excellent

review.title: San Frantastic
review.reviewText:
What a cracking chic boutique hotel

The suite was fantastic with generous space and city scape view on two sides

The staff were very helpful and courteous

The only downside, the couple in the room next to us who came back in the early hours - drunk and very loud, I could hear they're 5 minute sex session, followed by laughter for 10 minutes and vomiting by both for 20, nice...)

This wouldn't deter me from re-visiting as the scoundrels were reprimanded after complaint - a tip of the hat to the guys at the desk

A definite thumbs-up!!

review.title: Great romantic getaway! Eclectic, chic, warm..
review.reviewText:
The sheer ambience and location won my heart over. The common areas are eye can't and deliver on the unique, boutique, experience. I travel often with my boyfriend and this hotel really set the mood for romance! I can hardly say small room size was a problem because that is typical for San Fran.

Even in the summer, the fire pit was dreamy! It does stay cold enough for that fireplace!

The only reason I took off points for this hotel was:

1. BATHROOM: Extremely outdated to a point where proper functionality was being compromised. How embarrassing is it that I had to call maintenance to plunge a couple sheets of toilet paper? buzz kill. Also, no oo-ahh spa shower experience. Very disappointing! We did, however, enjoy the neat soaps:shampoos. ((cilantro, rum, etc)

2. HOUSEKEEPING: The after hours house keeper was very rude. An unexpected item was needed at a very late time and even the $5 tip wasn't enough to wipe off this lady's irritated expression! I wasn't about to find a cab at 3am for emergency tampon..
review.positiveRemarks:
Favs: Ambience, decor, high quality, fire place in lobby, warm
- excellent privacy.. thick walls!
- Just beautiful hotel!
review.negativeRemarks: Ugh: bathrooms... seriously behind and are majorly in need of a facelift.
review.locationRemarks: Next door to Starbucks! One block from AVIS! One block from Union Square! Interior rooms are great too!

review.title: Good for couples
review.reviewText: Very good staff and comfortable bed and like impressive desgin

review.title: Unique Hotel Design
review.reviewText:
This hotel is wonderfully different in design. Also, the staff could not be better! We were treated superbly every day by everyone. It is also located nicely in the center of downtown. Very easy to get to everything from there. I would say the helpfulness of the staff is their shining star. They were wonderful.

The only drawback I saw was the lighting in the bathroom as well as the lack of a vent fan.

Great place!
review.positiveRemarks: The uniqueness of the design and the staff.
review.negativeRemarks: The lighting in the bathroom and the lack of a vent fan in the bathroom.
review.locationRemarks: Great downtown location, also close enough to get to all the sights easily.

review.title: This Hotel Rocks!
review.reviewText:
This hotel rocks.
The room service is outstanding.
The studios are the best deal -- 775 sq feet!

review.title: Different to the other hotels
review.reviewText:
Really good hotel and different to some of the other chains of hotels. The Redroom Room was something to see. Also interesting furniture including Dali. Wifi rates reasonable as it included more than one device. Free wifi would be better.
On downside is the location although very central and ideal, you have to be careful if you travel a few blocks away from the main areas. But this is the same for all the major downtown hotels. However on three blocks from Union Square and the Powell St Cable car.
review.negativeRemarks: Neighbourhood can be challenging at night

review.title: Chic, classy hotel, fun place to stay
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, classy, great bar onsite. Lots to do within walking distance or a quick cab ride. Room was nice except for the bathroom. Bed was very comfortable, well-stocked mini-bar, room was spacious. Decor inside/outside the room was very chic and interesting. The bathroom, however, was very small. The toilet is wedged between the wall and the pedestal sink. You really don't have a lot of room to move - it's awkward. The shower dumps a lot of water out at once; so much water that part of it does not come out of the shower spout, it comes out of both the shower spout and bath spout. The tub would fill up some while showering. Despite the bathroom inadequacies, I would stay here again. A bit expensive, and valet parking ran me $57, so beware. But keeping in mind it is San Francisco - I don't know that there is anywhere that will be that nice and also be cheap.
review.negativeRemarks: The tiny bathroom
review.locationRemarks: Located centrally downtown

review.title: Nice romantic hotel
review.reviewText: Great concierge staff, all of the staff were outstanding. The bar area is beautiful. We went on our 25th anniversary and loved it.
review.locationRemarks: Downtown

review.title: Clift Hotel, SF
review.reviewText: The hotel was quirky and modern. It had a fabulous bar that felt more like a night club than a hotel. The rooms were clean, well furnished, and had huge soft beds.

review.title: Awsome Hotel
review.reviewText: Very happy with the Clift Hotel! It was clean, service was excellent and it was close to everything!!! Definately would stay there again!

review.title: Great for couples and singles
review.reviewText: The rooms were small, but comfortable. The sound system was upgraded while I was there, so that you could dock iPhones, not just iPods, which was nice. The walls were a fairly sound transparent, however, so volume control is important. The bathrooms showed their age, but everything was clean and functioned well. Based on the lively bar scene on the weekend, I would say it was not the most family friendly place. I enjoyed my stay and would stay there again.
review.locationRemarks: Convenient to Powell BART station, close to Union Square and many bars and restaurants.

review.title: A great stay at The Clift hotel....
review.reviewText:
We stayed in one of the junior suites as we had a 2yr old toddler with us - it was significantly bigger than the standard room, which our parents had booked into.

The room was great - clean, spacious, modern...... my only criticisms of the hotel are:

- charge for wifi
- no tea/coffee facilities in the room

Had we had the above facilities available, I would have rated the hotel 5/5!

A great stay at The Clift hotel....
review.negativeRemarks:
No tea/coffee facilities in room
No free wifi
review.locationRemarks: Good central location - only downside to the location is the number of vagrants/homeless people near to the hotel

review.title: On second thought
review.reviewText: I've been a fan of the Morgans group hotels and have stayed at the Clift in the past. On getting to the room, there is a promise of calm and peace but this stay was different The street sounds were non-stop and by midnight to 3 a.m. there was considerable drunken guests chatting and talking through the corridors. So the stay was not restful. I've finally decided that for the price, I'd rather stay at a boring quiet hotel to get sleep.
review.negativeRemarks: Noisy street, noisy guests. You can hear everything!

review.title: Perfect hotel in perfect location
review.reviewText: Perfect location just off Union Square and all staff really helpful. Would stay there again withouth a doubt.

review.title: Honeymoon in San Francisco
review.reviewText: We stayed at The Clift for our honeymoon in a junior loft suite. The room was really nice and a good size although the bathroom was a bit on the small side. We ordered room service for breakfast one day which was amazing. Would be good to get free WiFi and also the pay to view movies are very expensive. Very lovely, modern and sleek hotel with a great bar. Good location too near Union Square.

review.title: Modern hotel in central location
review.reviewText: good hotel although our room felt a bit dated and not as of high standard as the rest of the hotel (lobby, restaurant, bar...)
review.positiveRemarks: the redwood and velvet room / the overall design of hotel
review.negativeRemarks: the room was a bit dated and needed a good bit of fresh paint
review.locationRemarks: good central location - but avoid back of the hotel

review.title: Clift - a great hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel in a superb location. Didn't eat or drink there so cannot vouch for that. One critisism is that there wasnt a coffee machine in the room

review.title: Trendy Hotel for Trendy Travelers
review.reviewText: If you are a fan of the Morgan collection of properties, you won't be disappointed. The Clift is in typical stylish fashion one might expect from the group. However, in typical West Coast style, the Clift is not quite as brash as some of the other properties I have visited, largely on the East Coast. I recommend this hotel to anyone who appreciates nice boutiques and is looking a Starbuck's nearby, like across the street.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfort and livability. I stayed for eleven days.
review.negativeRemarks: The energy of the bar never seemed to come down, which is good for a party atmosphere but not if you are wanting to chill.
review.locationRemarks: Love San Francisco. Check out the restaurant Le Coloniel nearby, as well.

review.title: Good location - Comfy beds
review.reviewText:
My boyfriend and I stayed at The Clift for 4 nights at the end of May. Arriving from a long flight from Australia we had the best sleep ever, the bed was massive and very comfy.
I can understand why some of the older people may not like this hotel, the foyer and the lifts are very dark (like a night club) but once the lifts open on your floor the hallways are nice and bright and a lovely lavender colour.
We found the hotel to be in a great location, only 2 or 3 blocks from Union Square, great shopping and the cable carts.
If/when we go back to San Francisco we would stay here again.
Only con would be having to pay for Internet, but in saying that it was only $14.95 for 24 hours.
review.negativeRemarks: Paying for Internet
review.locationRemarks: Good location, close to shops

review.title: NZ'ers at Large
review.reviewText: Fantastic location. Staff and concierge all excellent. Erica superb. Bed comfort brilliant.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom - no fan to clear mirror
review.locationRemarks: excellent

review.title: Lovely Hotel with great staff
review.reviewText: The staff at the Clift were excellent - very friendly & helpful. They assisted us a lot with directions & places to go. As this was our first time in San Francisco, we really appreciated everything they did for us. The rooms were a good size although bathrooms a little small. Hotel is in a great location. Close to shops & transport. Would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Smart Hotel & Friendly Staff
review.reviewText: Beautiful Hotel in a great location. The staff were freindly & unprententious & went out of there way to impress & welcome us to the hotel. The room was modern & wonderfully furnished. The Food & beverage facilities more than adequate.

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: Excellent location, nice staff. .......................

review.title: PARKING
review.reviewText: Be prepaired for $57 a night parking unless you want to go down the street for $25.

review.title: Great but expensive
review.reviewText: great hotel, very nice, and in a great location. Downfall...hotel prices are restaurant and bar are beyond ridiculous. $28 for breakfast per person is a bit much. There are several placed in walking distance that are far more reasonable. I would stay there again.

review.title: Ecxelent hoet good location
review.reviewText: Clean and comfortable hotel, nice and helpfull staff, good location.

review.title: Staff is awesome!
review.reviewText:
We were staying in San Francisco because a relative was in the hospital. After a booking error, Expedia was gracious enough to move us to Clift at no extra cost. The staff at the Clift was first rate. We were tired and they recognized our need. Ursula behind the desk was great. The Bellman, John was awesome!
Traffic and one ways streets were extremely hard to navigate, especially on a Saturday night. But overall the Clift worked out great for our stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff...could not ask for a more attentive staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Traffic
review.locationRemarks: Located in a very busy of SF. Walking distance to shopping, public transportation, and restaurants.

review.title: Professional service and Cool Vibe
review.reviewText:
We found staff in all areas to be warm, natural and efficient. Front desk went the extra mile to find us just the right room, housekeeping brought the extra glasses we wanted and remembered daily for our 5 day stay. Engineer fixed our save promptly, with a smile.

Very stylish fit out. Room was light, bed and linen supremely comfortable. Loved the walk in robe. Perfectly clean - none of those grubby little corners you notice when retrieving that lost sock.

Bar very buzzy and stylish. Good for a light meal too - try the pate and also the fried olives. Breakfast in the restaurant was good - again charming service.

Loved The Clift and would definitely recommend.
review.negativeRemarks: Would have liked more light in bathroom
review.locationRemarks: Very central

review.title: Dark Lobby
review.reviewText: Room is big and clean. No dresser, you have to put your clothes in closet which is not enough. Lobby is too dark.

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: Fantastic staff, very helpful. The lobby is very eccentric and fun, the rooms are large and comfortable. I stay here once a week for business travel, and it's absolutely fantastic.

review.title: Great Hip Hotel/ Great Location
review.reviewText: Very cool, hip hotel. Great lobby bar. Lots of action for those that love that type of scene.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff were very helpful and friendly
review.locationRemarks: Awesome location...close to all the shopping areas.

review.title: Clift, the only choice
review.reviewText: Best customer service and accommodation. I will stay there every time I travel to SF.
review.locationRemarks: perfect location! walking distance to everything

review.title: Happy stay
review.reviewText:
Was pretty great... Wasn't expecting them to authorize my credit card for over $1000 for incidentals (which threw a bit of a wrench into my vacation for a day)... but the staff seemed willing and happy to try and fix the problem.

A little noisy on the main floor due to the nightclub off the lobby, but it's didn't bother me much - lots of security to keep things classy. :)
review.positiveRemarks: Malin+Goetz toiletries are pretty sweet... Quiet and comfortable beds.
review.negativeRemarks: no free wi-fi! Rooms not 100% soundproof (not enough to keep me awake, but though i'd mention it)
review.locationRemarks: Close to the Tenderloin, so a little shady in the evenings... but fine during the day. Close to tourist attractions.

review.title: Excellent location and I would stay here again!
review.reviewText: Excellent location, very clean and service was great. Room was reasonably sized and very comfortable. I travelled on my own and felt really safe in the vicinity of the hotel. Only gripe is that there was significant street noise even on a fifth floor room.
review.negativeRemarks: Poor sound proofing.
review.locationRemarks: Close to superb restaurants, shopping and sights.

review.title: Disappointed with the Clift
review.reviewText: I found the staff to not be helpful and at times quite rude. They have lost sight of the fact that the customer pays the bills and has many choices to stay in SFO. For a boutique, this is not what I expected.

review.title: An amazing place to stay
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay at the Cliff. It was conveniently located, easy to get around and had an amazing staff, They gave us great recommendations for dining and helped us plan a wine tour.
review.positiveRemarks: The overall friendliness and willingness of the staff.
review.negativeRemarks: No complimentary coffee

review.title: international fun
review.reviewText: didnt see restaurant until we were leaving a beautiful room but never open when we were available may be our fault no menus in room although we saw room service outside doors everything else terrific would definitely go back!
review.positiveRemarks: very chic decor artsy and eclectic all the help behind the desk were very accomodating nice touch with doormen love the redwood lounge not for family
review.negativeRemarks: end of bed too close to wall have black and blues on thighs
review.locationRemarks: fantastic location 2 blocks from union square walkable to china town and westfield mall next door to theater

review.title: Would come back in a heartbeat
review.reviewText: Great location, friendly staff and beautiful hotel.
review.locationRemarks: near Union Square, the heart of San Francisco. Close to restaurants and everything you need.

review.title: Clift Review
review.reviewText: This is a beautiful hotel - the downstairs areas are gorgeous, the room whilst quite small (I had a luxury room) is very well maintained and very comfortable. Unfortunately the view out of the window is not very pleasing - just buildings. The other thing to be wary of is the thinness of the walls - I could hear the couple in the room next to me talking amongst other things. It was quite loud. I don't know if this is because I was given a room with an interconnecting door which was locked. I was three for three nights so that was a bit of a shame. The other issue to be aware of is the charge of calls - a call that didn't connect was charged at $22 and I made 4 attempts and was charged this amount 4 times! They were good about deleting the items from the bill. Also their hotel car though being told it was $75 to the airport was $100 by the time I added tax and gratituties. Difficult when you come from Australia. It would be nice to be given access to vouchers etc. None of these were available or if they were were not offered to me. I think it's more of an "exclusive" hotel - not the sort of place for families I'm afraid and if you turn left out of the hotel you end up in an area of town you would rather not be. The bar is fantastic and the food excellent. I would stay again but would ensure that I didn't end up with the same problems that I had this time.
review.negativeRemarks: The thin walls
review.locationRemarks: Too close to the "rough" side of the city but close to Union Square - just don't turn in the wrong direction.

review.title: Highly Recommended
review.reviewText: A very nice hotel in the heart of San Francisco. Clean rooms, very good service, perfect location.
review.negativeRemarks: Size of bathroom
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location, close to Union Square

review.title: Excellent choice in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Very good hotel, excellent location very cool and good service
review.positiveRemarks: The room, common areas and location. Overall a very good place to stay in the Bay Area. I will definitely come back.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent

review.title: Clift San Fran - Good - but with a reservation
review.reviewText:
Great location - but even for a city central hotel it's noisy. Every door slams (including the housekeeping supplies rooms) - so don't expect to sleep in without disturbance. From around 8am you will probably be awake. Also as it's an old (and nice) building - the walls are thin so you can hear tv's, cupboards closing etc from neighbouring rooms. We had to complain about level of music from the next room at 11.45pm one night.
However, we would likely stay again as the location is so good and the price is much better than a lot in San Francisco.
The only other negative is the gym. It's poorly equipped and the running machines are old and need badly replacing with some newer well sprung models.
review.negativeRemarks: noise
review.locationRemarks: excellent - two blocks from Union Square

review.title: Boutique Hotel Feel
review.reviewText: The location is great and close to shopping, restaurants, theaters, etc. Be prepared to see a lot of sketchy people if you're walking around, especially south of hotel. The bar and lobby are amazing. The rooms are very small and stark but clean. Mine smelled musty. The bed is very comfortable. Easy to connect to Internet and the have iPhone speaker/charger.
review.positiveRemarks: Great bar scene. It was packed on the Thursday night I was there.

review.title: Clift Morgan = Great customer service!
review.reviewText: Great location, very well kept hotel with awesome customer service!
review.locationRemarks: Terrific location, easy access to cabs, the cable car stop and all kinds of shopping and nightlife.

review.title: Extremely Impressed
review.reviewText: Clift is in the heart of downtown and close to anywhere you would want to visit in San Francisco. The staff and their service was incredible; you will not need anything. My only complaint is that in order to check into your room, you have to put up a credit card/debit card. This in itself is not unusual; what is unusual is that they physically take the money out of your acount, whether you have spent anything or not. The woman wanted to take $600 at first, but I convinced her to only take $150. Besides that, my stay at the Clift was amazing and I would love to go back.
review.positiveRemarks: Hip decor, great night life, fantastic service, and in the middle of downtown.
review.negativeRemarks: Upfront fee.
review.locationRemarks: Could not be better for tourist or those wanting to be in the heart of the city.

review.title: Great stay!
review.reviewText: Great hotel staff. They helped us with all of our travel needs. Hotel was very nice and modern. Fantastic location to most things in San Fran. Hotel was one of the highlights of our trip.
review.negativeRemarks: Bordered on a rough area

review.title: Everything was perfect
review.reviewText:
My experience was wonderful. Really enjoy staying at the Clift hotel in San Francisco. The services were outstanding.
Claude
review.locationRemarks: about 10 to 15 minutes from the moscove convention meeting building

review.title: Darkness is not my preference.
review.reviewText: Lobby and halls are too dark even not to see people's face, which sometimes makes you feel unsafe or uncomfortable.

review.title: Happy to return again
review.reviewText: The staff were just perfect, effortlessly cool and yet very professional. Happy to help and knowledgable when asked. We stayed in a suite and found the room size to be excellent.
review.positiveRemarks: Loved the decor, location and style
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Great just up the road from all San Fran's shopping!

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText:
Fantastic hotel. Beautiful and immaculate rooms.
Provided us with complimentary champagne to celebrate our wedding.
No resort fee, but would have liked free wi-fi though.
review.positiveRemarks: The decor of the lobby and floors
review.negativeRemarks: No free wi-fi
review.locationRemarks: Excwllent location close to Union Square

review.title: We loved our stay
review.reviewText: It was an excellent place to stay. The hotel should consider free internet access considering the room rates.
review.negativeRemarks: no free internet access.
review.locationRemarks: It was definitely a place to stay due to being right in downtown SF and near transportation to all attractions.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: A great location in downtown SF and definitely good deal with expedia discounts. Easy access to most tourist attractions, great for shopping and entertainment. It's a hotel with its own style, very unique, though I found that the lobby area should be a lot more brighter. However, there's nothing complimentary in the room besides shampoo and conditioner. No boiling kettle or tea and coffee for the morning. Also, the house keeping missed cleaning our room for 2 days out of our 7 days stay. A bit surprised and disappointed in a 5 star hotel. However overall, it's a great hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Great location

review.title: Great location Great atmosphere
review.reviewText: Everyone there was friendly and nice. I didn't like my first room which was next to the service elevator and they moved me right away to a nice quiet corner room. The only 'negative' is that the hotel lounge does not open til 5pm so we had to go across the street for a drink and appetizers. I think the lounge should be open for business earlier or ideally all day. Travellers from all over the world come in from different time zones and are hungry and need refreshments at all different hours of the day.
review.negativeRemarks: The lounge not opening til 5pm is definitely not a good thing.
review.locationRemarks: Just off Union Square is great! Many restaurants, stores and theatre!

review.title: Excellent hotel!
review.reviewText: Great location - would certainly stay here again on my next trip to San Fran
review.negativeRemarks: Paying the bill!
review.locationRemarks: An edgy area, lots of homeless people, but apart from that its was nice and central - Prada and Gucci just around the corner!

review.title: Review
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Easy to get everywhere. Really enjoyed the bar on the weekend - adds more personality to the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Brilliant location - close to Bart, Street cars and cable cars. Easy to get everywhere.

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: Our room was on the 15th floor and was very noisy from the street noise and also the rooms next door. It sounded like someone was having a concert in the room next door with singing and amplified music at 1:00 a.m. It was hard to sleep because of this. The room was small and the lighting in the bathroom was not bright enough. Expected more from a four star hotel. Stayed at the Palace in the past which is much more luxurious for the money.
review.negativeRemarks: Room size, bathroom too dark and too small, noisy, not a friendly feeling in the lobby

review.title: great hotel!
review.reviewText: great hotel and location. made us feel very welcome.

review.title: Feels like a gloomy castle
review.reviewText:
very dark in lobby and unusual color schemes in elevators and rooms.
I guess an attempt to be chic, but didn't work for me.
review.negativeRemarks: Dark!
review.locationRemarks: Just off Union Square. Good location

review.title: Enjoyed our stay at the Clift....
review.reviewText: Second visit, so knew the hotel already. A standard room, which was very well furnished, with a nice bathroom and a gorgeous big bed. Great location for Union Square. Would stay again, but might have to look a bit younger and trendier if we're going to get a warmer welcome in the bar!!
review.negativeRemarks: A not so warm welcome on entering the bar
review.locationRemarks: Perfect for shopping

review.title: 3 nights at the Clift
review.reviewText: The Clift was a great place to stay. Our room was large and spacious, but some aspects were a little dated, such as smallish TVs and windows that were not sound proofed. The bathroom lacked any amenities such as cotton tips, shower cap, cotton balls, as you would normally expect in a hotel of this type. Food was excellent and bar had a great atmosphere. But overall, highly recommended!

review.title: Clift is our favorite in SF
review.reviewText: The hotel is beautifully decorated, comfortable, and trendy. We are hardly hipsters and traveled with a toddler and the staff could not have been more accommodating and kind to us. Great hotel and a great price.
review.positiveRemarks: The bar was a great place for people watching and good food and drinks.
review.negativeRemarks: The music in the bar could have been turned down a bit.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect. Close to BART and lots of SF sights.

review.title: Cool hotel in a perfect location
review.reviewText: Clift is a hip hotel in a great spot of town. A couple blocks to whatever you are looking for.
review.positiveRemarks: Lobby and bar were a great place to grab a drink

review.title: Fantastic Hotel near to Union Square
review.reviewText: Hotel Clift is a great hotel if you are staying in San Francisco. Excellent facilities and great bar.

review.title: Fantastic
review.reviewText: wonderful

review.title: Fantastic in many ways!
review.reviewText:
Room 1427. Brilliant service (door men, front desk and in-room), style (lobby and in-room) and location. Two flat screen TVs, high end bath products and linen, super comfortable king-sized bed and modern furniture.
Convenient to the bus (#38), cable car (Powell/Hyde) , express bus to Candlestick, BART. Walking distance to Nob Hill, Chinatown, Little Italy, Civic Center, Yerba Buena, Union Square, great shopping, restaurants and the theatre district.

The Redwood Room is a wonderful bonus.

review.title: Great hotel get location great value
review.reviewText: Would recommend

review.title: This is an excellent hotel it is near all the best attractions.
review.reviewText: I just came from San Francisco this week 11-15-11. This is an excellent hotel.

review.title: Great Weekend Get Away In Union Square
review.reviewText: Super location! The staff is obliging and attentive without being too gushy or intrusive. Great choice if you want to visit San Francisco without a car. The bar scene is fun at night. The rooms were very quiet and the bed super comfortable. The promotional deal thru Expedia really made this trip an outstanding value. Would definitely consider booking again thru expedia and returning to the Clift for another stay.
review.locationRemarks: close to Union square shops and restaurants. Had great dinners at both Fleur de Lys and Le Colonial which were each just 2 block away. San Francisco is such a great city for eating and going out -- food and service are taken seriously without being overly formal or stuffy. Hate to sound so cliche but San Francisco definitely European in its sensibilities on that front.

review.title: Fine hotel in great location
review.reviewText: Trendy but costly hotel in very good central location. Generally very happy with the quality of the hotel and the service we received (we stayed a week). Only very minor complaint about the cost of the Wifi!

review.title: Hot Spot
review.reviewText: They were very accomodating. The hotel was in very good condition. There was a halloween party going on while we were there and they let guests in with a costume. My husband wanted to go so he and his friend dressed up in the hotel robes and slippers and went in. They had a great time and there were lots of people there that weren't hotel guests. It seemed to be a hot spot for the locals. Also the other friend we were traveling with left her coat in the room, which she didn't realize until we were home. She called the hotel and they had the coat and were shipping it back to her in Neb! Great customer serivce. Everyone there from the concierge to the door men were so helpful in giving suggestions on places to go and how to get there.

review.title: Will definitely return
review.reviewText: Well-appointed room. Very reasonable price.

review.title: amentities lacking
review.reviewText:
minimal light in bathroom. problem with shaving by me and wife had to buy mirror to attach to window to put on makeup.

no dresser to put clothes into

minimal tv channels

resturant and bar were excellent

review.title: Love it, BUT
review.reviewText:
Only complaints:

TV channel options decrepit in this age of cable etc.

No coffee in room. Room service for ice.

Got a deal from Expedia, otherwise pay for internet--lame.

review.title: San Francisco Hot Spot
review.reviewText: The Clift Hotel was very trendy and clearly a hot spot among the "in" crowd. Our room was very comfortable and loved the bedding. The bathroom, however, was very small with almost no counter space. Although the water pressure and temp in the shower were amazing for a hotel. We had dinner in the Velvet Room the first night and our food was excellent!! Definitely five star! Do not pay to park your car at the hotel, the fee is outrageous and there are parking garages within a block of the hotel that are much more economical. Also, there is a Starbucks and Walgreen's right across the street, very convenient. All in all a great experience and I'd definitely recommend the hotel.

review.title: convenient location
review.reviewText: first time to san fransico and the clift was everything the reviews talked about. would stay at the hotel again because of the location. great front desk reception-very helpful with where to eat, how to catch local transit, and tourist tips! small rooms and bathrooms were mentioned in other reviews and found this to be true...but since not much time was spent in the room (too much to see and do) this was okay.
review.locationRemarks: One recommendation - rent a bike at fisherman's wharf to cross the golden gate bridge - the best experience!! Take local transit to get full san fransico experience.

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: Awesome hotel, excellent location, rooms are ultra comfy! And very friendly and helpfull staff. We stayed for our honeymoon and could not fault it!!

review.title: Great choice!
review.reviewText: I was extremely pleased with the hotel overall. The customer service was excellent. The only thing that was not great was the bar - The Redwood Room. The bar itself is beautiful, but the crowd was not. It was extremely LOUD, playing techo dance music every night. The crowd nor the music fit with the beautifully designed bar. And the crowd was very young, drunk, obnoxious the whole time we were there. I had guests come meet me for a drink but we couldn't go to the Redwood Room bar since it was too loud to actually have a conversation. Too bad. Other than that, my stay was perfect!

review.title: Love the hotel. .
review.reviewText: We really enjoye the hotel. The Redwood Room is amazing. We only wish there was a real restaurant in the facility.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: A LITTLE BIT PRICEY FOR ROOM AMENITIES OF ROOM. BUT I WOULD USE AGAIN FOR THE EXCELLENT LOCATION.

review.title: Nice place with great bar!
review.reviewText:
Great place with friendly service. Always gave good recommendations on food. The bar is one of the trendy places to go in San Fran.

Parking is expensive at $50 per day but they have a public parking beside of the hotel.

Very nice rooms with nice bedding.

Would totally recommend.

review.title: Not impressed...
review.reviewText: For the price this hotel charges, you could do better to choose one of the many other Union Square options. Service was surprisingly poor. The hotel's overriding desire to be hip and modern comes at the price of comfort. And I had ants in my room.

review.title: Great location, hotel looking a little old
review.reviewText:
Walls are paper thin
Gym was not properly equipped
Complimentary breakfast was decent
Staff friendly
Hotel was undergoing renovations during our stay

review.title: Great stay while in San Fco
review.reviewText:
Great hotel! blocks away from hop-on hop-off, China town and cable car service! Surrounded by quality stores and even a Marshall's and Walgreens.
Good eating spots for every wallet and taste!
Theatre district is a block away!
Great price and service!

review.title: Mohamedinhouston
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. Great location. Good size room with walk-in closet. smallish bathroom. A hotel of this standard should provide free wifi.Mohamed

review.title: Good Location!
review.reviewText: Good location, close to shops and lots of restaurants. Room was comfortable but everything was purple!

review.title: Great location and very cool
review.reviewText: Perfectly located to explore all of San Fran, just off Union Square. Comfy rooms, helpful and knowledgeable staff and a fabulous lobby bar to start your evening off - get there early or it gets too packed!

review.title: The Clift
review.reviewText: Great location. Friendly. Good service.

review.title: a great boutique hotel in a central location
review.reviewText:
we were really impressed by the size of the room and the comfort and style of the place. even the toiletries (malin + goetz) were impressive. the lobby staff were polite and friendly and helpful too.

only thing to note is that the lobby becomes a nightclub on Saturday nights (if you're from Sydney - it's like The Ivy) which means its noisy and full of people.

as for the area, Union Square is quite touristy... good for shopping and central for sighseeing, but you'll need to get on a tram to get a better feel for the real san francisco.

review.title: beyond hip
review.reviewText: This hotel is described as uber hip in many of the guides that I read. I'd say that is true if you look only at it's decor. The service takes it well beyond that - The Clift is exactly what a high end boutique hotel should be. Very comfortable rooms, staff that goes well beyond expectations in terms of service and great food.

review.title: Labor Day in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
The hotel was wonderful; the staff, amenities, decor, location. This was our girls' Labor Day trip and we couldn't have been more satisfied; only exception was the cold weather and fog (we didn't see the Golden Gate bridge due to fog) but had a great time overall shopping, enjoying everything else San Francisco had to offer.

Ernesto (Room Service) was wonderful. Thank you for everything.

review.title: Not perfect, but stiil very nice
review.reviewText:
I would have rated the Clift higher if staff had corrected a clogged up sink which we asked be fixed during breakfast. Unfortunatlely, it was not repaired before we checked out one hour later.

The hotel has a very modern decor and colors (purple on our floor), may not appeal to some tastes. The Bose Sounddock in our room, just like mine at home for my Ipod, was a nice touch. The bar was packed (a liitle too crowded for conversation), with a young hip group. This is a big change from the old days at the Clift when long haired patrons were turned away in the 70s.

Our room had a very spacious sittng room with large glass table and chairs
perfect for entertaining others.

review.title: Vancouver Traveler
review.reviewText: We had a spacious, comfortable, clean room. We were extremely pleased with the maintenance and cleanliness. Hotel service was courteous and helpful. The bothroom was a little small and the bar/nightclub was noisy and not clearly not geared for aging boomers. Oher than those two minor problems we were extremely happy woth our choice and if we go back to San Francisco would certainly choose the Clift.

review.title: thin walls
review.reviewText: Nice hotel but the noise levels from adjacent rooms were unacceptable.

review.title: Clean and quiet
review.reviewText: We stayed for 4 nights and were very pleased with how quiet the room was, even though the hotel seemed pretty full, judging by the traffic in the lobby. The lobby and elevators are seriously dark, but that appears to be a SF small hotel gimmick, because we went into a different, similar hotel that was also like a cave. However, the room was fine, and not too dark. The bathroom was functional but could use some touch-ups like new caulk, and a make-up mirror would be a good addition. Internet is expensive but that made me feel good about firing up the wireless on the iPad where a month of service costs the same as 2 days of Clift internet. All in all, we'll probably pick a different hotel next time, because this was nothing special, but nothing was bad either. It's about a block away from the start of the seedy district (the Tenderloin?), so the location is not perfect, but we had no problems.

review.title: We cant wait to return to theClift
review.reviewText:
Loved everything about the hotel. Location near Union Square and China Town is great. Special thanks to Erica at the desk for all her help. She is an asset to the hotel.
The only negative is the lack of light in the bathroom.

review.title: Great stay in SF
review.reviewText: Grammie with 2 young girls. Very comfortable, inviting and secure at the Clift Hotel.

review.title: Tired hotel, maybe I needed to be in my 20's
review.reviewText: Maybe I would have liked this if I was still in my 20's. The lobby is extremely dark and furnished with unique but worn out chairs. The rest of the hotel is lavender. Really lavender! My first room was on the 4th floor. It was small, faced a very busy and noisy street, the bath tub tap dripped, it was all lavender and the window to the noisy street didn't quite close. If I had been forced to stay there for the two nights prepaid via Expedia, I would have been very unhappy. They upgraded me to a very nice room, but I wouldn't count on that! All in all, if you are old enough to be concerned when the (very) handsome bellman tells you at least three times to get to the bar really early because it is really busy in the bar - or that this in a dicey part of town - pick somewhere else!

review.title: Quite impressed
review.reviewText: The room was small but comfortable. It was tastefully decorated. The lobby is extremely dim and has lots of unique seating (which brings about good photo opportunities, especially the massive chair). Wifi was pretty expensive at the hotel, so we went to starbucks across the road. It's in a really good location two blocks from union square and a short walk to Westfield on Market. There's also lots of little supermarkets and liquor stores close by. Hotel service was good - they delivered extra towels promptly when asked, and the concierge was very efficient.

review.title: Enjoyed our stay
review.reviewText:
Attended a convention at the Hilton, a block away, but didn't want to stay at the host hotel. The Clift was nearby and we found it to be a super alternative. The lobby and bar were super cool, lots wood, dim lighting and high cool factor. The bar ended up being packed on Fri & Sat nights, obviously a happening place! The bartenders and cocktail waitresses were attentive and friendly.

Our room was a little less appealing than the lobby and other common areas. The lavender paint was a little suprising, and the modern decor featured acrylic end tables. However the bed was super comfortable, just as good as any of the branded beds we've encountered at other hotels. We also found the room exceptionally quiet. Staying in the city we expected more city noise, but with the modern windows (which did open for fresh air) and polite taxi drivers, we experienced peaceful slumber.

The bath room in our room was small but adequate. Nothing luxurious, but it served its purpose, was clean, and the shower was hot. When traveling you never know what you are going to get in a shower head, yet The Clift has learned that Speakman shower heads are the best!

The workout room was remarkably well appointed in a large space with many machines and free weights to choose from.

All in all we were very satisfied and certainly would consider returning on our next stay in San Fran.

review.title: Great location but disappointing new bar noise
review.reviewText: The location can't be beat and the room while a bit small was comfortable and stylish. The bar at the hotel, the Redwwod Room is famous and I was looking forward to meeting some friends and having a drink. Unfortunately, the bar is now disco-esque with lots and lots of noise and loud music. The crowd was very young, you had to get past the velvet ropes in order to get in, bar tables were all reserved and later there were a scary number of guards roaming around the lobby and elevator area (made me wonder if untoward events were a common occurrence). Perhaps that is just the weekend scene but I was disappointed that something graceful has become glitzy and superficial.

review.title: coffee
review.reviewText: No coffee maker -- seriously?

review.title: Loved the location
review.reviewText: The bed was so comfortable, perfect after a long day out and about in the city. The location is perfect for late nighters, there's so much going on around. Or if desired you can stay in the hotel lounge, there's plenty of people, good drinks an overall good time.

review.title: Great Hotel, Challenges for Multiple Occupancy
review.reviewText:
This hotel is very well located about 3 blocks from Union square, in what is called the "Tenderloin" district.

We had read reviews about many hotels and understood many areas have issues with vagrants...this is true, but we were not bothered by them. Living in London probably makes us more imune!

When we arrived we were assigned a king bed room, however we had booked for three people (2 adults and 1 child). When we asked for a roll-away bed we were told that the room would be too small. They had no other room types available and we were therefore upgraded to a suite (very nice), however they tried to charge us for the privilige. We challenged this and we were given the upgrade for free.

However on check out we were then charged $40 per night for the roll-away bed. Again we challenged this on the basis of the booking for three and agreed to pay for only one night charge.

Lesson: Expedia only books king bed rooms, which sleep two persons. Call the hotel to ensure they have space for multiple occupancy.

Otherwise a very nice hotel, lovely bar, but a bit pricey!

review.title: Nice hotel. Loved the Redwood Room
review.reviewText: We loved the hotel. It's just down the street from Union Square. The room was a bit on the small side but it was perfectly acceptable. We spent the evening in the Redwood Room. That place had a great vibe with great music and a hip crowd.

review.title: Better than expected from the reviews...
review.reviewText: Hotel was better than reviews I saw here. Yeah the walls are thin, like most hotel in SF. The neighborhood is a bit rough. The bathrooms are super small. But at the rate I found, can't complain. Cool lobby, suite was nice, good view, etc.

review.title: Great service, bad rooms.
review.reviewText:
the first room that we checked into shared a wall with the service elevators. there is no way i could relax with the amount of noise. the receptionist was very understanding and moved us to the 17th floor (the elevator only goes to the 16th) and a couple rooms away from the elevator.

there was a small table in the bathroom that was dirty. i'm not sure if they just missed that table but it lead me to believe that the entire bathroom was not clean.

the housekeeping also neglected to replace the shampoo and conditioner so they were almost empty from the people before us.

the actual room was very nice though. the bed was one of the most comfortable beds i've slept in. and the pillows were nice as well.

the walls are paper thin so you can hear your neighbors conversations.
lastly, the windows let in a lot of sound as well, which would not have been a problem if there weren't protesters with bullhorns picketing the hotel across the street at 6:30am.

review.title: My home in SF away from home
review.reviewText: What more can I say? This hotel just makes me happy every time I come and visit. The style is very contemporary but not too over the top. It's got warmth and chic taste. The rooms are cozy and very artful, like San Francisco. The hotel amenities, well, the downstairs work and bar area, are bars against the others. The Redwood Room is my nighttime spot whether or not I stay here, so staying here and going down to my favorite bar is really a plus.

review.title: What a cold hotel that nickels and dimes.
review.reviewText: The hotel itself presents a cold, almost antiseptic, lobby and atmosphere. Paying the room charge is only the beginning. I have never had to pay $50 for parking. Also, never had to call room service and pay for ice to be delivered. The saving grace was Erica, the conceirge, who was simply spectacular. She was both knowledgable and most helpful.

review.title: location, service, and comfort are very good BUT scrutinize your bill
review.reviewText: I have stayed in this hotel for a couple of times and was very satisfied. I was shocked however to find a charge in my bill for an overnight parking fee plus tax. How it end up on my bill at all is a mystery because I did not bring a car going to San Francisco. They did admit their mistake but one should scrutinize their hotel charges before checking out.

review.title: Favorite Union Square hotel
review.reviewText: Chic, upscale and accessible. Loved it since I first stayed here in 2004 during an interview. Now I stay here when I come to SF for leisure. For anyone who loves the other Morgans hotels (The Delano, Mondrian, Shore Club), you'll love the Clift Hotel.

review.title: Fantastic stay
review.reviewText: The room was spacious, full of light, and very clean. The bed was extremely comfortable - we didn't want to get up in the morning! All of the staff we encountered were friendly. The modern look of the hotel (both in the main areas as well as in the room) is a refreshing change of pace from a typical hotel. As far as location, it was only a few minutes walk to Union Square and the Powell BART station - very convenient. I would definitely go back.

review.title: more flash than substance
review.reviewText: great location, flash and hip. but a little wanting in terms of actual "5 star" service.

review.title: Experience at the Clift was very good.
review.reviewText:
We found the darkness of the lobby to be somewhat distressing. Why the bizarre furniture in the lobby?

The hotel personnel were extremely courteous and helpful, except the the Velvet Room (see below).

The one day we had breakfast in the Velvet Room, the service was deplorable. We had to ask for everything from taking our order, delivering fresh croissants, to asking for our bill.

review.title: Sleek Hotel
review.reviewText: Beautiful room and a great lounge downstairs... good cocktails and excellent people watching.

review.title: The Clift - great location inn downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText: From our arrival at the Clift, the service was friendly, always available but low key. Great location just a block and a bit from Union Square. The rooms are bright, clean, newly renovated and comfortable - the king-size bed was just the right amount of firmness. Amazingly quiet considering the hotel is right downtown. However, missing from the room was any means of making coffee/tea late at night or first thing in the morning (thankfully, there was a Starbucks right across the street). That would have made it even better. Otherwise, our stay at the Clift was wonderful.

review.title: san francisco clift hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel.

review.title: Beautiful Lobby
review.reviewText: very chic. love this brand of hotels. rooms a little small, and zero view, but the lobby was gorgeous.

review.title: Classy and comfortable.
review.reviewText: The Clift is a very classy place. We loved the antiques in the lobby. The loft room was pretty big, and the beds and linens were exceptional. The bathroom was old and needed some upgrading. It was marble, but the lighting was too dim, and the counterspace was too small for two ladies with lots of stuff. They also need to put safety bars in the tub. We had a walk-in closet, a sofa, and a table which we used for make-up and computers. All in all, it was a very nice place with an attentive staff in a convenient location. I would recommend it.

review.title: weekend of hell
review.reviewText: the room next to us was partying all night shouting racial slurs and you could here them chopping cocaine the whole night. i asked the next day if they had checked out because i did not want to go through it again... i was lied to same thing in a row... 5 rather big guys in this room, that i wanted no beef from.... needless to say i nor my kids got any sleep while we were there.

review.title: Clift San Fran Trip
review.reviewText: Excellent service, great bar, unique fixtures & decor, contemporary atmosphere, perfect scene for young professionals. Overall very satisfied, would recommend to my friends and would stay again.

review.title: Get in the 2000's
review.reviewText: The Hotel has a ridiculously antiquated In room TV package, what's the point of a flat Screen TV if there is no HD Channels??? Seriously I thought Boutique Hotel meant modern and evolved not Old and Clueless!!! The shower in our Studio suite was terrible as well. Hardware didn't work and bathroom was in poor condition overall. This whole Hotel group has completely lost it's way since Ian left, 3 star hotel at 4 star price.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel and Great Location!
review.reviewText: Its a great location and prices are always on target.

review.title: Clift Hotel - very cool!
review.reviewText: I loved the modern, funky decor and ambiance of this hotel. It was so hip and yet so inviting. The staff was nice and cordial, the rooms clean, and the location was unbeatable. I would definitely love to stay here again if I have the chance!!

review.title: Classic Standard
review.reviewText: The Clift has been around for a long time and was recently update with Stark designs. The bar was hopping on Sat night. Restaurant was dead quiet. Great location on Geary. Go to the Starbucks across the street for breakfast - EZ!

review.title: Clift Hotel San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Stayed there over the memorial weekend. Since we were able to get 50% discount through expedia, price-quality was more than satisfactory. Room - spanish suite - was very elegant with its drapery and large mirrors. Very romantic.
Hotel has a cool lobby and Velvet Room bar got pretty crowded and fun in the evening. Only one thing that bothered me was a manager who basically ran after us after he notice my husband taking photos with a professionally looking camera. The manager proceeded to interrogate us whether we were planning to use the photos commercially (obviously we did not). Lots of tourists now have nice cameras, so one would imagine hotel management wouldn't worry much about it. If anything, it's a compliment to your lobby if guests take lots of photos.

review.title: Very nice staff and excellent food
review.reviewText: Love the modern details. Staff was very nice and food was excellent. Close enough to BART. Be careful with the town cars in front.

review.title: OK
review.reviewText: Entrance too dark, bedrooms small

review.title: So So Stay
review.reviewText:
Nice look, feel and location. Enjoyed the bar and restaurant. But the corridors and room had the feel of an old hotel with wannabe makeup. Minimalist decor in room is OK but it wasn't exactly exciting. Worst part was the thrice over by the 3 (kid you not 3) person security team at the entry to the elevators. I felt like I was a criminal going back to my cell block not a guest. They didn't make me feel "safe" just "suspected." Very strange.

Overall I got such a good discount it was worthwhile. I'd stay here again assuming similar pricing. But full price - never. Hey, this is not the Gramercy Park NYC although it seems to want to try to be.

review.title: Front staff was very good, I called reservation for info, they were not helpfull
review.reviewText: Very good, cool and different hotel.

review.title: Excellent atmosphere, service, location!
review.reviewText: Terrific location in the heart of San Francisco. Met guests, business partners, and family in surrounding restaurants within walking distance. Stayed for 4 days and had a wonderful time.

review.title: World-class hotel
review.reviewText: Flawless hotel and staff in somewhat shoddy area of SF. But it all works. Got upgraded without asking to a small suite.

review.title: Will not return
review.reviewText: I was not impressed at all. They are not only overly expensive for a basic room but they charge $14.75 a day for internet service, $50 a night for parking and you don;t even get complimentary coffee for the morning. I noticed a Motel Six around the corner as the neighborhood declines with each block you walk, and there they offer free parking, free wi fi, and complimentary breakfast. Next time I will go to Motel Six the comforts of their rooms looked actually better than the Clift Morgan..

review.title: Lobby
review.reviewText: Fantastic designer lobby but room was nothing more than an above average marriott. Staff were very polite and helpful.

review.title: Not Clean
review.reviewText: Not clean, but fun lobby.

review.title: Disappointed!!!
review.reviewText:
The company I work for has a corporate account with Morgans & in general our staff and clients are happy with the service, but not this time.
We arrived at the hotel at midnight- The room was not ready. We were told we were being offered a 'great' room, but they needed to check it was clean. After waiting half an hour we were offered a drink by the manager, but this was the last thing we wanted after a long flight.
We got into the room finally which was positioned next to the elevator motor. We heard the elevators going up and down all night. This is a lively hotel- We asked to moved the next morning. We were told no problem. Pack your bags and we will take care of it while you are out. We were gone for 10 hours. When we arrived back, we moved the bags ourselves.
The next day the towels and robes were removed from our room for no reason.
I called as soon as I saw this and asked for them to be returned. When we arrived back 3 hours later, they were not. We called again. Not what you expect from what is considered to be a 4 star hotel.

review.title: unfortunately the Clift dropped the ball
review.reviewText:
The rooms are showing wear (banged up doors, cracked bath tub floor, leaking faucets that barely have any chrome on them, etc.). There is no room service during the day, the quality of service and food in the restaurant went down, which is a shame, since prices are still what they used to be before.

Being approached by a call girl INSIDE the elevator tops off a very disappointing experience. I do simply expect a house like the Clift ensure that their guests are not being panhandled and harassed that way inside the hotel area reserved for guests. I will not feel comfortable bringing my fiancee with me again, since she might be harassed as well by who knows who.

I used to tell everyone how great the Clift is and had many friends staying there as well. I am sad to say I will not be able to recommend it anymore.

review.title: classy and cool
review.reviewText: a very good and exciting hotel!

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is delightful and inviting. The interior design by Philip Starck is amazing and provides great ambience. A great location with Starbucks across the road with free internet and shopping nearby at Union Square. Very comfortable hotel. Better location than Fisherman's Wharf area, however, a lot of poor people are visible around nearby streets, which is typical of inner city.

review.title: Great location !
review.reviewText:
It was an old-fashioned building, done up to look modern/ minimalist.......but overall a nice decor.
Bathroom typical of old buildings....cramped.
Bedroom comfortable ,with a minibar !
Very dim lighting thruout....nice lounge / bar, didnt see a restaurant.
Great location, just off Union Square.
Would go back again.....

review.title: loved the hotel- over priced parking
review.reviewText: Love this hotel. The service was amazing. The only negative thing was that the parking for the night was ridiculously expensive- $50 a night.

review.title: A Very Swank Hotel
review.reviewText: Wanted to spend Christmas Eve in San Fran so found the Clift Hotel which always looked really cool from the outside. The room was really nice but the bathroom was extremely small. The hotel itself was beautiful and very, very quiet on the inside. The staff were all charming and I really enjoyed my stay. Would definitely do it again at the Clift.

review.title: I would return to the Clift
review.reviewText: I had a security issue and the hotel staff did everything they could to help me. The lobby is kind of cool. The room was quite nice, spacious and well lighted. The only complaint is that the walls are thin and I could very clearly hear the couple next door having sex. I think that happens in a lot of places, though.

review.title: Great hotel for romantic evening in SF!
review.reviewText: The Clift will be perfect for you if you like modern design and hip, trendy crowd. The room was perfect for a romantic weekend getaway, a little small but giant mirrors on either side of the bed which are fun and make the room seem larger. Nice view of Union Square.
