Room very clean, bright white linens, very modern...beautiful

review.title: Trendy, chic, a well located
review.reviewText: I have stayed at this hotel on a few occasions and have enjoyed every stay. Note, if you are 40-something acting like 60, this place is not for you. Clift is trendy, chic and at night, a spectacle to witness. The women are as fast as the cars out front; and the bar is very cool with the exception of the creepy wall art. The rooms are small, the bathrooms are smaller, located one-block from the shopping district, that makes this place one not to pass up. The service was great from the staff, so in conclusion, a person will need to give up a little space to receive the ambiance and service this hotel provides.

review.title: Great hotel & bar
review.reviewText: Only there for 1 night so not a lot to base this on, but the staff was friendly, the room was very nice and the hotel quite chic. LOVED the Redwood Bar!

review.title: average
review.reviewText:
from the website and enterance to this hotel you expect something special but the rooms are really pretty average and you can do better for the price elsewhere. for example there are no blankets in the room, only one robe, no tea or coffee facilities, no internet or breakfast included, the gym with an empty water dispenser.

we also ate at the restuarant which was similarly overpriced without delivering anything special.

review.title: GREAT HOTEL, GREAT PERSONNEL
review.reviewText:
GREAT HOTEL, THE LOCATION WAS EXCELLENT, REALLY CLOSE FROM UNION SQUARE. THE ATTENTION AND SERVICE IS REALLY GOOD. IT SEEMED THAT THE BAR IS GREAT COS EVERYTIME WE ARRIVED LATE THERE WAS A REALLY GOOD PARTY UNFURNATELY WE ALWAYS ENDED SO TIRED FOR SIGHTSEEING.
ROOM SERVICE EXTREMELY EXPENSIVE THE DESERTS THAT WE ASK WERE SO SO...

BUT EVERYTHING WAS GREAT AND GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE.

review.title: awesome redesign!
review.reviewText: elegantly renovated old San Francisco hotel -a lot of charm and style....

review.title: Boutique and hip but kind of over the top in a $$$ way.
review.reviewText: Unfortunately, the rooms need a bit of a face lift and seem a bit dated - even for that boutique look. The in house restaurant is ridiculously expensive for breakfast ($6 cappuccinos) and they charge $15 a day for internet access in the rooms. Apparently this hotel caters to more entertainment and media folks and on weekends the lobby is a kind of social circus. It's not a bad hotel but I probably won't stay there again.

review.title: Dirty
review.reviewText:
When we checked in everything was fine until we went to our room! Our bathroom was GROSS! The bathtub had hair on it & in it (not from your head!) We called housekeeping and they sent someone right away (thinking they would clean it with soap!). We were wrong!! Housekeeping came with a dry paper towel and wiped it off! (I could have done that!) It took all of 30 sec.
The walls are very thin too! Every morning I woke up to a guy on his cell phone taking business calls I could hear every word! (so much for confidentiality!)
However the front desk staff were very helpful with information (everything from restaurants to directions). Oh and the downstairs restaurant was OVER priced!!

review.title: I liked the Clift
review.reviewText: The hotel is beautiful and in a good location (for shopping, dining and accessing BART). The staff was very kind and capable. The bar (and its seating options) are great. The rooms are cute but quite small. And, since the building is very old, there is very little sound insulation - I could hear everyone and everything. Tough when trying to sleep.

review.title: Clift in Union Square
review.reviewText:
The Clift is a beautifully restored and modern hotel. The lobby is unexpectedly dark -- apparently for atmosphere, you just get used to it. Staff was friendly and helpful. The downside of this hotel is that it is a "hot spot" downtown San Francisco (near Union Square) and when I checked in close to midnight on a Thursday, I could hear the music from the club on the first floor into my room on the 6th floor. Also, the rooms don't have sufficient sound-proofing between rooms and two evenings of the four I stayed I had loud ?drinking? guests in the adjacent room. Thank goodness for ear plugs, don't leave home without them.
Room was large and well-designed, closet spacious, safe in closet, -- no in- room coffee, but Starbucks across the street. Would stay again, but address noise concerns when making reservations and get quieter room.

review.title: Great loby and bar/restaurant area! Suite... not so much
review.reviewText: My girlfriend and I picked this hotel as we both enjoy staying in design hotels. The Clift offers an amazing lobby and bar restaurant area with great style. However when we got to our loft suite we felt truly disappointed by the style, very plain and common... What a disappointment. We may have understood this with a basic room; however, for a loft suite this is a tougher one to swallow. This is a shame as service was good and the staff very friendly. Also, the location is great as it is close from Union Square and the main cable car line.

review.title: Cool place to stay!
review.reviewText:
The hotel is very cool, the interior gives the feel of a funky boutique hotel, only the bath looked on the old side.
It is very clean, staff are friendly, the bed is comfortable and toiletries are ok.

The hotel is very central, close to Union Square and all the major shops, the price is reasonable compared to other places and if you book early enough you might find some sort of offer.
They have a cool bar on the ground floor and at the mezzanine level you can do your flight online check in for free in the business centre.
I would definitely go there again and would totally reccomend it!
Shame there is no coffee facility inside the room

review.title: Nice, but Loud and Pretentious
review.reviewText: The hotel and hotel room were in good condition, but the decor was a bit over the top for us. Why I wouldn't recommend this hotel: We changed rooms halfway through our stay because our initial room was adjacent to a parking garage that beeped as cars entered and exited (which felt like every 5 minutes throughout the entire night). Also housekeeping was very loud as they cleaned rooms - making it impossible to sleep during the mid-afternoon. You can hear the hallway traffic/noise very easily. On a positive note: the location made it easy to visit many of the attractions we wanted to see and the hotel was clean. Staff were pleasant. There is a nice bar/restaurant/club downstairs "Elixir" that seems like a good place to "be seen" if you're into that sort of thing.

review.title: nice hotel
review.reviewText: friendly staff, convenience store and restaurant around the corner. good experience. However, no coffee maker/coffee in the room and small bathroom.

review.title: Very centrally located
review.reviewText: Hotel was very nice, staff very accomodating and offered wonderful suggestions for dinner, getting around the city, etc. They loaned us umbrellas as it was rainy! Nice nightlife in the hotel lobby lounge. Would definitely use this hotel again if ever in the area.

review.title: The Clift Hotel was wonderful
review.reviewText: The hotel was wonderful and the staff were professional. Food was very good but pricey. Redwood lounge is beautiful.

review.title: Impresive Hotel
review.reviewText: The service, architecture, and decoration is great

review.title: I loved it, a unique experience
review.reviewText: It is located in a great area. When I first entered the hotel I knew it would be different. The lobby and "living room" area has a variety of very unique chairs. It is very comfortable and fun. It's a great place to have a drink or just and read or work. The rooms are large and very clean. The bathroom is also large with a great shower. The bed was very comfortable and had a clean white duvet instead of a bed spread. This added to the feeling of clean. The only thing that would have improved my stay would be free internet. There was no coffee in the rooms but it was free in the lobby and there are many specialty coffee shops very close by. The hotel hosted a costume party during my stay. All guests were informed about the party and invited. I had a great stay and am very pleased that I stayed at Clift.

review.title: Back to the City by the Bay
review.reviewText:
The Clift Hotel is an old classic hotel we knew of (having lived in San Francisco for years -- years ago) but we had never stayed there. What a great 'find'. The location is ideal. You can walk to shopping, Chinatown, North Beach, Fisherman's Wharf and (a treat for us, having lived/worked in San Francisco) a fun ride on the cable car.
If you are thinking of visiting this beautiful City by the Bay, consider the Clift Hotel. You will feel at home -- we did.

review.title: beyond my expectation
review.reviewText:
I'm a guy who reads all the reviews but never writes one. The CLIFT was was clean (which is firmly our first requirement), in the BEST EVER location. Within walking distance to all transit that connects to the Warf, two blocks from union square, easy walk to china town, and near many local eateries with 24hr breakfast etc. The hotel is like no other I have stayed in... and we travel. It has a unique odd flare (for example the furniture in the lobby is clearly one of a kind and the three different elevators with reflective glass haha). No, in all seriousness, you cant get a better hotel, in a better location. I would NEVER stay anywhere else if I could get a room at the clift... after looking around the area.
don't fret staying here!

review.title: Hotel was nice.
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice and I would probably stay there again. First the good: the location was great. The housekeeping staff was the most friendly I have ever seen. The concierage sent us to the best chinese I have ever had. The room was clean and the bed was very comfortable. Now the bad:First, in this day and age is it really necessary to charge for WiFi? Second, the door to our room would stick really bad and so you literally had to put your shoulder into it to get in and then it would not close behind you. My only other complaint is the walls were kind of thin. We could hear our neighbor's late night movie and talking to his wife on the phone.

review.title: Can't Wait to go back!
review.reviewText: Thank you

review.title: Unique Hotel experience.
review.reviewText: Small rooms but great clean hotel. Excellent location to downdown. Would diffently stay again at the internet rates. No ice machines or coffee makers in the room. It is pure San Fransico style.

review.title: Satisfied trip to San Fran
review.reviewText: The hotel itself is located centrally, so of course you can walk to everything, which we did. The hotel service was attentive and our room comfortable, although the walls are a little thin. However, overall we had a comfortable stay and would consider this hotel again in the future.

review.title: Efficient property
review.reviewText: I was only there for one night, but everything from check in to room service ran easily and smoothly. All as expected.

review.title: Clift is Fantastic
review.reviewText: Great hotel, great service, great location!

review.title: Good place for a stopover and access to shopping/Union Square
review.reviewText: We checked in a little early but our room was ready for us. Off we went to our room on a non-smoking floor only to find it stank of smoke! I called reception immediately and they could not apologise enough saying that the closest smoking floor was on 5th (our room was on 11th). We refused to stay in the room so they offered to hold our luggage while we went to get something to eat. On our return we had been checked into a huge suite with a separate dressing area and living area. We felt this more than made up for the earlier issue and we were assured that it would be looked into, the guy at reception told us they charge $400 to anyone who smokes in a non-smoking room! The rooms are basic but clean, we were only there for one night before heading off to Napa so it was fine for us. Walking distance to Union Square and shops, I would recommend!

review.title: Very good experience.
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. Great location. They do charge a lot for internet, drinks, phone calls etc. and they only have rooms with one King size bed, no doubles. Other than that everything was good.

review.title: Was nice but...would never pay regular rate for such a tiny and basic room
review.reviewText: Was looking forward to staying at this hotel....had heard how "fabulous" it was...found the room ok...little small...why no high def for t.v. in such a upscale hotel? Don't get me wrong...loved the location but expected a little more. If you can get a reduced rate on this place, take advantage of an amazing decor in the lobby and great location.

review.title: Surprised
review.reviewText: I had a relaxing time at this hotel. When we checked in everything went smoothly. The room was nice, large for a San Francisco hotel room. It had a separate living room and bedroom. The bed was soft just a little small and the walls are a little thin. I loved the 2 flat screen tv and the mirrors. Another plus was the iPod speakers. Just an FYI the room service is extremely expensive.

review.title: Different but still stylish
review.reviewText: (See Above)

review.title: Won't gp back
review.reviewText: Very nice lobby. Unfortunately the walls were paper thin. We could hear the people in the room next to us having sex and talking.

review.title: A liilte dark...
review.reviewText: Overall our stay at the Clift was good- the bed and sheets were excellent. I get the decor of the hotel but it was a little dark especially the elevators. It felt like we were entering a night club, actually at night the lobby was a night club. If you are looking for hip and trendy place to stay the Clift is the place.

review.title: funky, fun hotel
review.reviewText: A funky-boutique-type hotel with helpful staff and a great location. Our room had a bump-out desk area which provided a great spot for work. Bathroom was small but very adequate. Bed was comfy and our room was made-up quickly.

review.title: Dark and Sassy
review.reviewText: THe hotel has n ALice in WOnderlnd theme and is dimly lit, but very classy

review.title: Would go back for sure
review.reviewText:
Found a great rate on Expedia for last minute stay. Room was large, tastefully appointed. Loved the separate dressing area. Bathrooms nicely appointed.

Place has a very hip vibe but definitely works for those not a part of the hip crowd.

Room looked out on another building so was nice and quiet and had beautiful daylight.

review.title: Good choice in San Francisco
review.reviewText: We were aware of the fact that there is no sign in front of the hotel, just a series of beautiful tuscan evergreens. The hotel is very dramatic and beautifully designed. The hospitality throughout our stay was gracious, friendly and helpful. The rooms were small, but very comfortable. I would stay here again. Good location, comfortable spaces, friendly staff.

review.title: Unique hotel, relaxing atmosphere
review.reviewText:
My husband and I decided to stay at the Clift Hotel for our anniversary in September. It was very dark inside, very different from other hotels, but it was nice.

The location was ideal, not too far from MUNI, Union Square, China Town or the cable cars. The doormen were friendly and I felt safe, knowing they were there, when I went outside.

There were not any vending machines or an ice machine anywhere within the hotel. We had to order room service for ice if we needed it. Luckily, there was a Wal-Greens and several liquor/convenience type stores near by to buy snacks in.

The room had a thermostat in it, but even when I turned it way down to cool off, it took a while. I also brought my own fan, so I think that also helped a little. We thought it was a classy hotel, as everyone (guests included) were always dressed up. We wore jeans and sweatshirts, so we felt a little awkward, like there was supposed to be a dress code. We didn't spend a lot of time in the hotel, so it didn't bother us too much.

Overall, this hotel was pretty nice. It was clean, well maintained, and the people were polite and friendly. It had a relaxing atmosphere & convenient location.

review.title: Back again next year for Folsom '11
review.reviewText: Overall extremely satisfied, from hotel, to dining, events we attended, was an amazing trip

review.title: very pleased with location of hotel we could walk everywhere
review.reviewText: we were very pleased

review.title: Would stay again...
review.reviewText: Overall good experience, friendly staff and good location.. bar was awesome.. decor a but weird..

review.title: The lobby is Dark. Thanks Ian for the free upgrade
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Clift for the first week of September. Check in was smooth and our front desk guy Ian gave us a free upgrade. The lobby is very dark but nice with plenty of seating. Our room was spacious and nice right on the corner of the building, with floor to ceiling mirrors and a couple of chairs. There was a medium large stain on our carpet, didn't bother me considering the free upgrade and super corner room. The bed was firm so no sleeping on my stomach for very long ( I get a sore back), although perfect for sleeping on my back.. There were all kinds of items near and in the mini bar but everything cost money, hotel prices are steep. I just removed things from the fridge and let housekeeping know I wasn't purchasing anything and purchased my beverages a few blocks away. The beer and wine across the street is very expensive. Plan on seeing panhandlers depending on the time of day usually more at night there can be 3 on on one block. We walked pretty much everywhere from this location although many may not want to. We went to the market where the ferries run at the end of market street. We walked through china town all the way to fisherman's wharf and back. We also walked to as many of the scenic outlooks and hills. We did end up cabbing it to Haight Street to do some shopping but by then our legs were killing us.

review.title: i'm not going back
review.reviewText: too expensive for that room, i stayed in better hotel for less price, too much noise, we can hear the conversation of the next room, i not recomend this hotel at all, clift is just the name.

review.title: Love this hotel!
review.reviewText: Clift has a beautiful lobby and very trendy, well appointed rooms. The staff was friendly, professional and helpful! Parking was expensive at the hotel, but more reasonable at a garage less than a block away. Great location!

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: not very comfortable hotel. for example the stand in the bathroom to put toiletries was very small, and things kept falling off. The nightstand was tiny as well. there was only 1 robe in the closet not two.

review.title: Love this hotel, but the tiny bathroom!
review.reviewText:
Had stayed at The Clift years ago on business, and remembered it fondly as a lovely boutique hotel with the fabulous Redwood Bar.

The hotel service and location are excellent, but the hotel and bar had been renovated, and now have a darker quality. Some may like this atmosphere, I found it to be slightly brooding. But it definitely has character.

Overall, the weekend was lovely with one major exception, the tiny bathroom! We had reserved a mini-suite for us 3 women, a reunion, and the bathroom was NOT workable.

review.title: clift hotel
review.reviewText: close to most shopping and other scenic areas

review.title: The Clift
review.reviewText: Rooms are a bit small, but it is an old, stately establishment in the heart of downtown. It is comfortable and not pretentioius.

review.title: Interesting Room in a Good Location
review.reviewText: The Clift has a very interesting sense of style, which makes it interesting to visit. It's also in a great location, close to union square and lots of public transportation.

review.title: Clift outdoes itself...
review.reviewText: Fantastic hotel...Morgans Group properties really are the best.

review.title: Too Cool!!
review.reviewText: The hotel staff is exceptional...they were very accommodating to every request. The location is the absolute best that can be in San Francisco. The renovations are beautiful and very hip, very low lighting...everywhere. We have stayed at the Clift for many years and the recent renovations have definitely changed the personality of the hotel. The magnificent old Redwood Bar is now a meeting place for the 20 & 30-somethings. The drinks are twice the price of anywhere else in town. Our room was on the 10th floor and the noise from the bar on the first floor was very loud in our room until the wee hours of the morning...amazing that it could reach the 10th floor! We probably won't stay there again because it isn't our style....too cool for us.

review.title: nice but nothing special
review.reviewText: The hotel is nice. I would have expected more. we got a standard room wich is small especially the bathroom.

review.title: Rough start, nice finish
review.reviewText:
The staff at the Clift were all first rate and professional especially the ladies at the front desk who were bright, personable and beautiful.
I will stay there again.

review.title: Love the Clift!
review.reviewText: The Clift is always my first choice when I visit San Francisco, which is quite often. The hotel is understated (there's no sign outside), hip, and elegant. I was allowed to check in early and given an absolutely huge room... fantastic.

review.title: classy pad
review.reviewText: Great Hotel..with very clean,roomy and stylist rooms..Loved the style of the hotel and great Bar down stairs..Super service from all the staff and a great location of this hotel..Highly recommend this hotel to anyone..

review.title: Location excellent. Lots of diners for great breakfasts. Walked everywhere
review.reviewText: Great location. Can walk all over. Cable cars very nearby. Great little diners. Wonderful shopping

review.title: Awesome Artistic Contemporary Hotel
review.reviewText: Location and interior (artsy) of the hotel is awesome, however there were some issues with our actual room - e.g. drains not draining properly in the sinks and bathtub - when reported to the hotel staff, they took down our room number and said they'd get maintenance on it right away. The problem was never fixed the whole time we were there. We requested a wake up call one morning, which never occurred! Also, the hotel was pretty noisy (we were on the 6th floor); possibly being on a higher floor might help, but being so close to downtown it's impossible to escape some sort of 2am-6am noise.

review.title: Great location; not crazy about the modern style.
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a great location (5 min walk from the BART) and the service desk was very helpful. I didn't like the setup of the room (it wasn't very welcoming), the bathroom was tiny and uncomfortable, and there was no mini fridge (which is unusual for US hotels). But if you like the new artsy hotels, this is a great pick and pretty good value for your money.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: Service staff was very kind. Rooms look like an ad for an Ikea Store. Not into purple walls, either. Bed was good, but chairs very uncomfortable. $50 per day for parking and $26 for a buffet breakfast you could get for free at the Comfort Inn seems like a bit over the top. Couldn't wait to leave town.

review.title: Best stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel was amazing. The room was average size, clean and had a Bose iPod dock which we thought was a plus. The hotel bar was the place to be at night. The drinks were good but a bit pricey considering its a hotel bar. We were walking distance to many of the other bars/clubs in the area and minutes away from the cable cars. All in all, we enjoyed our stay at the Clift Hotel.

review.title: I'll never stay there again
review.reviewText: Motol 8 is better then this place had a nice bar area that was it. I was waiting for my bags to get to me for over 30 min

review.title: very tired place
review.reviewText: Needs some upkeep: painting, cosmetic updating, chipped tile in bathroom, etc. very worn.

review.title: Expensive, impractical, shop-around!
review.reviewText: This hotel is over-priced - shop around. There is no free Wifi in the room, unlike that offered by a much cheaper hotel across the road ( I went and asked). We had a "Superior Luxury" room, but it had nowhere to store your folded clothes! The only solution offered was to pack and move room. Drinks are thar bar are very expensive - pop out to a less pretentious, fun local bar instead. The Lobby floor is so poorly lit you can bearly see where you are going when you come in on a sunny day. This said, the staff are ok/friendly, and the hotel looks great if you are the kind of person that needs to be seen in a "cool" place - you will pay for it.

review.title: Elegant & Trendy in one of San Francisco´s most convinient areas.
review.reviewText: Classy and trendy at the same time, a fun place to stay, nice bar for drinks, great food at the restaurant, well located, excelent service and nice rooms. All the staff really nice.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: The staff are the best. Feels like home.

review.title: Fun place to stay
review.reviewText:
Expected a small romm but was pleasantly surprised--very comfortable space and on high floor with nice view. Very good value!
Lobby and public areas dark but was warned in advance. Services excellent especially concierge. Sent us to "local" places, not the usual "tourist" places.
Needs a bit updating: such as shades that were broken.

review.title: The Clift, Much Improved Over Last Time
review.reviewText: Our stay at the Clift was our second. This time was far better than the first. The room was well appointed, and free of the various high priced consumer items the Clift was previously promoting for sale. The concierge was extremely helpful, knowledgeable, and enthusiastic. The Clift bar, a highlight of the hotel was as beautiful as ever, and even accommodating given that we were far beyond the 20 somethings that make the room rock. All in all, a superior experience, and we will come back.

review.title: nice find
review.reviewText: convenient location, really friendly staff.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location. Terrific staff. The usual trendoid clientele visiting the bar tho... The hotel lived up to expectations in all regards except the room. I booked what was variously marketed as a "Loft Suite" which really turned out to be a standard square box room... Lets just call it what it is... otherwise, we had no complaints of the hotel whatsoever

review.title: Uber cool hotel in a perfect location
review.reviewText:
Very chic - more so in the public areas. Couple of blocks from Union Square and great restaurants, and deli's, to suit all budgets. Rooms were good but a little frayed in some areas and not up to the standard of the public areas.

Room service was superb! Fast - if you've ever tried to just get coffee in a 'vanilla' corporate hotel, you'll relate to this.. - with delivery within 10 minutes and geninely warm staff.

Kiehl's toiletries were a nice touch, too. Shame I couldn't have 'released' more of them!

review.title: Christmas Weekend in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Great location for Christmas season. Funky hotel with high end amenities.

review.title: Sophisticated San Francisco
review.reviewText: Having read other reviews of the The Clift, we arrivedwith one or two concerns However, the hotel far exceeded our expectations, and we would have no hesitation in recommending it to anyone looking for a stylish, upmarket and friendly place to stay right in the centre of the city. Full marks.

review.title: Clift Hotel
review.reviewText: We had an excellent stay at the Clift. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

review.title: Best Deal in San Fran
review.reviewText: Our room had a water view and extremely large living space. Rooms beautiful. We were with a large group and everyone congregated in our room. The night club downstairs was very convenient and packed with lots of pretty people. The staff were very nice and very professional. A++++

review.title: Caught up in its own pretention
review.reviewText: This hotel has an attitude problem. My husband and I usually book into well-known hotels, but as this was a birthday getaway I wanted something a bit different. This hotel believes that its design credentials is enough to satisfy its rating. We were there for four nights and the service we received was no different than what you would receive in the equivalent of a Travelodge. This is not a quintessential boutique hotel. The services within the hotel are limited, there is one restaurant with a very narrow and pretentious theme. The rooms are small and were not cleaned very well. When we needed help the reception staff were reluctant to help. This is not a value for money hotel and we were very glad to leave.

review.title: Friendly service, fading decor, problematic neighborhood
review.reviewText:
The staff were friendly, cheerful, professional, top rate.
The Phillipe Starck decor is interesting, but trendy goes stale faster than fish left on the counter, and this seems headed that way, though just a personal opinion.
The property is in the Tenderloin district with sleazy businesses surrounding it. I suppose a typical problem with downtowns in many cities, but it certainly is not a charming location.
If you want to walk, need to be downtown, and don't plan to walk alone at night, this is a good hotel, and a good value.

review.title: Happy we stayed here instead!
review.reviewText: We ended up staying here because the hotel we wanted was booked. We will stay here again for sure! The room was very comfortable. The best nights sleep in a long time. The only complaint is the bathroom is a little cramped but I guess that's what you get with a boutique hotel.

review.title: can't wait to go back!
review.reviewText: Great hotel, great location! Loved the bar & restaurant!

review.title: Firm Beds
review.reviewText: The hotel is beautiful and the staff very friendly. The workout room is great. The location is wonderful. But there was a problem; the bed was so hard that we woke up in pain.

review.title: Beautifully designed, but not very comfortable & very clubby
review.reviewText: Public areas & rooms are gorgeous, but definitely at the expense of comfort. Place is a little too hip - they seem to be much more concerned about the very loud bar & restaurant in the hotel than about the guests. Service seemed to be an after thought. Great location.

review.title: Very chic designer's hotel in the middle of downtown SF
review.reviewText: The hotel room was very stylish, and very clean and comfortable. The hotel itself from the lobby to the restaurant, bar is very cool. A little bit on the dark side, but stylish nonetheless. The restaurant food was fantastic!!! I would go there again just for the food as well, if I couldn't book the hotel next time.

review.title: Good service but loud clientele.
review.reviewText: I could hear the guests in the nexzt room's TV the entie night. When I complained to the front desk they asked it be turned down but I could hear it anyway. Amenities in room were incomplete - I lacked a shower cp and soap and had to ask for it. I was also charged $3,00 for a sewing kit which is normally included free in other hotels. I also thought the charge for wi-fi was exhoritant!

review.title: Clift
review.reviewText: Very trendy hotel with excellent common areas. Room decor could have been a little nicer to match the common areas.

review.title: Impressive
review.reviewText: We were very impressed with the Clift. We had never been to San Francisco before and we enjoyed our stay very much. We were sticker shocked by the valet parking fee though. Otherwise we would recommend it to our friends.

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: At the Expedia rate it was a great value, good size room, clean, well located next to Union Square

review.title: Just Okay
review.reviewText: The bathroom was small, there was no counter top space. You could easily hear people in the other rooms and the hall even if they weren't talking loud.

review.title: Great!
review.reviewText: Would recomend to other travelers, I can't wait to go back myself!

review.title: Not 100% happy with service
review.reviewText: The Clift was an amazing hotel in terms of location, interior design and reputation however during our time there the service was not fantastic. To start off with we had a less than satisfactory experience in the bar with one of the waitresses. As for the rest of the staff, they were not as welcoming as what I have experienced within the Hotel group. We would probably stay there again......

review.title: great place, nice people, very helpful
review.reviewText: Very up beat hotel, people that worked there , are very friendly and helpful. Hotel is in a great location.

review.title: Thicker Wall Needed
review.reviewText: Room is nice with modern design; however, you can hear all your neighbors conversations. It is really unpleasant to be wakening up by unwanted noise at middle night. The concierge service is average, taking us a whole day to get a requested item. I probably will not choose this hotel again given these experiences.

review.title: Groovy Hotel
review.reviewText: It is a fabulous place to stay!!

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel was excellent. My only criticsm is that the rooms were a little small and you have to call room service/front desk in order to get ice. Staff was extremely polite and knowledgeable.

review.title: Overall Great Place to Stay
review.reviewText: Great place to stay. Centrally located. Very friendly staff and super helpful Concierge and door men. Room was bright and clean.

review.title: Very impressed
review.reviewText: Had a great one night stay at the Clift in June on the way back from Napa Valley before driving down towards LA. Perfect for a bit of luxury before hitting the road. We had a luxury king room on the 8th floor and it was spacious and well designed. Bathroom was on the small side to give maximum bedroom space but very attractive. Staff were great and breakfast in the adjoining Asia de Cuba restaurant was lovely if a bit too huge and very expensive. We'd probably leave the hotel for breakfast at a cafe or diner next time. Location is great for access to restaurants and shops and we'd definitely stay there again.

review.title: Luxury goods vs. luxury service
review.reviewText: If hotel decor is all, then the Clift is for you. Hip design is carried through from lobby to room. Hipsters in the bar scene, fantastic bar/lobby that exploits the original interior well. BUT, as a guest the decor takes over the experience at great expense to service. The hotel is more concerned with itself than its guests. Nickel and diming, from ridiculously priced water in the room, the consumer items for sale in the room--cd's, throws, etc., the Frette linens towels and linens--all bespeak of the Hotel's need to identify name brand amenities, and to retail them. Absolutely unnecessary. Concierge service is not strong, reliance on Open Table rather than developing a relationship with area restaurants and articulating to them that the guest is from the Clift, and that their (the concierge's and the hotel's reputation is on the line). In short, the hotel casts itself as a tastemaker, wants its guest to be consumers of products it identifies, and profits from their sale, rather than concentrate on serving the guest and meeting guest needs.

review.title: Great service
review.reviewText: The hotel staff could not be more helpful. We enjoyed our stay in San Fransisco thanks to their recommendations on places to see and eat at. The hotel has a happening vibe to it. Its the place to be in San Fran.

review.title: Clift Hotel . . . an experience!
review.reviewText: This building used to be the Four Seasons, and its recent renovation has retained its classic beauty but interpreted the decor in a most pleasing key--redwood forest. The deep, warm redwood motif of the lobby level is breath-taking and magical. The artistry of the grand lobby flows quietly into its interpretation in the intimate space of the adjoining "Library," into the classic grandeur of the dining room, and into the inviting restrained elegance of the bar where a lively scene every night provides entertainment even for those who prefer to watch the comings and goings of youthful party people from the quiet comfort of the library or the cozy surrounds of the giant fireplace. The upper floors are light and airy as the ground floors are dark and intimate. When the elevator opens, one is immersed in soft, pale lilac-greys, pearl, and silver--as if emerging through the redwood forest valleys into the tree top fogs of the Bay area. The chef is top notch! Service in all areas the most professional and warm. All is perfect as long as those doormen keep opening the huge entry doors, which are much too heavy for the guest who does not work out daily...--perhaps the doors suggest entry into an enormous castle in the middle of a very old magic forest....but everything is high tech, friendly, and warm the minute you cross the threshold. Perfectly located with plenty of good little places to pick up light fare, convenient to theatres and shopping, you can't beat the Clift!

review.title: YOU JUST CAN'T FIND A BUT...
review.reviewText: Excellent service, All the crew are very efficient, friendly, helpfull and nice people. The whole concept of the hotel is very nice, edgie, modern and elegant. The only thing I notice is that the sound insulation on walls between rooms are not quite good.

review.title: Great location, great hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel was great for us, as it was located near everything. There are a lot of good restaurants around, and you can catch public transportation if you walk just a few blocks. Would definitely recommend!

review.title: Chic and Central
review.reviewText: Clift Hotel is well placed within easy reach of underground and overground transport around the city and great shopping just a brief walk away. There are theatres and galleries surrounding the hotel and some very good eateries from diners to restaurants again within a few minutes walk.

review.title: Very Posh!
review.reviewText: I was recently in SF for a romantic getaway and we had a WONDERFUL weekend at the Clift. Our room was very comfortable and the decor very chic and our view marvelous. We were in walking distance easily of sights and the hotel car could take us to other locations at a decent fee. The hotel bar is very hip and we had a great time hanging out there. Highly recommended and I am big luxury hotel person so don't recommend lightly.

review.title: Great!!....But.....
review.reviewText: The staff is friendly and helpful. Checking in was easy. The doormen were great. We upgraded to a corner suite and....WOW!! Amazing room. Room service was quick and good. The only issue is there are not enough concierge attendants. It was difficult to get them on the phone before our stay and even during. We stood at the concierge desk several times and gave up - we ended up asking the doormen for a recommendation. Overall good, but need more concierge.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Great location and incredible staff, they always had recomendations on where to eat and how to get there.. they were very friendly and accomidating and the rooms were incredible. very clean and the bed was comfortable!

review.title: Best Vacation Ever
review.reviewText: The Clift was the perfect hotel for the best vacation I've ever had. The staff was super friendly and able to answer any and all of my questions. The hotel was clean, comfortable and just totally fantastic.

review.title: Nice place
review.reviewText: Nice ambiance. Would stay there again.

review.title: Obviously geared for the under 40 set
review.reviewText: Anyone over 60, which would include all of my friends would find it intimidating as I did that I am not connected to an i-pod, i-phone or any other i-electronic device for local information. Not a telephone book, tourist restaurant guide or any other printed information was available in the room or the hotel for that matter. The hotel staff (all under 30) were helpful, but unable to understand my dilema and need for printed matter. Also, the room service menu in the room along with other hotel service information was printed on vinyl sheets in lavendar in what had to be 5 pt type that I needed a magnifying glass to decifer. The mirrored walls in the room and bathroom were also not a very complimentary feature, except for the fact that the lighting was so low that you couldn't see much anyway.

review.title: Amazing location, beautiful interior, lovely fresh decor in bedrooms and nice crisp bed linen
review.reviewText: This hotel was ideally situated a couple of blocks from Union Square, Modern decor and attention to quality and cleanliness. Young vibrant hotel staff and no in your face service. Definitely I would return if in the SF area again

review.title: Beautful place
review.reviewText: Great location,friendly staff,close to everything.

review.title: A great place to stop
review.reviewText: Perfectly central, sexy and oppulent. Clift is a perfect place to stop for exploring San fran. We stayed for 2 nights and found the hotel great. Staff were very friendly and helpful, the rooms were well appointed and extremely comfortable (the starched white bedlinen was wonderful) and the overall feel very welcoming. transport and walking links are excellent. Highly recommended if you want a romantic/contemporary/funky side to your trip!

review.title: Stylish and professional
review.reviewText: Staff helpful; design well executed and excellent bar and restaurant.

review.title: Great location, awful room
review.reviewText: Our room was next to the service elevator and it was extremely noisy. Also, there was a very narrow path between the desk and the bed and we had bruises on our legs from bumping into the bed. The bathtub did not drain properly but was repaired during our stay. Overall, I would not recommend this hotel.

review.title: Pleasant weekend in SF
review.reviewText: Friendly staff, door was always opened for us, front desk helped us get a car to the airport and ship a package home, and cocktail waitress in "living room" was fine. Rooms were not huge, but had everything we needed and mirrors made them feel larger. Beds were nice and we slept well.

review.title: A good place for clubers
review.reviewText: This is a nice, hotel but geared for the cluber/party person. For the middle aged tourist, not a good place to stay.

review.title: the service ROCKS!
review.reviewText: service was great....location is FAB. concierge goes out of their way to make you feel VIP. The room is small but it's SF...the bed is NOT comfortable at all (unless you like hard beds) blocks away from union square, a short bart ride into the mission- overall a really nice weekend.

review.title: Mixed review
review.reviewText: This is not the classic Clift Hotel of the past. It has gone trendy and chic, with an upscale modern approach that disowns its classic past. On the positive side, the bed was wonderful and the staff was terrific. Concierge was outstanding. Fitness center was excellent - good equipment, well maintained, more than expected for this size hotel. The negatives: no dresser or chest of drawers, not even a nightstand with drawers, anywhere in the sparsely furnished room, meaning you live out of your suitcase. No coffee maker. The Redwood Room still tries to be a classic bar, but it's gotten more glitzy and a double bourbon on the rocks was $24. Ouch! I also miss the French Room, a wonderfully elegant classic restaurant that has been replaced by a trendy NY bistro that is all sizzle. This is definitely the place for the 21-35 crowd, but not for the seasoned business traveler.

review.title: Very cool hotel
review.reviewText: Well the Clift lived up to expectations of Morgan chain - very chic and cool place. Staff very efficient and helpful. Great lobby and sittng areas, the Redwood bar is superb - great for a relaxing cocktail. The superior room I had was large with super king size bed, bathroom with tub and shower - loved it and so much better than poky room in Hudson . Very central and 10 mins walk to BART to airport. Will try and and stay here next trip!

review.title: Well designed hotel with an awesome Redroom bar... Cool place to hang out in the evenings...
review.reviewText: Have stayed at Clift for the weekend with a friend, two girls (27-28 y.o) coming for a short weekend in SFO and looking for a luxury ( but not boring) hotel with a good location to explore the city and some entertainment later in the evening in the hotel bar... We could not have found a better place! Were totally satisfied. I must say we did not even want to go anywhere else and spent most of the evenings there... Thanks to the Redroom... Clift is known for its very well designed lobby and the Redroom. A stunning, elegant lounge with beautiful digital paintings, an enormous bar, and chic redwood paneling and a nice crowd.... The Redwood Room is one of the most luxurious night spots in San Francisco. Get quite crowded in the evening. Great place, nice crowd, we loved it ! See many people are saying the staff was rude, was not the case with us. Everybody was friendly and very helpful... So if you are single and looking for the hotel with the nice bar to hang out in the evening ( together with the good locations, service etc ), this is the place to be. I would not dare to recommend it for the families with the kids though. Depends on what you are looking for. We were extemely happy and satisfied... And have a had a great weekend. Thank you, CLIFT ! ;-)

review.title: classy hotel - AVOID THE RESTAURANT !
review.reviewText: Service was attentive, but not overbearing. Decor was everything I expected - smart, clean, & well maintained. Bathrooms were a bit small, yes, but the bedsheets made up for it. Stayed on the 11th floor & noise level was very low. Only disappointment was Asia de Cuba - you are better off saving a couple hundred dollars & getting dinner from a street vendor- promise. (Foodies beware).

review.title: Glamourous and high tech
review.reviewText: Excelent hotel. Impeccable service. Perfect location. And I got it for an exceptional rate with Expedia. It is definitely worth more when compared to others.

review.title: Didnt meet the 4 star rating
review.reviewText: My room was clean and nice. The bed was not comfortable at all. The bathroom was also very clean but in need of some updating. It was a bit wore out. The bathroom was very small which would be fine if the space wasnt taken up with bad design. The lobby and bar are beautiful but the bar turns into quite the seen on the weekends. On the weekend if you want to sit in the bar rather than at the bar, you have to drop $300 or more on a bottle or forget it. Not too much of my thing but could be fun for thirty-somthings. My ironing board had make-up all over it. But it was replaced after a phone call. I sent my shoes to be shined and they came back just as they were sent........ In need of a shine. The hotel is beautiful but a class can be taught on the number of design flaws of this hotel. For the price there are much better hotels. I give it 3 stars rather than the 4 they claim.

review.title: Just appearance
review.reviewText: Not an excellent service. They should threat the the guest staying at the hotel better then the people going to drink at the redwood room.

review.title: Very impressed
review.reviewText: The hotel was very well maintained. The bar and restaurant were a little on the expensive inside, so be prepared. There were a large amount of homeless in the surrounding neighborhood. The staff and concierge were extremely friendly and helpful. I would definitely return to the Clift on my next visit to San Francisco.

review.title: Great hotel but not always completely accommodating
review.reviewText: The Clift is amazing space for those who are big on design features and who want a very good location in San Francisco. The rooms are great and the beds very very comfortable. This is true Phillipe Starck design (eat in Asia de Cuba if youhave a chance). You must have a cocktail in the bar with the digital artwork. The only very small issue with this hotel is that there are no facilities in the room for making your own tea/coffee so you have to order and pay for room service. And bottled water in the room is $11 USD for 1 Litre! Also, the staff were not completely accommodating when we asked for a birthday treat for one of our party.

review.title: very comfortable
review.reviewText: Though there were a few snaffu's with the billing of our hotel room, the service was good and the beds were very comfortable. Our room did have carpet stains here and there, which we thought was unacceptable. That said , I would probably go back.

review.title: Fancy hotel suitable for travelling with kids
review.reviewText: me and my 3 year old spent a week at the Clift and had a wonderful time, even though the hotel is very chic and fancy I found it to be quite suitable for travelling with kids; kids friendly restaurants are close by and the staff is very helpful, the rooms might be on the smaller side and the bathrooms too, but still sufficient for hanging out after a logn sightseeing day...the room's mini bar is big enough for storing milk...

review.title: Fantastic!!!
review.reviewText: Everything was great. The decor is so luxurious and fascinating, the staff was friendly and helpful and it's right in the center of everything!! I absolutely recommend The Clift

review.title: Fun, Trendy, Upscale Crowd
review.reviewText: I love Morgan's properties, and this one meets expectations. There's no need to even leave for a good scene at night because you can just walk downstairs. I love hotels with a scene. I have stayed at the Shore Club, Mondrian, and Delano in Miami; the Mondrian in LA; and now the Clift in SF. They all have a trendy upscale crowd, and I will continually stay at all of them. The service was great, Asia de Cuba is fab, and the location is right by Union Square.

review.title: Boutique Hotel Near Union Square
review.reviewText: I really enjoy staying at the Clift. The staff go out of their way to be helpful and attentive. The rooms are a decent size but the bathrooms are tiny. Be sure to ask the doormen for restaurant and bar suggestions as they are extremely helpful

review.title: So close to everything
review.reviewText: The Clift Hotel has a wonderful ambiance. The rooms are small but very comfortable and fully stocked for your stay. I love the location.....just steps to Union Square for shopping and great restaurants. Or simply stay on site and enjoy dining at Asia De Cuba and/or have a cocktail in the cool Redwood Room. Our number one place to stay in San Francisco. I highly recommend it!

review.title: Very Nice
review.reviewText: Pros: Location, great lobby, bar area & bath products. Cons: Bathroom is tiny, walls are paper thin.

review.title: Great Location - Lobby - Room - Bar - Staff
review.reviewText: This place is fun! You must eat at Asia De Cuba (choose the tasting menu and the union square cocktail). Look under the big chair in lobby. The rooms are great. The staff is helpful (can do). The location is walking distance from 80% of where you would want to do. If you don't stay - go for drinks....

review.title: n
review.reviewText: we booked this hotel for a few days and were pleased with it. it was very stylish and very central. staff were unfailingly helpful.

review.title: Too Noisy
review.reviewText: Walls are too thin, too much noise after hours, but then it is a hotel for younger people and they probably would not mind. Since we are 50-60, it is not the best place for people wanting a quiet evening.

review.title: I would go back and stay there.
review.reviewText: Great customer service and professional staff. I was impress since I usually stay in the same family hotels in different cities not the same service.

review.title: Clift is on the edge
review.reviewText: Hotel has been wonderfully renovated in a modern progressive style, yet harkening on the original grandeur. Unfortunately, one of the elements that resemble the past is the insanely tiny bathroom. Be prepared to bang your funny bone more than once... even in the upgraded rooms. The pulse in the social areas is hip, current and on the move. Best way into the Redwood Room on a Saturday night is to be a guest at the hotel.

review.title: Loved staying at The Clift!
review.reviewText: This hotel has so much character, mood and great vibes. Excellent location near everything. The staff were gracious and tremendously helpful with everything from booking restaurants, directions etc. The concierge also booked a flight to Burbank for us and found a flight that cost 1/3 of most other flights, very impressive. The Redwood Room rocks most nights and the clientele changes from more men and business types during the week (all very friendly) to (somewhat younger and more couples on weekends) but still lots of action . The elevators are very sexy, each one a different hue: smoky emerald, smoky crimson, smoky cobalt blue....with funky lounge music going 24/7. Enjoyed the mood of low lighting everywhere. The rooms were great, a bit small but the high ceilings made up for it. Our only complaint was that we didn't have a chest of drawers in the room...but managed with the closet space. Didn't try the restaurant. All in all an experience not to be missed!

review.title: Great place to party
review.reviewText: Room and bathroom are very basic but new, relatively spacious. Cool bar/lounge and good fitness center

review.title: none
review.reviewText: none

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: The Clift is in a wonderful location - just 2 mins walk from Union Square - ideal for the shops and 10 mins from Moscone centre. It was clean, comfortable and the only downside was that the room was quite small in comparison to other San Francisco hotels I have stayed in. The bathroom was very small! Other than that it has a 24 hr gym - great for those of us in the wrong time zone and the room service was prompt and food was good.

review.title: Hotel staff were excellent
review.reviewText: What made this stay standout was the hotel staff, including the front door staff,the front desk, concierge, & housekeeping. They provided excellent service & were very helpful. We would return again because of this.

review.title: impressed
review.reviewText: excellent hotel that made for a very comfortable stay.

review.title: Worth a try
review.reviewText: The Clift Hotel was situated in a convenient position very near to Union Square and therefore near plenty of good pubs and restaurants. I would not recommend a left turn outside the hotel particularly at night as you are soon in one of San Frans less solubrious areas. The hotel is very trendy but we found the interior to be far too dark and were not impressed by the bar prices. The staff were very attentive and friendly and the positioning of the mirrors in the rooms and the reflection they create is something I have not seen before.

review.title: TOTALLY DECIEVED - The rooms were NOT like the nice bar, restaurant and lobby!
review.reviewText: The rooms were so uncomfortable. The walls were tacky purple. The furniture was extremely uncomfortable. The hotel was very ghetto. I was surprised because it was so expensive. The hotel lobby, bar and Cuba de Asia are so nice...basically, the first floor was awesome but everything else above was so nasty and ghetto.

review.title: Great hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: I travel to San Francisco on a regular basis, Clift is always a pleasure to stay at, and the redwood room is always a great place to start or end the evening. I look forward to my next stay.

review.title: Great atmosphere and nightlife!!!!
review.reviewText: Very hip hotel with great atmosphere and nightlife! Food is great in Asia De Cuba!

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: My husband and stayed at the Clift for 5 nights and we were very disappointed. We specifically asked for a room as high as possible because we are very familiar with the city traffic and noise. We started on the 9th floor and moved rooms later that evening to the 16th floor. This time we couldn't hear any city traffic noise, although we were kept up all night by the loud noises of the elevators... ear plugs didn't help. In addition, the bed and pillows were extremely uncomfortable. The room seemed dingy. We couldn't wait to get home.

review.title: Trendy Hotel
review.reviewText: I woudl stay in the hotel again. The interior design is very trendy and chic and the service is excellent.

review.title: if u r young and like lpud, this is the place for you
review.reviewText: The hotel was contemporary and very hip. For my taste, it was too loud and dark! Give me some light.

review.title: Good for staying up all night.
review.reviewText: My husband and I wanted to get away from the kids for an "adult weekend" and we love the serene and sexy rooms at the Clift. But you always run the risk of a coked-up party group from the bar scene downstairs ending up in a room near you. If you are engaged in your own activities all night, this is fine, but if you are planning on any sleep at all, it's a gamble. The desk staff honored our request for a quiet room, but on Saturday night, although we got in around 1 am ourselves, the room next to us had one of those all night partiers who kept us up until 6 am. It shot our Sunday plans. I'll probably do a more adult hotel next time.

review.title: Stylish and friendly
review.reviewText: We were really impressed with the size and comfort of the bedroom. The decor of the hotel is wonderfully stylish without being cold, and the front of desk staff were so friendly and helpful. We had a hiccup with the 'free' flight check-in service in the downstairs Business Centre, but this was rapidly and efficiently sorted out for us. All in all a great experience and we would certainly stay there again.

review.title: Magnificent hotel for business & pleasure
review.reviewText: This is an ideal hotel for the business traveler. The service is great and it's a brief drive from SF Int'l airport.

review.title: great location!
review.reviewText: We walked to the wharf from the hotel...it was a hike but a nice walk.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Clift Hotel for 3 nights on the 3rd floor. It's in a very busy area and was noisy all night. The rooms are nicely decorated but the bathroom was very small and had very low lighting. No coffee or fridge in the room either. And be aware; $50.00 per day parking!! We had no idea when we got there. But around the corner there is a lot that is $24.00 per day with in and out priviledges. Otherwise the lobby is dark but beautifully decorated and the employees are very helpful.

review.title: Location is excellent
review.reviewText: Union Square location central to all transportation and easy to get to major attractions. Bell/Door staff very welcoming. When entering from bright outside, hard to adjust eyes to dark interior of hotel.

review.title: Service better than expected
review.reviewText: Since it was a boutique hotel, I expected snooty service. But the service was friendly and excellent. Two small problems: 1) Although I was in a non-smoking room, some smoke entered my room thru the bathroom HVAC. 2) My room had a 19in tube TV! The hotel sent me an online customer survey where I noted these issues. I was promptly emailed stating that they try to police the smoking and that they are in the process of installing modern TVs.

review.title: great!
review.reviewText: This was a great stay in a great hotel.

review.title: Great bar and lounge area with mediocre rooms
review.reviewText: I thought the highlight of staying in this hotel was the happening nightlife and the trendy decor. I was a bit dissappointed with the color of choice in the hallways and the entryway to your room. The bathrooms were very small, but had soft fluffy towels. The Gym located in the hotel was the nicest that i've seen throughout my many hotel stays. I would recommend partying there on the weekends, but staying somewhere else.

review.title: na
review.reviewText: The hotel was very "posh" and upscale, yet you walked outside and into bumland. We went for a walk after checking into the hotel and were asked for money no less than 20 times over the next 30 minutes. The hotel looked good...but thats about it. the bed was the hardest bed I have personally ever slept on and both my fiance and I woke up with back aches the next day. If you can handle those two things and want to be in a trendy up-scale hotel for some night life...then It wouldnt be a bad place to visit. For myself i prefer a bit more relaxing than this.

review.title: Fell in love over and over again...
review.reviewText: I love the Clift, the people..the area...the rooms! Everyone was so nice and it was an amazing trip!

review.title: at the heart of the city
review.reviewText: This one was one of my best stay and the hotel reminded me of paris hotels the way they have kept there lobby is like a lounge bar it self and the elevators they are just beautifull

review.title: Great weekend gateway
review.reviewText: As I family, we like Boutique Hotel, so we loved the hotel and location is great. However, if you are looking for typical family hotel, this is not your hotel. We stay in loft suite and room was more than enough for us.

review.title: One of the best
review.reviewText: I can't wait to come back to this hotel. the staff was friendly. the hotel was gorgeous. it's like an attraction all in itself.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Good hotel to stay in if you want to be in the middle of the shopping district. Easy to walk to public transit or cabs to get to other locations around the city. I would recommend this hotel to friends. Very trendy hotel.

review.title: Nice Enough
review.reviewText: The Clift Hotel has an impressive lobby and phenomenal bar. The rooms are somewhat spartan and the beds are very uncomfortable. There is some quaint charm to the rooms with the older style and design, but it literally was difficult to open and shut my room door because there were so many layers of paint from years of painting and repainting. It seems that the much-heralded extensive renovations are only on the surface. Also, the lobby was exceedingly busy with little room to stand around and wait to be checked in. The concierge desk was placed oddly close to the front desk, causing crowds to build up even when things were relatively quiet.

review.title: Will be back ASAP
review.reviewText: Perfect stay. Great room, nice staff, beautiful hotel. The Redwood Room bar was my favorite part. A great time.

review.title: Not a 4 star hotel.
review.reviewText: Small old rooms, small bathroom. The room was fine but it was more like a 3 star hotel.

review.title: very interesting nightlife
review.reviewText: great hotel in hot location. One of the hottest bars in San Francisco in lobby so don't be surprised by crowds. I did not stay over a weekend so it wasn't a problem.

review.title: modern elegance
review.reviewText: modern elegance meets a touch of artistic fun: from the moment you step into the lobby it's like walking into a modern-day version of alice in wonderland in clean, cool mixes of grey and purple with rich reds and gold. very sophisticated yet welcoming. every corner you turn there seems to be some unique object of interest. the lounge - although a great time and truly beautiful - can be obnoxious if you are not looking for a club scene (bottle service and reservation-only tables) after hours, but we enjoyed our pricey cocktails and people-watching before the scene started up at our own table which was warm and comfortable. the staff is extremely focused on making sure that hotel guests come first and went out of their way to make sure we were taken care of. our room was simple luxury in cream, lavender and bright orange - very calm, serene and refreshing. the room was small, but did not feel that way because of an ingenious use of curtains and mirrors - instead the room felt bright and open. great job at maximizing space. the staff was incredibly friendly and helpful all around.

review.title: Best Hotel in SF.....So far.
review.reviewText: I have never stayed at The Clift before. My gf and I (both 25) were looking for a swanky/edgy hotel kinda like a W that was well priced, pictures looked fun and central location. The Clift is where its at. Apon arrival we were upgraded to a HUGE room. Everything was very nice and there was The Redwood Room in the lobby that was a super fun club. The staff was helpful in everyway, town cars we available for $15 to go almost anywhere right out front, everything was perfect. But if I was to have to pick one minor flaw was the confort of the bed, was OK and the rooms had tacky old tube TVs, which we never used so who cares. I am going to recomend this hotel to everyone I know. For a SF hotel it has been my best experience yet. Try it out I guarentee you will enjoy as well.

review.title: Would stay there again. Very helpful
review.reviewText: Employees were very personable and helpful. Gave excellent advice for entertainment and restaurants.

review.title: Cool hotel; great experience.
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Clift for one night. I had stayed at the HUDSON in Manhattan a year ago and enjoyed that hotel. Expedia's deal on a room at the Clift was great.

review.title: Would stay at the Clift again
review.reviewText: Overall the hotel was great. It is in a fantastic location only a couple of blocks from Union Square. The rooms while on the small side are comfortable enough. The Red Room downstairs while expensive has a great ambience. The only knock on the hotel is the TV's in the room are old small CRT TVs. Replace those with a big LCD and you're in business.

review.title: Gem of a hotel
review.reviewText: CLIFT may not be for everyone but if you love trendy/funky decor and the local flavor of the Tenderloin District then this is the place for you! Top notch service at the front desk as well as housekeeping.

review.title: Superb, stylish and great service.
review.reviewText: Our second stay in a Morgans group hotel and it maintained the excellent standards we have come to expect. Helpfull, prompt staff abound. Door men who remember who you right away. Daily turn down service etc. Room was huge by city standards, bathroom smaller but nicely thought out. Huge comfy bed too. Lobby amazing as always and the bar had a really good vibe by about 9pm. Totally recommended for 20/30 trendy types but high quality and good service make it a good stay for almost any age (except maybe children)

review.title: Would go back if I need to stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Great Hotel. Great location. Room size is not as small as I read in some reviews. Even it is not the largest out there, it is decent size. I very liked the way it is furnished - very high quality. Very friendly staff who is actually listening to your needs.

review.title: Loved it!
review.reviewText: We had so much fun---the staff was extremely customer service focused, very friendly and helpful. From the waitstaff in the restaurant to the staff in the bar to the front desk folks--the way they went out of their way to make sure you were comfortable and happy. I was quite impressed. The bar scene is definitely the place to be as well! A lot of fun! Beautiful hotel--the bathrooms are a little small--but other than that, every part about the hotel was perfect! I can't wait to go back!

review.title: Not quite as good as last time - getting a little tired
review.reviewText: Still a lovely hotel - very trendy bar (a place to be seen in). Food was excellent - although a little pricey (but usual at this end of the market). Some of the fittings are getting a little tired though - the room I stayed in was fine, except for the bathroom - which was in need of a refit. There was the odd chip in the enamel, the sealant was going, the chrome was scratched on the fittings and the shower/bath didn't drain properly. I don't expect this at this end of the market. Summary: insist on a refurbished room.

review.title: Classic Elegance - Great location
review.reviewText: If you are looking for a travel experience in a beautiful old hotel, then the Clift is the place for you. Walking distance to Union Square and the Cable cars and a staff earger to make you stay memorable. What could be better. Food prices are high, but that is typical for San Francisco.

review.title: Fun, good location, rooms dated
review.reviewText: The lobby/bar/restaurant are very cool and what you would expect from an Ian Schrager/Morgans Hotel. The rooms are also what you would expect, minimalist and plain. Ours was suprisingly big, but dissapointingly old with a tiny bathroom. The front desk service was a bit slow, but all very nice and helpful. The location is very good for getting around the city. Overall, its a good place for younger people and people there for a fun weekend.

review.title: surprisingly excellent
review.reviewText: we were bracing for the worst, thinking we'd be punished in service for staying somewhere "cool." wrong! this place certainly was cool, (though a little annoying you need a reservation even at 4 for a drink at the bar), and the service was almost over-attentive. we were VERY pleased.

review.title: Great hotel, great style, great location
review.reviewText: The only drawback (at least for me)was that the lobby and lounge tend to fill up with REALLY young people (like High School age) who are loud and obnoxious. We just avoided it, and it was fine.

review.title: The Clift was awesome!
review.reviewText: Upon arrival at The Clift on Saturday afternoon (falling a long haul flight from Europe) I arrived in my friends convertible and famished. The staff had me checked in, oriented, and back out the door with my friend to lunch in just a few quick minutes. When I returned I felt that there was an imaginary red carpet that had been rolled out when we returned. The entire time I was there - I treated like royalty. The concierge helped ease the stress and time limitations. The doormen saved me from the wind. A certain staff memember saved me from forgetting which time zone I was in - and from missing a flight. The bar was fun. Breakfast timely. The only things I missed....a coffee pot and more purple m&m's!!!

review.title: Super
review.reviewText: Highly recommended - not one single negative thing can be said.

review.title: good thing I got a deal
review.reviewText: I was really excited to stay at this hotel. It was supposed to be a 4 star and we got a special deal. I would not go back without another deal. The best things about the room were the bed (really comfortable) and the bath towels (big and fluffy). The room was clean and the cleaning people were friendly. What we couldn't figure out was why the room had a bose ipod dock, but the tv was an 18 in. screen that you could barely see from the bed. The prices for the "extras" were ridiculous. You would think that in an expensive hotel they would be more generous with their guests. The weight room was decent, but not "state of the art" as they called it. The biggest draw back was the service at the hotel. The cleaning people were the friendliest out of all of the staff at the hotel. At the front desk, when we came in early to see if we could get in early, the first two people were very unhelpful. The third finally helped us, but that was 6 hours later. One night when we came in late, people were lined up for the bar/club and the doorman was extremely rude as he demanded our room keys before we could go up to our rooms. Mostly the staff acted like they would only really like you if you looked trendy and rich. I would say about 50% of the staff was helpful. All in all, it was a decent hotel, but I would not stay again if I had to pay full price.

review.title: Hotel as Art at its best
review.reviewText: The most impressive thing about the hotel is its lobby, bar and numerous, unique, work-of-art chairs. Just for those reasons, if for nothing else, the hotel is worth staying in. The location is great, a 5-minute walk to Union Square. The rooms are clean and bright, with wall-size mirrors on the opposite walls, while the rest of the hotel is very dark, which creates an intimate atmosphere ANY time of the day. The washrooms, however, are a bit small (not for anyone with clastrophobic tendencies). Overall, this is a perfect hotel for the trendy, and the artsy, in a great location!

review.title: Chic and lovely...
review.reviewText: Just a very elegant and chic hotel. We really wanted to find a cool, central, boutique hotel and Clift certainly delivered. Would recommend to anyone and everyone.

review.title: very hip downstairs and tiny upstairs
review.reviewText: the hotel is cool in the lobby...but stick with the lobby...the rooms are soooo small and I could barely shut the bathroom door when i was in it...

review.title: Would definitely stay again
review.reviewText: My sister and I recently stayed at the Clift in San Francisco and had a wonderful time. We are both in our mid-late twenties and the hotel definitely had a young, fun vibe. The staff was very friendly and made us feel taken care of. Our room was nice too. Much larger than I was expecting and very comfortable. I like things neat and simple, so the room was perfect with its few but functional furnishings. Everything was impecably clean an I loved the fixtures in the bathroom.The common areas were also very cool and atmospheric. Much different from your typical hotel. The Clift's location right downtown is great too - many nice restaurants, galleries and shopping are right at your door. We visited the Redwood Room on both nights of our stay for drinks and really enjoyed it. We would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to anyone looking for a cool place to stay in teh heart of San Fran!

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Very satisfactory which I would expect from the Morgans Hotel group.

review.title: Poor choice!
review.reviewText: No courtesy coffee in the room, no blow drier, very small TV...nice decor but extremely overpriced. There are much better hotels in SF!

review.title: Perfect again!
review.reviewText: This was the second time I spent 7 days at the Clift and it was awesome again! The mgr remembered me from my first stay which was impressive. Very clean, location is wonderful, service is great and the hotel environment is trendy enough to remind me of staying in South Beach. The Clift has become my official spot when conducting business in SF.

review.title: Great location and ambiance
review.reviewText: Rooms are big ans refurnished. The lobby bar is awsome and always with good ambiance and service.

review.title: A great city break hotel
review.reviewText: A piece of urban chic in one of the best places in the world. Everything was of the highest order and only two blocks from Union Square

review.title: Do not stay on weekends
review.reviewText: The special price was excellent however there is a very popular Bar called the Redroom Room which requires Guest verification each time you enter on Friday and Saturday nights. The room key is insufficent -they use a print out to see if you are a guest -waited 15 minutes in the cold to be verified. A club should not impact guests -I was delayed several times.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel lobby and restaurant are fabulous and very uniquely decorated. The restaurant and lounge were always hopping as these are popular even with the locals. The room was a bit small but that is to be expected in these older renovated hotels. The room amenities were very nice. I would definately stay here again.

review.title: Great trendy hotel
review.reviewText: Very stylish but also comfortable, good sized rooms and a massive bed. The location was good for central SF. There was a slight feeling of being charged for lots of extras that other hotels may give for free - WIFI, bottled water, sewing kits etc

review.title: Mini Bar Charges
review.reviewText: Be aware of the extortionate charges for items in the Mini Bar. Bottle of Water (75ml) $10.00

review.title: Hip, comfortable, clean and super friendly staff!
review.reviewText: There's no denying this hotel scores high in hip factor. From the cool decor with the giant chair and fireplace in the lobby to the Redwood Room with its 'oggling' digital art. The accomodations and staff are top class. Highly recommended for the contemporary business traveler or couple looking for a unique experience in the City.

review.title: Excellent hotel, you get for what you pay for!
review.reviewText: This is a superb quality hotel for those who like a funky kind of luxury. The staff is very helpful, cheerful, and with a good sense of humor. The hotel is lush and very nice on the senses. This is a wonderful place to have a romantic retreat, but also very good for a business visit, if you can afford it. Note, the restaurant looks super, but both the bar and the restaurant are VERY expensive, even for SF standards. However, given the quality and ambiance of the digs, I can see why.

review.title: Not super excited but I enjoyed.
review.reviewText: I enjoyed how comfortable the bed is, it was perfect and very big. My room was plain but very relaxing and stylish. The only real issue I has was with the shower, it was like a whirlwind. The curtain flying everywhere and no matter what I did making a big puddle of water on the floor. Do not think it is meant to be like that. Otherwise the bathrooms are a very nice, small but nice. The modern style of this hotel is very relaxing.

review.title: Dazzling to the eye.
review.reviewText: The hotel is amazing, the whole place is full of character. From the lobby's intersting and varied chairs, to the bar behing the redwood room, with what looks like it houses every spirit ever made. My room was lovely, with the biggest bed i've ever seen, with two giant ceiling to floor mirror, and a stylish all be it cozy bathroom. Everything was clean and tidy. The CD alarm clock came in useful and so did the air-con. Was very pleased to find a safe in my room as well as an ironing board, iron and hair-dryer. As the hotel has a swanky restaurant attached i pleasently suprised by the hotel roomservice, which offered some great food, and there's a priority service for guests if they want to eat in the restaurant itself. The staff were very helpful doing wat you'd expect of the opening doors cleaning rooms etc. But the comlimentary nightly turndown service was fantastic to come back to of an evening, making your room feel invitinng and helping you get ready for bed. Some things I did find slightly annoying were that the walls did at times seem a little thin and the tabtop curtains let a lot of light in as they don't completely close.
