They let in a line of light where they meet, the blind was also hard to use. Other than that it was an amazing trip and an incredible hotel. Would definately stay there agan and would reccoment to everyone who likes a bit of style and design in their hotel experience.

review.title: Excellent Service
review.reviewText: We were most impressed with the quality of service and how accomodating the staff were. The computer/internet in the hotel's Business Centre was unable to process our attempt to purchase theatre tickets. When we explained the situation to the staff at the front desk, the Concierge helped us to get the tickets. They were unable to reverse the charge for using the Business Centre's internet (which was quite expensive) but they provided us with 2 complimentary breakfasts and 2 complimentary drinks at the lounge. While the overall ambience & decor of the hotel is beautiful & eclectic, the size of the room & bathroom was small.

review.title: Very disappointed
review.reviewText: We were very disappointed with our room. The bed was extremely uncomfortable. The mattress was the hardest mattress I've ever experienced in a hotel. I actually considered sleeping on the floor. The room was cramped and uncomfortable. The TV was too small. The bathroom was also very small and there was very little room to put our toiletries. On top of that the bathroom tub didn't drain very well. While showering we stood in 6 inches of dirty water. The service in the hotel lobby was slow and unpredictable. After having drinks we waited an unusually long time to get our bill. Basically they provided poor service to their patrons. We will never stay at the Clift again.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: The hotel itself and staff a wonderful. The first room we were put in was so small and the elevator sound was horrible. The desk clerk did up grade us to a suite which was beautiful. The problem was the walls are so thin you were keep up till all hours hearing all the private business of your nieghbor. If they insulated or made the walls thicker I would highly recomend. Due to this problem I would not return.

review.title: Can't Sleep In San Francisco
review.reviewText: The room was small, not quite what I had expected but what really set the tone was the loud noise coming from the Hallways as boisterous guests get in at 2:30 in the morning. Couple that with a Fire Alarm that goes off with a possible evacuation, at 3:00 a.m. and I would never stay here again. I would gladly spend more then to have to face this onerous night again. When I checked out and mentioned the horrible evening, there was no attempt by the Hotel to make allowances for the miserable night, a terse "I'm sorry" from the female receptionist was the only compensation provided for by this place.

review.title: Great location, clean, but small rooms
review.reviewText: My wife and I just stayed a week at the Clift for a combination business/leisure trip. They initially put us in a small, dark room on the 3rd floor where we ended up riding out the 5.6 earthquake and later that evening a lot of thumping bass from the disco below during their Halloween party. Next morning we complained about the noise and requested a room higher up and the hotel delivered, moving us to a Jr. suite on the 13th floor at no additional charge and also throwing in two free breakfast vouchers. The hotel is clean, recently remodeled and decorated in a spartan "Euro" style, but the rooms are quite small. However, the fantastic location just blocks from Union Square more than compensates, and the friendliness and attentiveness of the staff is a big plus.

review.title: Great hotel, great location.
review.reviewText: The Clift hotel is perfectly located near Union Square. It is a beautiful hotel with great service and the best thing is that it is located near many attractions that are walking distance. Great City, Great Hotel, would recommend it.

review.title: CLIFT IS AMAZING!
review.reviewText: I stayed at the clift in September 2007 and it was FANTASTIC!! I went with a friend to SanFrancisco, it was our first time to the west coast and we absolutely loved it! The clift is gorgeous, clean and very chic! our beds were soo comfy and they were changed daily. The bathroom was really clean, a little small, but perfect for us 2. The shower had great water pressure. The robes were great too. The staff was very friendly. The concierge was great at facilitating our tours. The housekeeping was fast, we requested a bucket of ice each day for drinks we bought at the walgreens (right across the street). The hotels restaurant, ASIA DE CUBA is MUST! its expensive, but very large portions are served and the food was DELICIOUS! Its a Cuban/Asian styled menu; We are of Cuban descent and I can tell you the food was excellent! We had 2 entrees, 2 cocktails and an appetizer for about $70.00 each. We had plenty of left overs and the next day, housekeeping gave us a microwave so we could heat up our food at no charge!!! The doormen were also very friendly and knowledgeable about where to go for dinner/breakfast etc. Redwood Room is a HOT SPOT, great drinks and atmosphere. Note: all nightlife closes at 2am! Beware of many beggars on the streets, we found that they're harmless though. We will definitely come back to THE CLIFT! Totally worth the money! If you have time, visit the ACT Theatre (right down the stree) and see what shows you can catch. We saw Sweeney Todd, and it was amazing!

review.title: Will definitely return
review.reviewText: The hotel was very convenient for the Moscone center and nightly activities. Excellent food from room service. Somewhat small room and underwhelming tub, but otherwise very nice decor. Room was fresh and clean. Very safe and comfortable. Highly recommend!

review.title: Very cool
review.reviewText: Great service, loveley room TINY bathroom

review.title: The Clift is TIRED
review.reviewText: The quality of our room was poor. The furniture and was poorly made and everything was just plain cheap. The temperature in the room was hard to control. It took three hours working with on-site technician to get connected to the internet. The food from room service wasn't that hot... Overall I would give it a 4 out of 10. The one good thing was the water pressure in the shower - it was great.

review.title: Great hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: The lobby is large and comfortable. The bar and restaurant were always busy even though we did not try them. The room was not large but the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was small. The front desk and concierge were outstanding. They booked tours for us, recommended restaurants, made reservations and were very helpful. The hotel is a few blocks from Union Square and is centrally located to many tourist attractions and restaurants.

review.title: Don't bring anything you want to put in a drawer...
review.reviewText: As there aren't any! You get a couple of 'cubes' to stuff your belongings in, but there isn't a drawer to be found in any of the rooms in the hotel. I stayed at the Clift with my mother, and after we'd gotten to our rooms, I was very grateful we'd each booked our own room. I was lucky, at least the area around the sink was large enough I could lay my makeup out. My mother wasn't as lucky - about 3 inches around the sink, and that was it. Other than those two things, the hotel is fine - staff is very friendly and helpful, beds are spacious and comfy, rooms are kept clean (although previous coffee stains in the carpet were not removed). Great for a weekend visit, as you could cope with the lack of storage when you only have a couple of days worth of clothing to deal with.

review.title: Awesome Hotel!
review.reviewText: This is truly the best place to stay in San Francisco!! We stayed at the Clift from 9/14-9/19 & we truly couldn't ask for more. The hotel is gorgeous, chic and elegant. We absolutely loved it. Checkin was a breeze, the rooms were small but great, super clean. The bed was super comfortable and they even iron your sheets!!! The restaurant downstairs Asia de Cuba was excellent. Its a sharing menu so we had plenty of left overs & the next day room service provided us with a microwave so that we could heat up our left overs. The staff is very professional and helpful. Always referring to you by your last name and very willing to accomadate any needs you might have. The same goes for the concierge service who helped us book our tours. The location of the hotel is one of its best assets. Its 2 blocks from Union Square where there are a bunch of theatres and restaurants. We had some of the best breakfast ever!! YOU MUST GO TO DOTTIES TRUE BLUE CAFE! We also got tickets to the ACT theatre (right next door) and saw Sweeney Todd (a must see!)- if you're into muscials. Alcatraz is a must see (try to book ahead of time for the night tour) and also the Adventure Cat catamaran bay cruise was great as well. Hope this review helps!! Clift is definitely worth the $!!!

review.title: Pleasantly surprised...
review.reviewText: This hotel is beautiful inside and has a very friendly staff from top to bottom. We had a great time here celebrating my best friend's b'day & I can't wait to come back to SF to stay at The CLIFT again!

review.title: Cant wait to go back in 2 months...
review.reviewText: This hotel has great service, is in a wonderful location surrounded by lots of shopping and restaurants. I didnt have one complaint. I stayed for a full week and it was wonderful. I will be going back to SF in 2 months and will be staying here again. Room was thoroughly cleaned everyday and the lobby atmosphere is lovely. This hotel has an art deco feel to it just like the lovely ones in Miami that I love to visit. It really couldnt have been any better. Not sure what someone would complain about. Wireless internet came in handy. Wonderful hotel!!

review.title: Would not go back or recommend
review.reviewText: The rooms are VERY small. The bathrooms are the size of an airline bathroom. The rooms do not warrant the price ticket they are getting. The decor is very modern and cold. The location is convenient for the theater district, however; I would not stay or recommend this hotel to a friend.

review.title: Triple AAA all around.
review.reviewText: Very hip. Very clean. Big rooms. Clean rooms. Bar is great. And, very good price, as well.

review.title: Exciting style of the hotel, loved it and will return...
review.reviewText: A beautiful hotel with a very nice location....

review.title: Very Cool!
review.reviewText: The Clift is very well done. The music, the ambiance, the feel. It was a warm fun place to relax after seeing SF. The only thing that was a bit much was the price of food and wine at the Redwood room.

review.title: Classy place to stay in SF
review.reviewText: A great place to stay in a great city. The place has a real impact as soon as you walk in - clearly a lot of thought has gone into the design of the public spaces and the bedrooms. Rooms are a reasonable size, so you're not tripping over things each time you move. The reception staff and doormen are very friendly, and add to the general un-stuffy atmosphere. We even had the hotel bar recommended to us by a couple of locals that we met, which must be a good sign. The location is great - just a couple of blocks from the main shopping area of Union Square (Macy's, Tiffany, Saks), and also close to end of the cable cars to Fisherman's Wharf. Definitely a place I would return to if I visit the city again.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Highly recommend the Clift. Upon check-n our room was not available so we were upgraded to a jnr suite. Very nice. Clean room, clean bathroom. The rooms are very cool and funky. The only thing missing a coffee maker. Bottle open is there and the hair dryer is there, just look.

review.title: to expensive
review.reviewText: beautiful lobby and nice service.But too expensive. I had to even pay for ice. Yikes.Iwould not go back but to have a drink in the bar.

review.title: Perfect for the Young Busines Professtional
review.reviewText: The Clift is a great hotel with a contemporary atmosphere, dark lobby and bar,catering to the younger business professional. Rooms are small but comfortable and well appointed.

review.title: great
review.reviewText: Fantastic Hotel. Loved it!

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: The Clift hotel was great. It was my first time staying at this hotel, and I was definitely impressed. I plan on staying at the Clift on any future trips to San Francisco. All the staff was helpful, courteous, and super friendly. I had arrived in the city very early in the morning and had planned on just dropping off my bags there until check-in time at 3pm. Surprisingly, they had a room ready for me when I arrived. Also, the Redwood Room at the hotel was very fun.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: I was only there for 10 hours, but it was a very pleasant stay.

review.title: San Francisco Hippest Hotel
review.reviewText: Fantastic Hotel in a fantastic city. When we come back we will stay here every time.

review.title: Grand end to the Honeymoon
review.reviewText: Stayed here on the final part of our 5 stop USA Honeymoon, for 4 nights on the 26th May. Just loved everything about the Clift. Friendly staff, fantastic room, style to die in every part of the hotel. Really couldn't fauit the Clift and would hope to be able to go back someday.

review.title: Cool... but small rooms!
review.reviewText: We stayed here for two nights on our honeymoon. It was great, cool, good food, but didn't quite feel right. The rooms were small with very little storage space and almost everything carried an additional charge. Not bad... but you could probably stay somewhere better for the cost of the rooms but still come for drinks and dinner!).

review.title: Great experience. good location. excellent staff
review.reviewText: Clift was awesome. modern done right. Redwood Room really is cool, and beautiful. Asia de Cuba restaurant was very good, but you pay a lot for it. We had a great stay, and will go back. Very convenient location, and we were able to walk everywhere, or take cable car from 2 blocks away. Highly recommend.

review.title: Nice hotel, not nice rooms
review.reviewText: Its a very modern hotel, the lobby, restaurant and bar were so nice, but dont expect the same when you go up to your room, you may be dissapointed, our room was tiny and the bathroom besides being small it had no toiletries, and some amenities that supposed to be free you may get them charged if you used them.

review.title: Great Hotel - Great Location
review.reviewText: I really enjoyed my stay at the CLIFT hotel. I was a very modern, very cool hotel with super friendly staff and it was a very close walk to Town Square, which was an added plus. The bed was nice, but to me it was a bit hard. The rooms are small, but the mirrors make it feel comfortable. Since most of the time we were out site seeing and shopping, we didn't mind that the room was small. The bar downstairs is very hip, but we are in our early 20s and the crowd was definitely a bit older, so we didn't end up spending our nights there. Overall, it's a great stay and I recommend that couples and singles stay here. It's not the best place for a family, I would imagine.

review.title: Fresh & Beautiful
review.reviewText: Each time I check in to the Clift, I am confident the room will be fresh and clean. We have friends in the area and always make a point of inviting them up to the room, partly to show it off but mostly because we know we can all enjoy each other in such a lovely setting.

review.title: Would love to stay again
review.reviewText: The Clift is a surprisingly lovely, contemporary hotel with ideal location. The hotel service was outstanding, the cleanliness was superb, and the overall experience was excellent. Although, the room was slightly small, it was very accomodating and lovely. My wife and I would love to stay at The Clift again when visiting San Fransicso. We may just get a bigger room.

review.title: Clift Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is not the traditional "fancy" hotel, but that was good for us (ages 22 and 24). We checked in around 7 pm, and the place looked like a club, with people dressed up and walking around the lobby that connects to the restaurant and bar. Room service is expensive as well as the restaurant. I recommend eating at the restaurant and skipping room service.. it was sort of bad. The rooms are smaller than average, but the bathroom had a good table for storage. The service was really good, although be prepared to prove you're a hotel guest if you come in later than 10 on the weekends.. and to battle the line in front of the hotel.

review.title: IKEA not Chic!
review.reviewText: I was extremely disappointed with this hotel. For the high ratings of the CLIFT, I was extremely disappointed. The IKEAesc furniture is not what I anticipate when I got to a nice hotel. We had a deluxe room which was small (I can't imagine the size of a standard room). There was about a 19 inch TV in the room (not that we watched it much, but that is unacceptable). The mini bar was overpriced and had condoms in it which I think should be reserved for a hotel that rents by the hour. All in all, I would not recommend this hotel. There are many other suitable hotels in the area.

review.title: Trendy and clean
review.reviewText: The Clift has a very cool ambience. It has a very happening nightclub but noise was not a problem in the rooms. The bed was the most comfortable I have ever experienced in a hotel! I had the best nights of sleep while traveling ever. The room was quite small but stylish and very clean. It is close to all kinds of shopping.

review.title: Outstanding !
review.reviewText: The hotel is ultra-chic -- the room, luminous and subdued simultaneously (with cavernous ceiling height.the service: impeccable (from the front desk, housekeeping, bell staff, etc.). An enlightening SF experience.

review.title: too hip, trendy and dark for our taste
review.reviewText: Unless you're under 35 yrs. of age, there are other hotels in the area more comfortable that cater to your needs. The lobby and other main areas are extremely dark 24/7, the bathrooms incredibly small, little space for your toiletries, no chest of drawers or shelves to put anything away, but other than that, the room was nice and no street noise. Bedding was lovely, but I think the lucite end tables could have been upgraded to something nicer. Next time we'll stay somewhere less "hip and trendy" and some place that caters to creature comforts. The Redwood Bar is great but too crowded with non-hotel guests nightly. The doorman checking people going in to the bar on weekends was very rude even when we told him we were hotel guests. We certainly didn't look the type that was going to "crash" the bar scene.

review.title: Very swanky and comfortable
review.reviewText: I stayed at the Clift while attending a conference at the convention center. It was not my style - very swanky and hip - but the room was interesting and comfortable. The location was awesome - very easy walking distance to Union Square and the Moscone Center, with plenty of restaurants and shops nearby. The only real drawback was that the walls seemed kind of thin. I could hear the people above me walking around and heard voices in the halls, even when people just seemed to be speaking at a normal conversational level. But for the location and the oh-so-comfy bed, I would stay there again.

review.title: Rock solid (and kinda fun) hotel
review.reviewText: I have stayed at the Clift several times and would not hesitate to recommend it. The location is excellent - two blocks west of Union Square. Near enough to be convenient, but on a relatively quiet street. Service is outstanding. The hotel itself has a funky, fun decor that actually works. Terrific bar scene and a good restaurant. The rooms, while clean, well decorated and comfortable, can be a bit small - though this is a fact of life in California. Good place.

review.title: Can't wait to go back,
review.reviewText: Nice trendy hotel, exelent location, red room best bar in town, would like a bit larger bathrom.

review.title: Nice Place, Great Locale
review.reviewText: They had our room ready when we arrived at 11AM (we had called ahead and asked for early check-in). Staff was very friendly and helpful. Bathroom was tiny, but clean. Bed and pillows were comfortable. We had a nice stay at the Clift and would return.

review.title: Just Fantastic !!!
review.reviewText: We have enjoyed many stays at the "Clift".We have tried several other hotels in Union Square Area but none of them have the welcoming feeling and fantastic bar/lobby area. We will be back soon.

review.title: Always happy at the Clift
review.reviewText: This was our third stay and we were satisfied as always. The location is great and it is a fun place to stay.

review.title: Hip, fun, great location
review.reviewText: concierge too busy, rooms can be small

review.title: Hip Hotel for Hipsters
review.reviewText: Loved the cozy living room in the lobby. Met a close friend and lazed around the comfy sofas there. It felt very intimate, even though the lobby was bustling. Dinner at the restaurant brought us great Asian/Cuban food, and there's a posh lounge called the Redwood Room - try the pomegranate martini. The decor seems fresh and quirky, and the location is central. This is a hip hotel.

review.title: Great Trendy Hotel in Union Square
review.reviewText: The hotel was very trendy and luxurious with a distinct decorating style. It's dimly lit, moody, and the lobby is punctuated with eclectic furnishings. The room was smaller than we were accustomed to, but seeing as everything is on top of everything else in San Francisco, it was to be expected. It's not uncomfortably small, but don't be surprised if it's smaller than rooms in other cities. All of the hotels rooms are small in the city. The room was well decorated with several mirrors and a huge bed with fabulous sheets and pillows. We slept extremely well every night. Some other reviews have mentioned a noise issue in the rooms. The walls aren't thin, we never heard our neighbors, but we could hear several sounds from the hallway through the door. Don't stay near the Wharf ... it's a total tourist trap. You have to see it at least once while you're there, but don't stay near it. The CLIFT was in a great section of Union square; just don't walk 2 or 3 blocks south... you'll be in the Tenderloin district - scary place, even during the day.

review.title: Fun and Modern
review.reviewText: The location was wonderful. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Don't rent a car- you won't use it. The valet prices are also very high everywhere in San Francisco, including the Clift. The room was cozy with a wonderful view, but was only large enough for my boyfriend and I, and it was still a pretty tight fit. Overall the trip was a success and I got engaged on a Hornblower Cruise, which I would definitely recommend.

review.title: Great style, at chain hotels price
review.reviewText: The most significant feature of the hotel is the ambience. Every detail is taken care of. The room provides not only TV but also your own dvd and cd players. Priority entrance to the popular Redwood Room Bar is also a great perk of staying here.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: Customer service level is lacking for a hotel in this price range.

review.title: Great hotel, great location!
review.reviewText: This is a very nice and trendy hotel. The bar in the lounge is a great place to be and be seen.

review.title: Very Impressed
review.reviewText: Very Impressed with service (quick and courteous). Hotel very well situated, walking distance to Union Square (shopping district). The Hotels Restaurant (Asia de Cuba), Bar & lounge (Redwood Room) are very nice, the places to be. Hands down one of San Francisco's best hotel experiences.

review.title: These guys are good...
review.reviewText: The staff was extremely efficient, I've never seen anything quite like it. I'm an avid traveler and good service can be hard to come by. Very clean too.

review.title: Very impressed with the CLIFT hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel within walking distance to all the shops in Union Square. Rooms are trendy and comfortable. Young crowd in the lobby bar area. Very fun atmosphere.

review.title: Very nice
review.reviewText: Becareful with the shower. Views are beautiful. Starbucks is walking distance.

review.title: Different for a reason
review.reviewText: This is the most unique hotel experience I've ever had, and I've stayed at a lot of four/five star hotels over the years in many countries and places. The service is impeccable, the food in the Asia de Cuba restaurant is impeccable and the rooms, though a little smaller than what you might find in other similarly priced hotels, are simple, but the beds are very comfortable. I was very well rested, even after getting only a few hours sleep. Also, very cool lounge, connected to the restaurant, with some of the most interesting and comfortable ambiance, decor, crowd. I recommend the hotel even if you're not staying there.

review.title: An enjoyable experience in San Francisco
review.reviewText: There were several previous reviews regarding less than stellar service, noisy rooms, etc... however we did not find that to be the case. All of the employees, from the front desk to the doormen at the front were always friendly and eager to assist. Yes, there isn't a big neon sign out front, but that is the point. The location is perfect, close enough to Union Square, but far enough that it doesn't feel touristy.

review.title: Great location - room not so great
review.reviewText: Clift offered a great bar/restaurant and excellent service with knowledgeable concierges. The room was small, as expected, but the bathroom was extremely small and uncomfortable. With an industrial toilet and a flimsy fabric shower curtain that clung during showers, the "4 stars" seemed undeserved. It's a great location off Union Square with a great bloody mary at the bar, but not so luxurious when it comes to the accomodations.

review.title: Fun, Funky decor makes the place
review.reviewText: If you are a standard, big-chain hotel type...you need to try the Clift for something completely different! It has all the upscale service, cleanliness and amenities you'd expect from the big guys, but it has a funky charm the others lack. I'm a fussy traveller; I don't deal well with "smoky" non-smoking rooms, poor customer service, stained or shabby bathrooms, bedspreads, furniture...and for an older hotel, I was pleasantly surprised to find none of that! White down bedspread, minimalist furnishing that added to the charm, crisp, clean feel to everything. I loved the giant, oversized chair/art in the lobby, the lavender walls in the hallways and rooms, the purple, red & green lighted elevators and dark, dramatic alcoves where you could relax with a cocktail after work or sightseeing. The restaurant, Asia de Cuba, was pretty nice; a little overpriced and trendy, but the food was fantastic. This was my first trip to San Francisco. It won't be the last, and I'll stay at the Clift again.

review.title: Recommendation would depend on the age of the potential visitor
review.reviewText: The hotel now is a trendy place for the younger adults. The service was good and the staff very professional, but it was obvious the hotel now caters to the 40ish age group. We asked to stay there based upon several prior stays when the hotel was under different management. The room is now too small and the lighting in the bathroom is too poor to use for makeup application. Neither is there storage space in the bathroomm.

review.title: Room Size
review.reviewText: Rooms are quite small. Other than that, nice place to stay.

review.title: Can't wait to go back!
review.reviewText: This hotel should be a 5 star! The pillows are like clouds, the white decor - peaceful, the service - top quality!

review.title: Typical Ian Schrager Hotel
review.reviewText: Good thing we had upgraded to a deluxe room --- not large, but adequate

review.title: Exceptional experience.
review.reviewText: A wonderful stay with exceptional service and beautiful and well appointed accommodations. Would most definitely stay here again.

review.title: wonderful
review.reviewText: the best place

review.title: Great service, excellent restaurant, handy location
review.reviewText: I had some trepidation when I entered the lobby and realised I was in another Phillipe Starck hotel -- my experience in London (at their sister hotel)was unhappy but this was much better: comfortable room, extremely attentive staff, and a fantastic restaurant, all within walking distance of Union Square.

review.title: It's all good!
review.reviewText: OK, I'll admit...I prefer trendy, modern, and scene-y. The CLIFT gave me all that and a comfortable room too. The check -in was professional and expedient. Like any big city hotel, tipping helps when you want service with a smile. The location was within easy walking distance to everything I wanted to do (and taxi's are readily available if I didn't want to walk). As a former resident of SF, i was able to relive all the finer parts of the City.

review.title: Impressed!
review.reviewText: The service was excellent and the surroundings are beautiful. I would recommend it to anyone, really, except for people with small children as it's a modern, hip, adult kind of place. My only criticism was that the minimalist design left the rooms void of maps and helpful tourist materials. Also, the TV was very small.

review.title: loved the clift...will never stay anywhere else in sf
review.reviewText: the clift was a mixture of modern cutting edge style and old school elegance with incredible service to boot!

review.title: great sheets and atmosphere, not much else
review.reviewText: I travel a lot to San Francisco, this past trip was meant to be a relatively special trip and Clift seemed like a novel choice. The staff is young and sometimes forgets to open the door or offer any other assistance but I'm very young so I expect that. I was wearing a suit when I flew in and they were extremely nice. The location is great, 24 hour parking around the corner and a short walk to Union Square. The front lobby is lively in the evenings but the hustle and bustle is left behind once you reach the elevators. Once you reach your floor, if you encounter any of the housekeeping staff they're friendly, but maybe that's because I'm asian. My room was clean, lots of fresh towels and amenities, and the sheets were amazing. The only issue I had was the lack of privacy, the walls are not paper thin, but the doors between the rooms and out into the hall tend to be an inch or more off the ground. A family was next door and I ended up stuffing the bottom of the door with a towel. My particular room had thick curtains you could draw to diminish hallway and bathroom noise. The windows, although in need of a bit of cleaning (I can't imagine they would clean it every day being 15 floors up) Opened up to an amazing view at night. All in all it was amazing for a one time stay, if I were to look for the same level of accomodation the next time I stay, I think I might be able to find better for the same amount of money.

review.title: A Very Hip Hotel
review.reviewText: The Clift will appeal to a particular type of traveler. One who appreciates the style of a boutique hotel. The rooms are not particularly large but they do have very comfortable beds. You will find some quirks like a light switch behind a door or tiny little TV, but the overall ambiance of the hotel more than makes up for this minor annoyances. I doubt this hotel would appeal to families or those looking for opulence or luxury, but those who want a fun and hip hotel should be pleased.

review.title: Techno is not chic
review.reviewText: Only negative is the lobby background music - technopop/electronica. Can't this genre just die? Nobody really gets excited about this music. It is not really that HIP. Great central location.

review.title: most chic in SF
review.reviewText: besides being a nice place to stay, the Clift has a great bar and restaurant.

review.title: Very Posh
review.reviewText: Modern, clean, cool

review.title: You should reconsider........
review.reviewText: It is a modern style hotel. The lobby and hall way are very dark. Many hotel staffs are young people without having experience as a professional. Non hotel guests dine at the restaurant and extremly laud in the lobby at night. Deco of the rooms are not so great. I stayed at Suite room but plastic table, very small bath room and two 14 " TV did not impress me. I don't think I want stay at Clift again.

review.title: Hip only goes so far.
review.reviewText: The Clift fancies itself on being a hip hotel. This it delivers in spades, but if you are looking for comfort, helpful staff without attitudes and value; look elsewhere. Basic services for the business traveler are also lacking with hopelessly slow in room internet (for which they charge) to lack of irons and boards in the rooms (reason: the rooms are too small to accomodate them).

review.title: Too Cool
review.reviewText: Really enjoyed my stay and usage of the Clift. Rooms are not large but certainly clean and functional. However, great location and great bar and restaurant. Service was solid and staff was very hip.

review.title: Very posh.
review.reviewText: I did a lot or research on the Internet before choosing this hotel as the location of my 15 year wedding anniversary. I surprised my wife with a weekend getaway to San Franscisco. We loved this hotel, also loved that it has no signage on the outside at all, you just have to know where it is located. The interior was awesome and we were not treated in any way other than politely and professionally by the staff. The hotel was located within a few block of everyting we wanted to do that weekend.

review.title: can't wait to go back...
review.reviewText: ...if only the weather in SF could be great sometime

review.title: love it
review.reviewText: nice louge at the hotel

review.title: Mixed feelings
review.reviewText: The hotel room was a bit small but very clean and comfortable. The shower curtains in the bathroom were so annoying. When you put the shower on, the shower curtain would sway towards you because of an up draft from the exhaust vent. The rooms were cleaned twice a day. The front desk was very helpful. The employees at the Redwood Room were extremely snobby and slow.

review.title: Luxurious Clift
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful relaxing time at our stay at The Clift. The service was great and our room was spacious and clean. The restaurant at the Hotel is a must, where the service is also excellent.

review.title: We love the Clift!
review.reviewText: We were worried the Clift would be a little to ultra-mod for our taste, but found it to have lots of fun touches without sacrificing quality. Comfortable bed, tons of fun mirrors and chairs, and great overall vibe. Too much street noise at night, but I don't blame the hotel for that!

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: The service was great from the door, very friendly and receptive. The entire hotel was great other than a very small room and a very small bathroom, everything else was great.

review.title: Lost some charm
review.reviewText: Cool place but overrated for the money.

review.title: Very Hip
review.reviewText: Very hip crowd - not everyone's scene - the bar downstairs is quite a scene on weekends. Our room was small but comfortable, and the bed was great. It's an interesting change of pace from the big tourist hotels in town.

review.title: Very trendy, excellent service.
review.reviewText:
Went for Easter weekend and really enjoyed my stay.  Hotel restaurant is top notch (get the sangria) and you room service is quick.
Rooms are very chic but a little small.

review.title: Great place to stay.
review.reviewText: The Clift is a great place to stay and located in the heart of the city.

review.title: Money Hungry
review.reviewText: There were a lot of people staying and working at this hotel that gave the impression that they had tons of money.  And maybe they did, however so do I!  That atmosphere was not relaxing.  It was uptight and snooty

review.title: Would LOVE to go back!
review.reviewText: Amazing ambience.  An attraction in itself.

review.title: Love the vibe-
review.reviewText: The Clift is my idea of a perfect hotel for a few days.  Hip touches, hip furniture in the room and lobby and centrally located to the theater and shopping.

review.title: It's a typical Ian Schrager hotel
review.reviewText:
Public areas are very cool & pretty impressive. The actual rooms are beginning to look a bit tired, but are still pretty hip. In typical Schrager style, the room size is on the small side, but you'll still enjoy it anyway.
Note for newcomers to the Clift: the reserved tables in the Redwood Room (ie: their very cool bar) are reserved for hotel guests in general - if one's free and you're a guest, grab it. 
Asia de Cuba, like it's LA conterpart, is a major disappointment. It may be classed as 5 star on the West Coast of the US but compared to London or Sydney restaurant standards, it's well below par.

review.title: Very Cool Decor, Very Cold Service
review.reviewText: Clift has convenient location and its decor is very, very chic.  The Redwood Bar is a very happening place.  The rooms are extremely small, so ask for one on the bigger side.  The biggest downside:  Service was horrible.  Expect to be ignored by staff.

review.title: Hip and Fun
review.reviewText: Great location, great Hotel, great scene!
